HjBmGAPXlTjwLdXXRYv-3Q.text: This place is huge and therefore a good place for groups. I came with a large group on a work trip and we had no issued reserving a last minute table for 15 people. Food was good, nothing was extremely memorable but it's inexpensive standard bar food. Bathrooms were really, really messy.

vNHK8c-eDPDk0BmsJqmQrQ.text: Server was obviously in the weeds. Neglected to greet our table for 15 minutes, we felt very rushed so we hurried and ordered beers which he brought in 5 minutes, then it took another 20 to come back and take our order. Seems like a cool spot, the shit service kind of killed it though.

lpmPzyqF5ZoPtY6vIEywog.text: Went for a late lunch on Feb 13. Had to wait 15 minutes for a table even though there were plenty of vacant tables. Seems they had a shortage of wait staff and then a back up in the kitchen. No biggie - our waitress was nothing short of amazing!  The drinks were cold, recommend trying the flight. And the food was absolutely delicious!  Will definitely go back!  Highly recommend this restaurant for the ambience, cuisine, and service.

SrQMGlFaXy3GaskMVt-hOw.text: Great food & craft beer. My husband is a craft beer guy and he loved the 6 he tried. I went for the food, had the Veggie Burger which had black beans and was amazing! Had the tomato soup as well, interesting, but also good. ONE negative, though- NO WHOLE WHEAT BUNS?! What restaurant doesn't have whole wheat bread alternatives these days?!

BlgtRlsEiA3RDkoC-pHnuw.text: I'll start by saying, I am a server, so I understand and accommodate for certain things being out of a servers hands when it comes to food, and also that a busy night can lead to service being slightly below par. But this day was neither busy or late night. Our server was absolutely horrible. We sat for 10 minutes before even being greeted and when we placed our drink order went another 10 minutes before they even hit the table. A glass of wine, a beer and a water with lemon that was delivered without any lemon. Our server then came back to take our order. We ordered a ribeye, the salmon and chicken tostadas (or whatever they're called) with no crema. We waited for about 20 minutes and finally received our order. WRONG, and delivered to the table behind us. I had to ask if they were they're before they passed them over to us and they had crema. So we sent it back to be remade and after a while they sent us the order back and it was awful. We told the server is was bad and she said she was enjoying the one we sent back and thought it was pretty good. We asked for our check and left. Our servers name was Dana, I believe. She only had two, maybe three tables and the service was beyond slow and is the main reason I won't be back. I brought my friends here earlier in the week and ended up having our entire bill taken care of because the service was so bad. Won't be back.

w1gdEcLwnvdGE6mHD7Y7zQ.text: Rock Bottom has been a graduation tradition for my family for the third year in a row this year. I'm not sure what has happened over the course of this time frame but I'm not sure I've ever been so dissatisfied with service somewhere in my life! To start off, we arrived around 9:30 or so, the hostess proceeded to POINT our party of 6 to a dirty table. One of the employees cleaned it off for us and apologized. We sat down, and for 20 minutes we patiently waited on a server to take our drink order. Nothing. Finally, we asked the bartender for drinks as the table of two behind us left in frustration for the same reason. I suppose message was relayed to our server as we finally got someone to come and take our order. She apologized and said their was a mix up with her coworker. She was a sweet girl and I felt bad for her but at the same time we were one of maybe two or three other tables. Needless to say, when our food arrived 45 minutes later it was cold. After our food arrived our waitress told us they were folding silverware in the back and they didn't have any rolled. So we waited again. We didn't leave until after closing (11pm). By the time we finally left the place was still a wreck. It looked like no one had been bussing for hours, the tables around us were disgusting. I can kindly say we will not be returning. Rock Bottom has officially hit rock bottom.

P3Epbv6zn71giosKfQUHoA.text: Incredibly mediocre. Looking from the outside, I was hoping for so much more. This is the definition of "don't judge a book by its cover". Large portions, but, the taste and everything else with the food is just, MEH.

wRuxfoILjliDsGLFb_e0NA.text: Went here this weekend for lunch and to watch the football games with the family.  It has a great atmosphere and is very clean.  I had the Santa Fe Chicken Salad and a couple of their in house brews.  The salad was excellent and their beers were pretty good as well.  The service was really good, first thing our waiter asked is if there was any game that I wanted to be put on the TV (I think more places should do this) and was extremely helpful through out but not overbearing. I would definitely go here again.

u2oXPt3lZZBZ58gYEpommw.text: Rockbottom? What can I say. Hmmm. Don't throw rotten vegetables at me please. Okay, I'll say it: it felt like an upscale Applebee's.  Everyone was helpful and friendly; we didn't even mind the 20 minute wait (at  5:30 PM?). Did not care for their IPA. I love beer and only drank maybe half - tasted more like a Lager to me. Wife's soup was barely warm but she said the flavor was good. My Santa Fe Ranch Chicken Salad was just okay. Some of the lettuce was a bit limp and slimy. I did like the deep fried Jalapeno rings on top. Our waiter was really good but smelled heavily of cigarettes.  Our glasses never went empty and he even packed up our leftovers and bagged them. I think trying to run a good brewery and restaurant at the same time is a tricky operation. Sometimes one may suffer to highlight the other, or both may be slightly diminished as the operational  focus is spread thin. A-OK but not great. Go at least once and decide for yourself.

2jbK4qmlp_FLRpPjvsgDRg.text: Yummy!   6 of us ventured into this Uptown Charlotte restaurant around 6:30 and I was a little worried that it wasn't very crowded for a Friday night.  We were able to get a table right away.......   And lucky for us....... everyone of us LOVED our dish. I had the Fish and Chips which were made from fresh Haddock perfectly battered and fried.  It was served with an excellent Apple Slaw that awakened the senses in my mouth.   The Commissioner loved his drink and my glass of wine was hearty and full bodied.  His dinner was an excellent adult version of Mac and Cheese with Bacon and Chicken.  As we were leaving the place was starting to get busier and busier. So stop in if you are in the neighborhood.  Well worth a visit.

kJzFypJlKKLfanaPoKK79Q.text: We came on a Thursday and ordered the beer sampler and Southwest egg rolls.   - Happy hour extended! Great Waitress! It ended at 630 but she was kind enough to let it slide.  - Egg rolls taste more like a flauta.  - Sample 6 beers. 3rd one is too hoppy. 1st and last are the best. good deal for $7.  - Lots of TVs. Big party friendly. - Just like SD and SJ.

8Z2GgDDq0sn-NAq9yiRbeQ.text: Great atmosphere and service. The server accidently messed up my order, it happens, I would have been okay with an apology and a little extra haste getting me my correct order. Instead, the manager came out and apologized and proceeded to check up on us the remainder of the night. He hand delivered my correct meal himself and offered us a free dessert of our choice (we got the brownie one), which he personally delivered as well. It was definitely above and beyond, and went a long way with me and my girlfriend. Would definitely go back

G1-6YBg1gg4Z-0oaXxlVqw.text: Came here the other night with my guy after going out on a long planned date night to the hornets spurs game. Originally after the game we had planned on going to our old faithful Thomas street tavern, but we were to tired to continue drinking and just wanted food and bed. Most things were closing up that I suggested along the way until we came upon Rock Bottom. I had never been there and neither had he so we were excited to try something new.   To be honest the whole experience started out wrong so I probably should have gone with my instincts and left right away. We sat ourselves in the bar area we could tell that was the only section open and well no one had come to seat us so sat we did. the server whos name ill keep out of this just because I believe people have bad days and sometimes you cant hide it even at work it happens to the best of us. however she was extremely short and the general impression we received was that she would rather not only be doing anything but serving us but that she genuinely didn't like us for whatever reason. She started by asking if we had been there before we said no she went over the fact that they were a brewery and what would we like to drink. We sampled one of their house beers that was on special that night. I said it was ok and that I would rather have a mixed drink. My guy asked if they had OMB copper on tap, she retorted "no were a brewery we don't have other peoples beer here!" ..... uh ok well then why is miller lite and Newcastle on tap right behind you I ask.. she said well we have a few I guess.... ok...... we then went over the menu and my guy ordered a ribeye well done (much to my dismay and whining about why he was ruining a perfectly good steak... I'm working on him)  I ordered the salmon.   About 5 minutes later our server returns to inform me that they had not necessarily run out of salmon but that at that point in the night they had already put it away (they didn't close for another hour or more) and that she would just get me a menu.. so I ordered a salad that sounded really good it was a smoky tomato and kale salad that I added shrimp to. when the food came out the steak was med rare (me happy my guy not so much) and my salad was a little bowl of lettuce kale and pico de gallo with some sort or spicy aioli for dressing that was really just mostly mayo. yuck. I was starving so at this point I just made do.  my guy asked the server once she came back to please put the steak back on the grill for a little longer since it was not well done. she just grabbed the plate and walked off then brought back his broccoli to eat without his steak so that "he had something to eat while he waited" she came back about 1 min and a half later with a steak that looked like had been gotten out of the dumpster, I mean it wasn't it was his but it had been microwaved into next year. This is not hard to tell folks and for my guy it was just an insult he cooks for a living and I served for 11 years its pretty much a huge screw you mr customer I could care less about your experience here with us.  He asked for more sauce since they microwaved it she brought it didn't say anything didn't ask how it turned out then once we asked for the check before she brought it she asked how everything was I said OK to be nice but try to get the point across she looked down at the plate she picked up rolled her eyes and walked off without another word.  A few minutes later brought the check for 50 bucks on food I would have been so much better off not eating.   I know this was a long review but to end all I can say is when walking uptown and thinking about places to eat for dinner, pass this place up and try one of the other wonderful places uptown like ruths chris or capital grill.  I really wish I had just gone with Thomas street and next time given limited options well just be ordering pizza or hitting a drive through or just not eating. Everything about this place turned me off which is a shame I hate unhappy reviews.

mc7hp49JSX2uie6h_vWhEA.text: Came for dinner with my boyfriend and sat at the bar. It was a great atmosphere on a Thursday night. We ordered the chorizo and cotija pretzel bites as an app and they were delicious, we had just wishes there were more of them! It came with six small pretzel bites and a jalapeno mustard dipping sauce - so good! I ordered the RB Ale Chicken. It was delicious. It came with cheddar and green chili mashed potatoes (amazing) and veggies (equally as amazing). My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried chicken (also delicious). He subbed the apple coleslaw for the mac and cheese. The ma and cheese tasted so much better than it looked. I always expect mac and cheese to look creamy and cheesy, but this looked almost dry when it came out. But, when we tasted it, we were totally wrong for judging it by its looks. It tasted rich and cheesy and was topped with parmesan breadcrumbs.   Our entrees took a little longer than expected to come out, but we didn't even notice since we were having such a great time. The bartender who was serving us noticed this, and gave us a free dessert without us complaining or asking which we were very grateful for! We got the brownie sundae but ordered a half order of it since the whole thing normally comes with four brownies. Half of the portion was still too much! But it was amazing! Will definitely be back :)

lRkELJzrtAOvHAFafOW_oA.text: Ordered one of their burgers recently, however was unimpressed- by size, flavor, and overall quality.  Seemed like a regular cheeseburger I could have ordered from cook out for a third of the price. This was a fourth visit and each time the quality in food and service seems to decline a little more. But the beers are good!

UlCtGwIBZF95m8ZOdvxFgw.text: Beer: Just Ok Service: Timely and friendly Food: My expectations were a bit higher. I ordered the Cajun fish tacos. (Highly recommended by the bar staff) More lettuce than fish, to much of the sauce, came with rice that was not fully cooked, along with beans that were cold and topped with chopped chives. Overall the tacos tasted like something from Taco Bell and the sides were all I could salvage of the meal. Friend had a chicken sandwich that was clearly re-heated chicken, stale bun, one slice of avocado and soggy fries.   Apparently people love this place. I'd come back to have a beer and an appetizer but probably stay away from the rest of the menu. Over priced and overrated!

zOf9BU0nMV2ehKkrlts0EA.text: Great lunch!  Sat at the bar - busy spot - they have lots of take out orders. Bartender do an ok job keeping up. Salad was delish!  A little too much arugula , so I removed some and it was better. Will look forward to coming back next visit to Charlotte

VDugrEySCtaP1PL_FspZHA.text: Didn't enjoy the food at all. Cocktails and beer were very bland and didn't taste good at all. Nice atmosphere and the inside is really cute!

OsG2Asw6OLkcP29N8Sxt8g.text: I have been to this place twice now, the first time leaving with the entire meal comped because of the crappy service. Last night I went in there with eight of my family members and we had to wait 30 minutes to get a drink we had one then left . Manager didn't seem to care so I can assure you we will not be spending $300 twice a month there anymore

El6quoewifJ1QzrwPgt_Ng.text: Rock Bottom Brewery is decent bet for food and drinks in Uptown.  While I haven't had a bad dish or poor service, Rock Bottom seems to be a variation on a theme: a classy Americana pub with dressed up pub fare and dark paneling.    I agree with Stephen K.'s summary of Rock Bottom but there are some highlights to the menu.  I've had a pretty awesome quesadilla and enchiladas to the tune of $12-14 and a hearty pick-your-own toppings cheeseburger.  I love carbs, so in this aspect, Rock Bottom does not dissapoint.  The chicken fingers are so-so.  However, the fries evoke memories of your middle school cafeteria (thin cut and taste like veggie oil).  The staff are very friendly and professional; they actually make sure you're doing OK unlike wait staff at most sports bars.  I've never been treated rudely or indifferently here-I would vouch for the service any day.  What then, is the "selling point" of Rock Bottom.  Duh, location!  The outdoor seating gives view to a long stretch of Tryon St.  Rock Bottom is an awesome place to people-watch or grab a reasonable meal before launching an evening Uptown.  Rock Bottom is casual but not trashy, a pub that resorts to being a sports bar, and a stopping point but not a destination. If you've exhausted your rotation of Uptown restaurants and hangouts, at least add Rock Bottom to your list.

qaD2nT5aaGk4RAS5p5-xbQ.text: I ate here for brunch today. I had the three meat omelet. I thought it was pretty good. Portion sizes were pretty big as I suspected they would be. Service was pretty good too. We arrived shortly after they opened and were the only customers I believe for the first few minutes. I've eaten at Rock Bottoms in different cities and enjoyed my experiences with them each time. I would recommended this location. As an extra bonus they validated our parking which is always a bonus!

5sDZBKQLs8CE6GmGFti9Ow.text: My girlfriend and I were part of a friend's birthday party of about 12 adults on a Thursday night. It was not especially crowded (no wait) and we had reservations. 1. Nobody took our drink orders or brought us water for over 20minutes. 2. When they brought out all the appetizers, ours was not among them, because it was never put in. When it finally came out, it was clear the nachos were rushed and they were not especially good. 3. When the entree came out, we were brought the incorrect dish, at this point I had more than enough of the place, so I told them to forget about it and bring the check. 4. Everyone had finished their meals for nearly an hour before the checks were sporadically brought out. After all the checks were brought out, we had to pull the waitress aside and specifically ask for her to bring ours. 5. During this whole time, there was no one who looked like a manager to be found. Everyone at the table was clearly upset by the service, yet management never showed its face.  This was, by far, the worst dining experience I have ever been a part of and I would not recommend this overrated establishment to anyone.

zxBrNiv4ZkCXkdIXwNpGbw.text: My boyfriend and I went here hoping for better-than-average bar food and a good home brew while in Charlotte, but it was just meh. We were told we would wait for 20 minutes which seemed ridiculous as there were open tables all over the restaurant and bar and finally got seated in one of these open tables after 40 minutes of waiting. The $10 calamari was a very small portion, the sauces were obviously not made in-house, and the pieces of calamari were TINY! We both ordered mediocre salads and didn't find their brews to be anything special. Would have rather spent $50 elsewhere.

lBlS3QxbvKuLOVfD-9UKeQ.text: We only ordered appetizers and they were your average wings and chicken tenders. Average American food. Nice place to have a drink and enjoy the outside patio area...especially at night.

1StVgIQbQWHdCgAanJTOHA.text: I have been to this place in the past before they remodeled.  I enjoyed it.  I like the fact they brew their own beer on site.  You can tour the facility when there is time.  They are introducing new menu items and I was able to preview the new items.  I really enjoyed them. I will definitely have to go back.

gNRddfaWrB7-ykRJoaESrA.text: I tried all their beers; the seasonal was OK, stout was great.  Rest of them were not good IMO.  Food is so so - not really worthy of 3 stars and wait time was long but it was a Saturday prom evening so it's OK.  They got the third star from me for the service; waitress was great and once seated, service was extremely prompt and courteous.  I guess they made it a point to train their staff in explaining their different brews so that was nice.

cuWm78keFAQkHBnXUaV4lA.text: I've been to rock bottom many times and plan on going back because I always enjoy the good food and great beer that is made on site. But this last time I went I was really impressed by the professionalism of the management. I just read the review by Erick V and I was there when the party from the ACN convention was at rock bottom, and they were out of control and ruining my dining experience. I was sitting next to the bar and twice I saw people from the ACN party steal my drink from the bar well. Andrea was quick to come over and very calmly take care of the problem, despite the fact she had to handle 100+ party out of control at the same time. And I was happy to see that she called the police because the party was literally stealing my drinks. And after reading the review from the ACN party I have to say when you go out to eat you shouldn't need a host or manager to tell you to pay your tab, you pay it on your own like a normal adult, and don't steal people's drinks.

JA1bGXFK5sMMlWuY6VFByg.text: Checked this place out while on vacation. They had pretty decent food but the atmosphere was very chain restaurant like. But great beer!

9QYnE-mLpV11-8KmDL6cKw.text: Classic chain fare - great for lunch & as a place when you can't get into anywhere else.  Service at this location was great.

UEh1XiyWY_0_Hx303lrtGw.text: I have been here on numerous occasions with a variety of people and the one thing I must say about this place is inconsistency.  You can go there one night and have great food and service, whereas you could go there on a totally different night and experience the complete opposite.  The same goes for the food.  Some dishes are awesome (shrimp and grits, stuffed chicken) while others I would definitely shy away from (pizza).  If you are a beer lover, they have some good brews which are actually crafted on site.  The beer can be better than the food more times than not and I would recommend people to go here for that more than the food.  The Southern Flyer is great for pale ale folks like myself.  If you give this place a shot, prepare to roll the dice because you don't know who you will get, or what the food will be like when it comes out.  The one thing you will be guaranteed to have if you are so inclined is a nice brew made on-site.  Can't beat that sometimes...

Iq5VYnffrlCz441X-HLzlg.text: Nicest patio downtown. There are much better wait staff downtown. Get the beer or wine. Stay away from cocktails. Food = pedestrian.

gNeRADtHhV7x_-NKuO_qsg.text: The only really great thing I can say about Rock Bottom is their location, it was perfect right before going out on a Friday night, but that's it.  Their menu is WAY overpriced, with nothing really great on it.  I just got the nachos (found as an appetizer) and my friend got the burger.  The nachos were overcooked and semi-stale.  The beer was decent, it's just draft beer here.  Service was good and the atmosphere was fine.  But I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

0ZQClDWurmEgRvxaoZgUDA.text: It's rock bottom, you know what you're gonna get. We have this in DC and San Diego.   Friends kids loved the pizza and fruit cup. Most even stayed on the table and not on the floor. this was a major accomplishment.  The milk and apple juice must have tasted great as well as they both had refills.  I had the Hawaiian Chicken which was really tasty, pineapple, rice pilaf and green beans.  Next time maybe something not "chainy", but this did hit the spot. no wait at around 7pm on a Monday.   outdoor seating too - a+

IhcWJpqRlyw2yJd-g53PIQ.text: I have mixed feelings about Rock Bottom. I enjoyed the inexpensive beer sampler. The main reason we went  here though was for my fiance to try a specific burger. Unfortunately that burger was "86'd"... as was her second choice. We weren't told that until 10 to 15 minutes after ordering, which delayed our dinner. Otherwise what we got was OK. We went for a second time with some friends to watch a Panthers game, and, again, it was just OK. i tried a third time and not only did our food take a long time, but it was clear that mine was made first and had just been sitting out because nothing was warm. Three strikes and you're out in my book. I will not be going back. If you do go, I recommend going when it isn't busy (as it was with my first and third experience).

RnMU7XsoWDhj5T1PFo1-Ig.text: Very much enjoyed this place. Nice location...Within walking distance for most of the center city hotels. Wide selection on the menu...definitely something for everybody (even picky little kids.) The Spiced Hefeweizen was amazing...finished very clean. If you have kids, avoid the Mac and Cheese on the kids menu...it's just Kraft. The wait staff was great; attentive but not overbearing.  Overall a good place to eat for a family staying in center city Charlotte.

7fXDz7Ft27tWvf7f7Jg7bQ.text: Great location in Uptown. Awesome to sit outside and people watch. The menu at any Rock Bottom is semi boring, but if you just want food one step up from Friday's (read: just order a burger and you'll be happy), then this place is good. Fun for after Alive After Five downtown. The bathrooms at this place are pretty cool-- you get to see all the brewery things in the back. Even though it's a large restaurant, I'd try to make a reservation or at least call ahead if you know you are coming-- sometimes the wait here gets just a little north of uncomfortably long.

npHqYaPbMzaRG_VSH8byDA.text: not thrilling, not disappointing.  RB is average across the board.  Try the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.

d4C5OLOq1y_8M03F1qRZHA.text: For the most part, your average "American food" type of restaurant. I can't comment on their beers as we didn't have any. The menu was pretty extensive but we'd viewed it online beforehand and knew what we wanted. Hubs got the seafood cobb salad which was HUGE and he enjoyed every last bit of it. I ordered the hazelnut crusted chicken primarily because I noticed before we went that a few reviewers here on yelp recommended it. It was reallllllly good! Also HUGE portions that hubs had to help me eat. the chicken itself was really tender and juicy and that crust and sauce are delicious. The cheddar mashed potatoes were good, as you'd expect, and even the vegetables were yummy. We also had the jalapeno spinach dip which was not that great. I mean it was fine, but out of all the spinach dips I've tried in my life, it was not on the top 10. The atmosphere is nice, it's pleasantly decorated and clean, nothing special. Seems pretty large, probably good for groups. The booth we sat in was really spacious and comfortable. Our service was quick and adequate, although our specific server seemed like she'd rather be anywhere else but work that night. She wasn't rude, just did the bare minimum and spoke very quiet and without any energy. But she was quick and got our orders right, which is really what matters. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if the location and timing was just right, as it was for us last night, I would go again.

JLF1h7tY2I9ApSp91Kuoiw.text: didnt eat.. the pilsner was hopped to perfection along the lines of an ipa- brilliant

oTrW9Y6GOCZXJU4yNZb91w.text: Alisa is an amazing waitress. The food is AMAZING best food I've had in a long time The chicken fried chicken is good, the pretzel breaded chicken is good and the chicken macaroni is to die for.

Ow_l6NdejdKdDQFK-oDZFg.text: Service was below par, waited a 1/2 hour to be served. There was only 20 people including folks at the bar. 10 minutes after ordering we were told one of the items that we ordered was not available, and they didn't wait around to obtain the new order. We had no idea who our waiter was because we saw about 3 people while we were there. Our food came out with a small amount of fries when the fries are suppose to be bottomless, but we were advised the fries weren't ready. The service was just God Awful

E6PfzemRmsoudzh4RWYSLw.text: Extremely condescending management, upon entering the near empty restaurant our party of 6 was delayed 15 minutes due to "extremely high flow" whatever that means. We promptly walked to the bar and ordered a few drinks. The only redeeming factor of this place was the bartender. Despite calling us "massholes" she was personable and efficient. We ended up seating ourselves due to extremely slow service. We were foraging for ketchup bottles as we were waiting for one or the wait staff to talk to our table. After one beer my friend was approached and patronized with a glass of water the management "happened to have found" after walking out of the bathroom. After all of this hoopla we had an okay meal, decent burger, good Mac and cheese. Would definitely never recommend this place to a friend please find a different place to find dinner.

kHXuBM8rKn6-EhYgOPfjRQ.text: In short, our experience here was awful. Food ranged from bad to pretty good. The service was probably the worst I've had in 20+ years of adult dining experience.   The positives about Rock Bottom... The restaurant it's self is a really cool space and it's very clean. There are a ton of great beers on tap. The place is very large and we were able to get seated right away on a Friday night. Some of the food was good.   I dined with a party of six and we ordered a variety of foods... The burgers were just okay. Not particularly flavorful but edible. The onion rings were good. The nacho appetizer was good and the salsa it was served with was very good.  The pretzel sick appetizer was odd... The sticks were not actually pretzels. The didn't look or taste like pretzels, rather like breadsticks. The cheesy jalapeno dip it was served with was good. The firecracker shrimp was very good, definitely the highlight of the meal. The chicken tacos were good. I personally ordered the lobster and shrimp tacos and they were served cold. Not room temperature or lukewarm. They were cold, like they had literally just been pulled from the walk-in.Had they been warm, they probably would have been good. They were served with a side of bland, instant rice and black beans.  The biggest negative about Rock Bottom is by far the service. The service was awful. Although we were seated right away, the server was slow to take our drink order... And slow to return with the drinks... and slow to take our appetizer order... and slow to take our dinner order... And never stopped by to see if everything was okay with our food.  The appetizers came to our table all at once and quickly enough, so there were no issues there.  It then took quite awhile for our dinners to start arriving. Between the six of us, four people had ordered burgers. One burger was brought to the table and then *nothing* else was brought out for 15 minutes... Three more entrees (burgers) were served. And then 5 minutes later, a fifth entree was brought out. And 10 minutes after that (30 minutes after the first entree was brought out) the last entree was delivered (the cold lobster and shrimp tacos). Amidst all of this, I noticed the server did have time to engage in some very public displays of affection (e.g., hugging and kissing) with another server in the middle of the restaurant. Although I did not send the tacos back or complain about them to the server (because who knows how long it would have taken to get a hot order brought out), I noticed on the bill that they had been comped. This tells me that they knew they were serving a bad plate of food and sending out too late. Very odd.   I definitely will not return to Rock Bottom and would not recommend this restaurant to anyone.

ODwV_uQO0_lQ0v8A5H1k1w.text: This is the only place that you can get Rock Bottom brewed beer.  They depend on it for their distribution.  Beers are good.  The few I had were on the heavier side.  The food was general southern American.  Battered, greasy and heavy.  They have a 2200 calorie slice of carrot cake on the menu??  2200?  My advice grab some beers, skip he food.

kWGcyGxILZSb6X44xIgRsA.text: My Fiancee and I were in town for the weekend and went here for drinks. The staff was so unprofessional! They were talking loud and laughing the entire time which was quite annoying. They were also eating from the same plate, each taking a bite from the same sandwich (Gross) 4 total workers including a guy. They were making fun on the carryout food that was being picked up by door dash. This was disturbing because I sure didn't want to order food after witnessing this.  I will not be patronizing this place again while in Charlotte.

_G-47G7PmztXUYfKL8MBRg.text: This restaurant has hit a new rock bottom (no pun intended). I went with my fellow co-worker to celebrate his vacation to the Philippines. It was suppose to be a memorable lunch but it ended up with horrible service. We waited 20 minutes before our server even came to our table. Once he did, he had no idea of the menu and seemed like his first rodeo. We waited for our food for another 20 minutes. My coworker had asked for a beer refill and it actually took 15 minutes to get there. Mind you while we were waiting for service there was nobody (customers) at this time. Very disappointed as the food tasted great.

RBYeYEU9M16KDkKwVKZhfg.text: Rock bottom is a great way to describe how you'll feel when you realize you've been waiting 45 minutes (and counting) for a cheeseburger. I can't speak for the food, but the service and environment leave much to be desired! Sorry Rock Bottom, but you're probably never going to get a second chance. Boooooo.  EDIT: the food finally came. my fries were cold and the burger was mediocre at best. I'd give it a solid 3/10 for food quality!

w-mSv6jwJrNMDRLpO8BvXw.text: I happened upon this place on Sunday night and I've been back every night I've been in town this week. This says a lot, as I love variety and spontaneity. The staff is awesome! The food is great! And the beer (brewed on site) is great. I love the Texas Fire Ribeye! I am not into spicy food, but the staff assured me it's not that bad. The spice adds flavor but isn't overwhelming to the palate. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Charlotte!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yum! Texas Fire Ribeye

G7hIG0seU6dvpnEX4ahEHg.text: As I sit here inside of rock bottom brewery with my family to celebrate my bday I realized I've just had the worst experience of any of my bday. Needless to say this is my 40th which to me is a milestone but since it's on st. Patrick's I guess they figured they would make enough money off the bar and other activities that my family and I was not taken care of in the least little but. The service was horrible, from taking drink orders, appetizers,and entrees it was slow, nonchalant, and I guess they figure with or without this table we making money

h_RtC4pBCczlA3cOMMxJjA.text: The food here is consistently off-the-charts good. The beers are also some of the best in the city (hello, marzipan-flavored wheat ale). Plus, it validates parking in Uptown. What more could you ask for?

tF9ttM5BLb0FkjEIaOBnig.text: Charlotte NC Location. We had the nachos, firecracker shrimp, and the classic wedge prior to our show. All was good and plenty of blue cheese on the salad. Plenty of food as well. More than we could eat. Beer was good as well. Great service throughout!!  Nick was our server and he was great!!!  Will ask for him everything we come back!!!

-InJ5cXNvSCtXPYZz1nBNA.text: Terrible experience. The food took over 30 minutes to arrive. Once it arrived it was incorrect and we had to send it back. When it came back my burger was way over cooked. Along with that our table was dirty when we sat down, we couldn't get silverware or ketchup, and the final receipt was so faded we couldn't read it. Will not be returning to Rock Bottom because sadly they are aptly named.

tbHW3q06qeCFNq4_hHNAOw.text: We went to Rock Bottom for a family dinner. Parking can be difficult downtown but they validate parking. We ordered a few appetizers including the crab dip. For an entree I ordered the veggie pizza. It actually tasted good. The only issue our group has was service. There were a few times when the order wasn't correct or forgotten. Overall good experience and they have a large menu that provides options for a larger group.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

OUNczpTIhamYd10lsQu9QA.text: Never like to leave bad reviews but this is deserved.  Came tonight around 5 and the place was not busy at all. We opted to sit outside .  We ordered our drinks and after a few minutes my kids sodas and waters were delivered. But then we preceded to wait over 20 minutes longer for our beers ( at a brewery ) even after my husband went to find out what was going on ( and saw our beers sitting at the bar unattended) - it still took another 5 minutes . Our server apologized - but when i said , yeah, it was a little long - he went into a long " I'm the only one out here - doing what I can do". There was only one other table sitting outside .  We finally ordered - specified no mayo on the one sandwich - and even said " more importantly - no mayo " and no cheese on the burger - just lettuce and bacon. Well. our food came and guess what ?   We ate the food as our server was no where to be found . It was mediocre food at best .  When the server came by , he asked if we would we like our check because he knows we are in a hurry ??! We never said we were and we had been there for well more than an hour and a half .  Just rude and terrible way to service your paying customers .  And if you are wondering , I have worked in the restaurant/service  business so I do know what it's like and appreciate good service.  I can't imagine what would have happened if it was crowded- the place was empty and could not get it together .  Sadly , my tip reflected our poor experience ( and normally a very good tipper ) . There are far many other places in CLT we should have gone and spent our $$.

ITtXDNhUouZdyFnDrvvpuQ.text: My boyfriend and i came here for an early dinner after our movie and we were so disappointed with the service. I have been here before and never had a problem when im sitting at bar but this particular night our waiter asked if we wanted to sit at bar or in dining room and we chose the latter. He rolled his eyes at us and proceeded to huff and puff as he took us to our table and we didn't know why! He didn't speak at all just mumbles the whole time when we were ordering. It felt like we were inconveniencing him! Never gave us refills, practically threw our foods in front of us. It was very uneasy my boyfriend and i just stayed quiet and tried to not let the attitude get to us but it really did sour the mood. I ordered the bacon cheese burger and jt was barely cooked i asked for well done and it was raw. Such a shame because we usually enjoy it here. Sade to say will not be returning.

oKoKraME02L2vYjcYPXlgQ.text: Grade 90. Stood at hostess stand for 6 minutes until someone said I'll be right back. After 3 more min. I left.

RCDW6njEzDfdHKrDT4IoxQ.text: Left duckworths and walked across the street to the best establishment on Tryon. Equally busy atmosphere however we were seated and served with our drinks in under ten min vs waiting a lifetime at poor customer service "ducks". Drinks, food, AC, and service was the best hands down at rock bottom. Stay out of duckworths and spend your hard earned money here vs there! Take care patron and please read to AVOID poor customer service at -Duckworths. Pro rock bottom negative on duckworths!!!! Go ROCKBOTTOM!!! AWESOME PLACE!!!
