fnUnCgqGbtwjdf8VNxrCgA.text: This had to be one of the worst dining experiences we have ever had.   Service was slow and the food was cold. The batter on the fish would have been great if the meal had been warm. One of the worst Bloody Marys I have had here in Charlotte.  The ladies bathroom had no toilet paper!!  If these facilities had been visited before ordering our meal and not afterwards we would have found another place to eat.  On leaving the restroom one of the kitchen staff was being escorted from the kitchen as obviously unwell.  After seeing this and the meals we were served I felt sick to my stomach

KXYcIIk3_cEJt7FutXngLQ.text: My service was horrible I came with my family we had to wait forty mins for an appetizer it came out with our food we asked to speak to a manager and he argued with us about the issue and our server appeared to be new and didn't even apologize about the issue I would not advice going there I should even give them one star

GrQ7Dp4R4tyklL_SgvBTtQ.text: This is one of my favorite all-around restaurants. Good food, good service and it has a great atmosphere. Casual, but it is not too laid back. It is perfect for family and friends. It has great outdoor seating.

Z8H5T7PBtIXWcfPFrMS3vQ.text: I decided to bring my girlfriend in because she was craving crab dip.  Our server started off great she was friendly and seemed to have a general idea of everything.  After our two appetizers we waited about an hour for our food which never came.  We were told our food would be paid. A half our later our server comes back and regrets to inform us we will still have to pay for our food which we now in to-go boxes and delivered an hour and a half after our second appetizer. Our server apologized and offered to pay for our drinks out of her pocket. We were told our entree would not be taken off our check because the manager denied it took an hour and a half for the food to be delivered to our table. In all we paid for everything that we didn't get to eat hot but after the concert that we almost missed due to not being able to get a check from the server.  All said and done, the server was in great spirits and nice.  But was overall the worst experience I've had in a restaurant.

ibIPtvfhzfDajkiVjbAHCA.text: If they had half stars I would give it! The service at this place was awful! It wasn't busy at all and our waitress barely came by to check and fill drinks. After waiting forever for food it came out cold no I'm sorry freezing cold! Went to get ketchup bottle it was empty so went to grab the next bottle and it was empty too. Had to try and find a manager all the staff just looked at me stupid like they didn't have one. Finally Got a  manager over and she took the plate to the back and warmed it up and brought same plate back. No apologies! It's insane to be a place in downtown Charlotte and charge way too much for cold food!!!! This place is awful! So here we sit cold food and no refills!  I couldn't even finish my meal I was so upset with how bad this place is.

YjO8gkn4nKPP1hJbRTIzRw.text: I had a fabulous time sitting at the bar on a busy Saturday. Meredith is an incredibly attentive bartender, regardless of her busy surroundings. Great beer. The food was pretty rockin'! Get the Mac and cheese!

jT2l610RyrGHzGR9PbuTwQ.text: Food and beer were great.  Service was horrible.  It took 10 minutes to get a waiter to come to the table and then another 10 to get our drinks.  People s round us hsd s as me issue.  We then ordered 2 more beers. My beer came out in 10 minutes my wife's in 15. We then came to bill pay and we had a gift card.  Waiter did not take off gift card amount but rather took sll off on my credit card.  When I showed him the gift card he said oh sorry  thought was a Vic card.  Then had to back out charges from my credit card and add vorrect charges.  I go here a lot and food is always good but service has dropped off a lot.

p4oTf9ALws-9GZv6c_VAcw.text: I like Rock Bottom.  It's in a great location Uptown and offers a good American menu in a nice, casual setting.  I can always count on great food and great service.   If you want a "light" meal, they have an abundance of salads to choose from.  I'm working my way through each of them, but I haven't had a disappointing one yet and they're each very filling.  If I'm a little hungrier or craving a hot meal, I tend to go with the Blue Crab Stuffed Chicken or the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken.  Mmm... they're both melt-in-your-mouth good.  Then I usually wash them down with whatever brewed-on-the-spot beer they have on special, preferably something light.    Rock Bottom is a good place to take eaters that don't like to experiment with gourmet food (but you can still find something gourmetish yourself!), out-of-town guests, or even a date for a nice, casual get-to-know-you meal in nice surroundings without any pretension.  It can even serve as a great standby if everything else Uptown is too crowded or you can't decide where to eat.  You'll never be disappointed.

cnmKctT7KMCd3RNtiSjVxA.text: Better-than-average bar food with a great atmosphere. It's kind of a standard place to find yourself in nights out uptown...you won't expect to have your socks knocked off by anything, but you also won't have a bad time. It's spacious, too, so it's a great place to start the night off with a big group of friends. It's a decent place to bring kids as well...the menu is pretty diverse in terms of bar food, so it's good for families.   My favorite part of this spot is the outdoor seating. You don't get a much better outdoor seating experience...you're right in the heart of uptown at one of the busiest intersections. It's fun to sit out there alone and just observe what happens.   It's also a great venue for events. I attended a work-related party here, and the service was great. We all had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. From the website.

OXO14DixznHRyVdN5zAiGA.text: Have been here several times. It can get loud when crowded and there can be long waits. There is a parking lot across the street that can be good. It can also have a sign saying it's full when it's actually empty, oddly enough.  Loved the fish tacos, nachos, and salad with pear. It's not as cozy as Ri Ra down the street, but that depends on what you are looking for. Service was average so won't identify the server.   Hope to check out more restaurants in the area in the next few months.

Wvl7YLsk__5RVUt0nJnhvw.text: Came here for lunch after a field trip with my students. Great service, great staff, great food!

mf2ujrWpx2Vr-64f_2VIWg.text: When I come to Charlotte downtown is always my first stop. The mac&cheese is the best! You have to try it! The service overall is okay and the drinks as well. The prices are descent but I love coming to Rock Bottom!

3WvA3PsBCXHOo3cCqQs8nA.text: Food was AMAZING! Fresh and cooked perfectly! You could tell that everything was cooked to order, my caesar dressing was defiantly home made! Service was great as well and food was reasonably priced! Will come back again on my next trip to Charlotte!

Ixj0Y7Fa3aR_htAFr0OfjA.text: We were ivisiting from out of town and went here on a Friday night.  We had good service and great food.  We both had the chicken/sausage gumbo and it had just a little kick to warm us up on a chilly night.  Also went for the beer battered fish and chips which was also great.

FehKNoIkvMMVb-nrYkO4lg.text: Been to Rock bottom multiple times, just as always had a great time. Our server was Donna, great server and she knew a lot about the beers.  The manager was walking around checking in on tables so I asked him for his suggestion from the menu. He suggested the Chicken Parmesan pasta with the "Smoky Mountain" pasta sauce and a side of marinara.  It. was. amazing. Perfect recommendation. Had a great time. We'll definitely be back.

tAHHC1rpiDpI4NFoVmuR3Q.text: Let me just say, the5 times that I have been here, I have LOVED it!  Went here for the first time with my boyfriend. We went during the week, and they had some kind of trivia going on(it was pretty fun & entertaining) For an appetizer, my boyfriend ordered a caesar salad, which was really good! I ordered chicken quesadillas which were MIND BLOWING!! I mean OMG, they were soooooo good! I had never eaten sour cream or avocado before that night, and now I eat it all the time when I get the quesadillas.  Next, my boyfriend ordered a burger(with cheese, ketcup and mustard. PLAIN I know.) He ordered steak fries that came out more like potato wedges. He thought his burger was so-so. I tasted it, and it was dry and overcooked. The wedges were salty as well.   I ordered a steak(medium well) and fries. Now that was 10 times better than my boyfriends plain burger. My steak was juicy, seasoned well, and cooked to perfection. I couldn't have asked for a better steak! So kudos to the cook! My fries were normal fries which were just as tasty(once again better than my boyfriends) lol.  I have been back to Rock Bottom 4 times since then, and now that I live up the street from it, I plan on becoming a weekly regular! I always get the chicken quesadillas, and have even tried the chicken nachos. Let me tell you that the nachos coming in a heap PILED up on a plate, with cheese, olives, tomatoes, and other stuff. They were sooooo good! Me and my friends couldn't eat it all.  Also, my boyfriend ordered the ribs before, and he did not like them WHAT-SO-EVER. But then again, he was comparing them to the ribs at Firebirds so yea. He also ordered the cheese pizza, and I must say that I have gotten better pizza at chuckie-cheese. I don't know if my boyfriend just has a string of bad luck at ordering at Rock Bottom, but his food is NEVER as good as mines. I have ordered the burger before(cheese, ketchup, mustard, lettuce, bbq sauce, medium well) and it was DELISH!  I recommend Rock Bottom to everyone to try out for themselves!

PYCub7whJuiV8RbTHrKxdg.text: 2 word review: sub par.  more-than-2-word review: good location if you're in uptown, lots of seating, decent service.   The food, however, is pretty bleh. Everything I had was bland with the culinary prowess of a microwave burrito.   Crab and artichoke dip was runny, like hot yogurt with the same about of flavor as crab meat (...so, not much).   I got the margarita pizza which was edible but that's the only redeeming quality I can give it. I was with a group of a dozen or so and everyone's summary of their food seemed to be "meh".  Basically, if you like Applebee's... you should come to this place and pay more for the same food.

AwAdjSIUSBzBQ0t4GI31bA.text: _The Music on Fridays is great!  Had the appetizer tostada, two small ones but the perfect size for me. The corn tortilla was tough in the middle otherwise great.  Service was a little slow. .. They were busy.

zMTXPfq6R6TmbLgZtmK0FA.text: Just got back from a week long trip to Charlotte with my girlfriend and of all the places we went to, this was our favorite by FAR.  EXCELLENT beer, food was delicious, steak cooked to perfection, wait staff was attentive and polite.  Just a great experience! If you're in Charlotte, got to Rock Bottom!!

BgsL_VbcbfOdzXMNP_tY1w.text: I am never disappointed with their beer, food , or service. I have visited Chicago and Long Beach and now Charlotte always great and consistent.

rBlF5xh26MSoDihETktc4g.text: There is a wide variety of food choices here, from salads to pizza. Steaks and seafood, Mexican to Cajun. Something for everyone, and great beers on tap all brewed in house as well as bottled beers and a full bar. The servers are friendly and efficient, they know their menu. An excellent choice out side of the box is the "Bistro filet", ask for the Ale sauce on the side. My all time favorite is the Shrimp and Crab tower, with avocado in it and Pita on the side.

JWBE-EgFflMMNHVLZqgOpQ.text: Rock Bottom Brewery has a great location and huge space, including bar area and indoor/outdoor seating. I've been a few times for lunch during the week and twice for dinner. It gets pretty busy at lunch time so try to arrive a little before noon or around 12:45pm in order to beat the lunch crowd rush. I've not had a problem getting a seat for dinner. And I've always had great service.   The menu is huge (literally) with tons to choose from in terms of beverages and food. The fish tacos are good and the chicken picatta was okay but I found myself scraping off the extra sauce, and the green beans that came with it were overdone and soggy. I did enjoy the french fries.   Where Rock Bottom falls slightly short is the prices. They're frankly too high for this type of establishment (in my mind it's similar to Applebee's or Outback). And as always, parking is a little tough uptown. Ultimately, if you're looking for somewhere to go and the other uptown restaurants are packed, Rock Bottom is a solid choice. Just don't expect to be overwhelmed.

lJk-tEC0dTp6r7MiJ1tQuA.text: Service was great but food wasn't anything special. A little pricey. We will try a new place next time.

R6gdiUhfSip8TnFi6iqX1w.text: A friend and I had lunch yesterday and we both ordered the fried fish.  It was awful.  Tasted like frozen fish sticks they threw into a fryer and placed on a bed of fries.  I think you should get better fish for $14.00   On the positive side, the slaw was very good.

7LcZ4kMJ3LGakzDvTlY6aQ.text: We went for lunch on Sunday Afternoon.  We sat there for ten minutes and nobody acknowledged us or came to our table.  A waitress passed our table two times and chose not to make eye contact with us.  Servers congregated at the hostess stand.  We walked out and still nobody noticed.  This used to be my favorite place uptown.  Really disappointed.

p8WKFR1TyyugrXwrO0Dfsg.text: While I am not much on chain restaurants, Rock Bottom is certainly a place we will be visting again.    My boyfriend and dining partner in crime is a huge beer lover.  Rock Bottom offered a great variety that he was pleased with and the brewery atmosphere is really cool.  The spirit and wine offerings were also pretty good with a solid variety of wines and the usual spirits (with some fun cocktail options).  The menu is huge and offers enough to please anyone.  Our server was extremely sweet, quick, and very knowledgeable of the menu.  She passed the test when she offered solid beer recommendations with food pairings.  The food was surprisingly good.  We tried the southwest eggrolls to start (holy carbs and cheese) and then split a salad with flat bread pizza.  Once we finished dinner we moved to the bar...which I made a note on to visit for game days.  Spectacular set up with plenty of seating.    The gem of this place is actually the bartenders.  I'm sure that it's no surprise that if one sits at a bar, they are most likely going to chat with the bartenders.  These girls were hilarious and carried on great conversation with us without seeming imposing - which is the key to a great bartender.  We were enjoying the atmosphere so much we moved our evening plans to Rock Bottom and had friends meet us there.    Good food, great service, great drinks...we will definitely be back.

U6A-SWv3bomk5f90G3X-6g.text: Came in with a buddy of mine to a familiar place that always delivers during my travels. We sat down, not too many clients in the restaurant and service started out well with our server Imani. However, it became evident that either we were placed in a section different from the areas she was working as we kept seeing her less and less or I can just ignore my guest because I think I'm cute and smile and everything will be okay. At the end of our meal, which was very good, she offered us dessert, we opted for another beer which never came. We would catch a glance here and there of her for the next 20 minutes and finally she came over and asked if I beer made it to us. Did you bring me my drink? Then no, I have not gotten my beer. She would look for it right away, but I asked her to just close us out as it just wasn't nice to be there any longer, no excuse, no apology, just said okay, smiling away and walked away to what I hoped would be a quick return with my bill. She again left for another 10 minutes. When she returned I asked her what exactly happened that our drinks never made it to us? Was someone else supposed to bring it, did she forget? She said that someone else usually brings it, she was helping out the bar by bringing our drinks, someone must have taken it, oh my god, i'll just smile at these guys and everything will be fine.... no.... i just want good service. The server who was on our side was taking care of all his clients, bringing them drinks so im pretty sure I was getting the run around. I asked her who the manager was and she said Michael and again walked away. Pretty disrespectful attitude to have in a customer service environment. Next time I come to Charlotte I need to stick to the many many other places with great food and folks that want to take care of their clients. My opinion is that the food here was darn good and consistent, the beer is excellent, the service which is the most important, was "rock bottom".

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Steaming jalapeno sirloin!!! So good!!!
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pepperoni pizza!

_9v-_9-uf4H5M7FQy86ZOQ.text: Went here for a pre-show meal. We were looking forward to the beers, and fortunately or unfortunately (depending upon your viewpoint), that was the highlight of the meal. I ordered the ribs, which were dry and not that hot. Also they were not that tender. Their sweet sauce, however, was good, but no sauce can make up for poorly cooked ribs. My wife had the chicken pesto pasta. While that was decent, it wasn't exciting either.  Sure, the plates were "sizeable." But PRICEY for what you get. I mean, we could have gone to Aria Italian nearby and gotten a MUCH better quality of food for LESS than this place! I mean, we went here thinking we would get a good value. Unfortunately, it's more than a lot of other comparable places in Uptown.  Too many other choices in Charlotte to come back here.

6PY7ZsjhUvE1bf_BiUPvUg.text: Very good beer and food + a truly relaxing and comfortable setting = four stars. Prices were OK and the location is great if you are in or near center-city CLT. I had the Cajun Pasta & my wife had grilled shrimp with Mac/Cheese. YUM!

MUVtwPp-hTLcw2CnDD0iow.text: This is a great  stop for a meal if your going to a Bobcat's game or any event at Time Warner arena. They have covered garage parking for just $5 and a menu that just won't quit. They've got something for everyone. Try the Mahi tacos, two fresh and flavorful,  crispy tacos, covered with a soft flour tortilla...the flavor screams at you...! If it's busy, you can get a game of pool on the two billiard tables or sit at the bar and enjoy on of the many big screen plasmas.  It's a five mimute walk to the Bobcat's and the Blue Line Lynx with easy access stop to Panthers.

9CkTwPbSbnjtBIHXT_hKtQ.text: Very conveniently located at the top of the Blue Line, just a short block and half over to Tryon, you can't miss the Rock Bottom facade. I was meeting a friend for a semi-business lunch, so I wasn't able to try any of their house brewed beers (they server Kaliber, but they don't have their own non-alcoholic beer). The back of their lunch menu is all booze - 11 different martinis and 4 different margaritas and a whole bunch more. Definitely a full bar here!  I had read over the previous Yelpers before going, so I had one of their salads - the Goat Cheese and Hummus. It was a huge scoop of hummus (at least a cup, maybe more) with a dressing tossed salad on top of sliced flatbreads. Way too much food, the hummus was sharp and tasty with just enough garlic that it was delicious but not so much that I was worried about my breath heading back to the office. Maybe there could have been more goat cheese, but that's just me complaining because it was good!  My friend had some sort of cheese topped grilled chicken with fries. While it was good, I absolutely won the competition. ;-)  A very pleasant experience. I'd have no problem going back here if I'm Uptown.

mX_1PbFk434g6EuYn6TRLg.text: Yes! Yes! Yes! If you are weak at heart...don't come here! Cause you wil experience multiple foodgasms!!! I was a fan before they changed the decor, and now it's that much better!  My favorite app is the Artichoke and Crab Dip! 0_0 with the crosctini bread! OMG! Every entree has been deelish! They have it all from burgers, to salmon, to salads! All homemade...and we haven't even gotten to dessert yet (Which is also killer of course!). Seriously! Make sure a bed is near by after you waddle out of there! lol   Melissa was our sever last night and she was super cute and super helpful! Great food! Great Service! Clean and Modern decor! Free parking! Descent Price! You just can't go wrong with this place!   Complete and Utter Satisfaction! Guaranteed to please! Every time! ;)

eKQ31LSRaBJLCC-YtRjD-A.text: Average food although dessert was awesome.  Would get the salted caramel toffee. Waiter was very nice, however clearly made an error on our bill.  When asked about it, he admitted it was wrong and attempted to fix it but essentially came back with a charge that was essentially the same as before but now with a non-itemized receipt so you couldn't see the error.  Could have asked him to address it again, but wasn't worth it.

oGn-pLOY83wtaq2zZgZQhw.text: Went here for a bachelorette party of 12 girls, we had a reservation, waited 10 minutes to be seated, was seated a four different tables that we had to asked be pushed together.  We then sat at least 15 minutes before we were greater and our drink order was taken, but the drinks took almost 25 minutes before arriving.  When our drinks did arrive, the server ran off before taking our dinner order, more time passes... we order and our food comes out pretty reasonably ~15-20 minutes.  When the food did come out three orders were missing completely, our server did not bring our food and was nowhere to be found, we sat waiting until finally she came by.  At this point we've been here well over an hour.  The manager comes by, gets the food out, says that there would be a free round of drinks for the whole table.  I didn't receive the drink promised by the manager and when I asked the server I got a look, this was the first and only time I asked her about anything!?  She brought the drink as I was returning from the restroom and said that an entire bottle of wine would be brought out due to the issues, we explained that we had other commitments that it wasn't necessary.  Then the manager threw in two bottles of champagne, at this point, I'm pretty sure he knew that nobody had a great experience and was trying to save face.    In the end, the manager was great at covering up for the lack of service we received but with so many options in downtown Charlotte I would chose another place next time.

s4qz6xVGiQDc8n7xUt61Yw.text: I love their dark beer and veggie burger!

8SAQs3hUWyrphJr_gBQ8Cw.text: This place wasn't bad.  If you live in Charlotte and have tried the other local beers in the area, check this place out.  If you're from out of town and want good local beer, I'd recommend somewhere else.  While the beer was good, it wasn't memorable.  The food was good, but again, nothing super memorable.  The waitress was friendly and attentive.

WJ0WF6diT3lExV9FwQMNxQ.text: The food was good, the beer was excellent!   I had the 2 A.M. burger, the burger itself was good but the hash browns on it were not. My wife had the bourbon burger she said it was good. My oldest daughter ordered the kids hamburger and was impressed that it was cooked to order not the hockey puck on bread that kids normal get. My younger daughter got the build your own pizza and she actually got to "build" it before they put it in the oven. The food was a little slow arriving and the service was fair, we got more attention from our server than our waiter.  I had the three of their handcrafted beers, the IPA, the Hop Goddess, and the White Ale, they were all excellent!

EocO8LeGv9lQx3QX5ObYeA.text: Rock Bottom probably has one of the best locations in uptown. Right on Tryon St. with a large dining area and excellent patio for people watching or watching the cars go by.  I don't remember what I ordered I think it was some sort of BBQ chicken and ribs. The food was pretty average, I didn't get to try the beer but I hear it's quite excellent. It's not that the food is bad, in fact I quite enjoyed my time here, but the selections available and food that came out were just not quite memorable. Maybe I would even call it boring.  I'd come just for the great atmosphere here. When you go to the bathroom you can see all the behind the scenes brewing behind a large glass window! The parking is free too which is nice, more to spend on food!

LC-agZKJcrTW-dLwUDFYuw.text: Stopped in before the Panthers Sunday night game. Sat at the bar with my buddy.  It was not busy.  The bar was dirty and no one made an effort to clean the space where we were sitting.  Gross.  Bartenders were terrible and not attentive.  Waited 10 minutes before someone asked if we needed something. Unacceptable. The beer was decent, but once we finished we waited a while with empty glasses before finally having to ask for another. Do the bartenders here not work on tips?  Because that's how you get stiffed. Only plus is the beer was $3 and they validate parking.

O8sPvJ69s1IpD3iN5iRfRA.text: This place was great for atmosphere and large groups but the food actually sucked.  We ordered from the happy hour appetizer menu and our server was pretty slow and forgetful. She brought one of us crab dip that was cold (supposed to be served hot), then took forever to bring the drinks back. I asked if the southwest egg rolls were very spicy before I ordered, she said no and low and behold I get them and they are spicy.  The drink (margarita) was very strong and not sweet enough. Overall they get a D for food and an A for ambience and location.

Mtewm1AdsTUky5wSCwwKhg.text: I had the Tuscan Chicken Pasta. It was very well seasoned. My son-in-law had the Cajun Pasta, being from Louisiana it wasn't very spicy, but good nonetheless. Pleasant atmosphere, good service.

u6NGJgP4C1E6LulGHmZBsw.text: I had the 2AM burger and it may have honestly been the best burger I've ever had! I also love their patio seating outside and the bar around the back. My only complaint (which isn't Rock Bottom's fault) is that homeless people approached our table 3 times during our dinner to ask for either money or some of our water.

SPT1nUBvWbhvsyMul4eraA.text: One of the best places I've ever eaten. I would highly recommend it for anyone. I got a royal flush on the rocks to drink which had a good amount of liquor for the price. For supper, I got the chicken fried chicken which came with mashed potatoes, chicken, gravy ( I got on the side) and subbed the coleslaw for French fries. Super filing & Couldn't even finish it all. Very satisfied. If you come across this place, definitely go inside!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

LYCn1DH9Y8TN1ORnNHkKGA.text: This is sort of a cluster of a story to tell as a review and maybe not a reason for a single star but it's not how things happen but how you deal with them, I'll write.  In town for the week and we decide to have a Holiday night our at Rock Bottom.  Bosses wife sets it up from 6-8 with open tap, appetizers and some other goodies.  Now long story short we get there at 5:45 and it appears there was a mix-up and they had us down from 4-6 (what office does anything at 4 on a Thursday).  They hold our area for an hour, till 5 before the call to see where we are, of course its after 5 so the phone is off.  They don't call the second number, just give away our area.  So again, long story short we show up at 5:45, all 14 of us and we don't have a table.  Manager on duty cops a serious attitude with our boss and it all goes down hill.  We finally get seated and the service is AWEFUL!.  They bring out apps after about 30 minutes but then take them away because they are for the people at the table we were supposed to be at (serious no-no in the biz).  When food does come out it's COLD.  Felt really bad for the two servers although I do think they got tipped well.  As for the management and the kitchen that part was about as bad as you can get.  Beer was half ass and not worth the trip.  Would not return, no way!  KT

lk7vBIoPDhkOit4f4HE9oQ.text: I took a client to lunch there yesterday since he worked in the same building.  I was a little surprised with all of the events going on in Charlotte that the restaurant was not busy.  I now can see why.  My client order soup and they brought it without a spoon.  When we asked for one, they brought us a plastic spoon.  I asked if they had any real spoons and they said no.  How can a restaurant not have any real spoons?  I ordered a their special which was a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich.  It was Fair but the fries were cold.  So, this place is nothing special and barely average.

pxbvbcL8IeZLY1deQ56uNg.text: The beer is great enough to earn 5 stars on its own but the service leaves so much to be desired that I would give negative stars if it were an option! I have to agree with another review that states, "Rock bottom" is how you're left feeling, so the name is appropriate. I ordered the flight and was very pleased with all samples. The pretzel duo was just okay. Cheese dips were clumpy with cold spots so microwaved it was! My entree, veggie Mac and cheese was horrible! No veggies except 3 hard mushroom slices and the pasta was chewy. Just gross! Our waitress if that's what you want to call her was basically nonexistent and did not seem to care that my entree had been sitting on end of table for 30 minutes. She offered to bring ticket without checking why my entree was untouched. I let her know it was not done and I wanted it removed. She simply said okay. Wow! Great customer service! I do not recommend restaurants that I feel are a risk so do not take a chance on dining here! The beer is awesome so bar service only may be an okay! I ordered a growler of Blue Ridge Mist to go and of course, the waitress forgot to place the order so I had to wait on this a little longer! The brewery will suffer unless wait staff improve and chef needs to improve also!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flight
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flight
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer menu

d5UDAdtZSib1KuvM_5c-lA.text: It took 2 hours to get my delivery and when it finally came, it was the wrong order. I got wrong items, missing items, it was cold, and hey- medium rare.doeant mean well done guys. The food was awful. Yes. Yes I ate it because I was only offered a refund and I was crazy hungry from traveling all day and hadn't eaten all day. I don't leave bad reviews. I really don't but this is piss poor guys. The only star I'm giving you is because of how kind the driver was

yIrLQrLcG5B1-7FmR0Mpog.text: Nice place had a special $3 pint it was great our waitress (shea)was cute and fast my grandson and I had pizza on a Saturday afternoon it was great,James brown was playing the pint was from the land down under i found on street parking enjoying downtown Charlotte

pWv7bW7JTeRvp2gX88ScJA.text: Sadly this was my first and last visit to this Rock Bottom location. Our server was not attentive to us or ensuring we had what we needed, but was focused on flirting, lingering, and laying all over a few male customers to which she was not assigned because they appeared to be dressed as though they were wealthy. The food was bland and tasteless; the macaroni was not full cooked and was not even at an al dente texture, which would have been acceptable. We ordered a growler to go- which the waitress failed to put in because she was so focused on returning to entertain those male customers which caused us to have to order the growler again and wait for it and the second check to be generated, in between her flirtation time that is. Sadly disappointed in this location seeing as how it is the oldest brewery in Charlotte it would have been a nice location to return to.

zY6F_rLw8eOK_vJ4r1G0vg.text: Seated quickly, waitress was good. We have some food allergies in our group so she was very good about getting the order right. The ONLY reason they didn't get a 5 star rating - the kitchen took a very long time to prepare the food and it was 2PM so the place was not very busy. Everything ordered off of the menu so this shouldn't have happened. So - if you are in a big hurry (we waited almost and hour after the food was ordered) - try another place but the food was good!

Xyulzr1AW6GlUQYp1RGy2A.text: This was my first and last time to visit this place.  I was with a party of 16 and the entire party was upset about the service, wrong orders, wrong drinks, wrong attitude, and wrong checks. Reservations at 8pm, received food around 1030pm. The place closed at 11pm.  The bar staff had shut down and the server told us it was last call and half he table hadnt got their food.  Everything, I wanted to order was not available food or drink wise.  It was a Sunday night and the place was dead.  The manager was in the kitchen plating food.  He had a bad attitude when asked why the long wait? He stated he didnt have time to talk, he was trying to get peoples food out.  The total experience was not good at all.

PZsYMRvW3TuwRrBIsCptAg.text: What a waste of a great location.   Start with the service.. took several minutes after being seated to see our waitress. We ordered drinks and apps but as we ordered apps our waitress walked away without letting us finish our order. When she came back we finished getting the order in. Jalapeno poppers, some shrimp thingy and pretzels. The apps all looked like they came from a frozen box of TGIF from the Harris teeter frozen section. The pretzels came with a cheese dip that was congealed and hard to dip. I took a bight with the cheese and gagged. DISGUSTING.. Keep in mind as well, during this time it took forever to get drinks, silverware etc.  Food we ordered finally came and was all gross. Hamburgers did not seem fresh. Looked like frozen patties. Bacon on burger was not well cooked etc. etc.   Fast forward to today.... I've been in the bathroom all day. No exaggeration, no joke... I haven't left the bathroom at work. SICK TO MY STOMACH...  I can't even finish typing all of the complaints because my fingers hurt...  STAY AWAY... gross food, horrible service... bad bad bad.

m-juQhg9oOG0eZ_jOQ30oQ.text: Service is terrible... especially with a big group. Took forever just to get a water and silverware. The food wasn't even that good for as long of a wait we had. Our waitress and the manager were very unprofessional and rude to us yelling at us to get our attention in the middle of our conversation. I DO NOT recommend this to anyone wanting good service and really good food. Do better.

Be3o-Rh8fXpbmWcGuKeXKg.text: Terrible wings, awful tacos, dry wet napkins, long waits for food, non-existent service. Will NOT be back.

H51Td9m1bWQK7MSLzbJoWw.text: Standard brewery/pub restaurant. I wasn't impressed with the vegetarian selection, but that I expect that at this type of restaurant. Their beer is pretty good, and a waiter came around with complimentary samples of their seasonal beers. We ordered the nachos, and they weren't anything special.  The best part about this place is that we were able to be seated immediately on a Friday night. We went out last minute and had tried multiple restaurants that had waits from 30 minutes to two hours. But, we walked right into Rock Bottom and got seated and waited on promptly. Great service

k5zwJl6ipnmLDXYRVNfrnA.text: Date of Visitation: 11/21/2017 around 2:00pm Reason: Afterwork Drinks  (i) Sampler - Premium - $4 Flight Tuesday - So, I only got BEER while I was there, but the beer chosen by the bartender + the bartender + the "eccentric and family-like" atmosphere + price of the flight = FOUR STARS by far. I can't remember the five (5) beers sampled, but they were all tasty craft beers.   The only downside was the smell of the place and some of the drunk patrons that were making a scene by being mildly belligerent.   All in all, I would definitely go back for the drinks and I MIGHT try the food. I really didn't see anything that peaked my interest.   --TrizzyO_o

YxdHPcu-Xivx8F0aanYCWA.text: Rock Bottom- you have to do better. Your food and location is too good to let your cleanliness and service take your down. My party of 4 went in (with reservations) and got seated in a NOT BUSY dining room on a Friday night at 5:00. Once we were seated we waited approx 13 min to be asked our drink order. Waited another 10ish to get said drinks- only to find out that one of the mixed drinks was completely wrong. We didn't even bother telling the waiter because by the time he came back around for us to tell him this- so much time had passed it wasn't even worth it because we knew it'd take another 15 mins to fix it. Parts of our order (soups) were missing but we were charged (waiter never even noticed) and again, we didn't tell him because he didn't visit our table frequently enough for us to notify him. Everything just moved super duper slow.  Additionally, the bathrooms were not clean. I would recommend the food but was completely turned off by the service.

O5ALU5v7b1remt0AX1B9Rg.text: Grabbed lunch here with the Fam, waiter was pleasant but forgot my bloody Mary and then served my sister in law a sizzling steak over my sons head without an excuse me.  My wife loved her Seafood Alfredo my fish tacos were not so appetizing. The black beans are on point.

euHcyalgGaIv_blHr876vg.text: Very disappointed. Arrived for our first visit to Charlotte on a Sunday evening. Had not eaten all day, so we searched Yelp for a pub and grub close to where we were staying. Saw Rock Bottom didn't have great reviews, but decided to try it anyway as their menu looked great.   1st disappointment - As soon as we walked in, we were informed that they were only serving from their 'late night' very abbreviated menu that started at 8pm. Since we were hungry and didn't have a plan 'B' location, we got seated.  2nd disappointment - We didn't get exactly what we ordered. We ordered the chicken nachos with an additional item of guacamole. When nachos came out...no guacamole!  Never saw waitress again until nachos were gone. I told her that our nachos didn't have the guacamole we ordered and she blamed the kitchen 'for having a bad night'! 3rd disappointment - We got the bill and noticed that the beers were charged more than the menu price and the nachos were charged extra for the chicken.  In the menu under nachos, it says choose chicken, beef, or guacamole for $5. Next line reads Add additional items for $1. Our waitress explained that it may be confusing, but the chicken, beef, or guacamole is EXTRA?!?!?  WHAT?!?!?!?!?!? So I guess all the poor yelp reviews are True with this one!  It was a terrible experience and our first impression of Charlotte was not good.

xvHTZKe8b59ZEGRvVBnHrg.text: I went here one day for lunch... and left. It took my friend and I about 5 minutes before we were greeted by the bar tender, who noticed us looking around to see if anyone was working that day. Once we were seated it took another 3-5 minutes for our server (who acted like he didn't care to be there) to ask for our drinks. Before he could come back to order our food, we decided to go across the street to Duckworth's. Duckworth's food was hot and tasted really good. We were more than happy to leave a very generous tip.   Pn: There was 3 parties there. One of 2, and the other of 5 and 1 guy at the bar. Maybe they were understaffed...

qx295T4yUIgs48A7zQtl6w.text: I had family in from out of town, and I wanted to take them somewhere in the uptown area where there would be something for everyone. They really liked it here! We had two flights of beer (the Firechief was everyone's favorite) and everyone enjoyed their food. Only four stars because the service was a little slow, but not awful.

Nz2wlTZiWBF3t9WJZoBhhw.text: Worst place EVER!!  Servers and bartenders were more interested in socializing. Dirty, and smelled bad. Food was horrible. Place does not deserve one star!

4wwmH5-aRSSGGfufKjUDpw.text: Beer is good, strawberry margarita is delicious!! The jalapeno pretzel bites are an appetizer worth paying for!! Wish it wasn't just seasonal, they should have it all year round! Food was so yummy! Our server Brittany was so nice and helpful! Definitely a place I would visit again :)

8vkfxK9EColQvZFVC-8ATg.text: This place has a fantastic outdoor patio and makes for a great place to sip back and enjoy a few beers. We split the brewer's feast and particularly enjoyed the southwest egg rolls with a roasted jalapeno ranch dressing. I enjoyed their winter seasonal and their Sweet Magnolia brown ale. However, they didn't make my top favorite beer selection and other than that I really didn't find any of their brews to be that great. Overall, I'd recommend going elsewhere with a better beer selection from multiple breweries. Of course, much of this review reflects my distaste for chain restaurants and breweries.

aMQcgsIZljrt5006iw6vjg.text: Ate here the other night and would TOTALLY go back. Very spacious, awesome bar and outdoor seating available. I had the Hawaiin Chicken dish - you have to try this, it was incredible! They chicken was so juicy and cooked perfectly, with pineapple sauce on top and rice pilaf underneath. I am craving it again as I type this. It is also very cool to walk into a place and order your beer by saying "red, ale, amber, port" etc. I will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

aqOR3TzckLcpuGf7Nxg3oA.text: This place has a decent menu, it's executed pretty well, and they (of course) make their own beers. Too bad it's often packed to the rafters with "former frat boy turned middling banking executives who still listen to DMB on the side". I'm happy to eat there if I happen to be uptown and the crowd wants to... but I try to avoid it whenever I can.

c4BQ7iZJ4HRC32QDMQ-FHw.text: Great all American restaurant! Cool spot! Choose this place over your other chain restaurants.

adffsM6saACw5zEvqPc3Ig.text: It was good. The beers were fun to sample. We sat at the bar and shared an appetizer sampler platter. One bartender was sort of unfriendly and the other was pleasant and made conversation with us. The appetizers left a lot to be desired. I'm wondering about the jalapeno dip would be eager to drink than dip. It was extremely liquid-like in consistency. Not really a dip. The southwest eggrolls were pretty decent. The wings were average, but cooked perfectly. Overall, it was ok. I wont be racing back for the food any time soon and ill steer clear of the abrupt bartender. The little blonde girl behind the bar who served us the remainder of our visit is worth asking for....if I could only remember her name. Anyway, if I'm in the area again, I will stop in for a beer.

Rnzt-fqsZvEribjnX2seGw.text: I have been to several Rock Bottoms including Denver, CO and this one was less than impressive. I'm new to Charlotte so I've been waiting to try this Rock Bottom out.  Went on a Sunday afternoon around 5pm. I took my young son with me so it was just dinner no alcohol. The restaurant wasn't very busy so we got seated right away.  Our server (which I didn't get his name) appeared about 5 minutes after we got seated, got our drinks and then we ordered.  We didn't see him again until after our food was brought to us. We only saw him twice after he checked to see if we had our food, and one of those two times was to hand us the check. The food was so-so.  My son had a hamburger which was delicious - my chicken bruschetta was fair but cold and the broccoli had no butter, seasoning, nothing.  It was over priced for what the meal consisted of. I gave two stars because  I was disappointed mainly with the service more so than the food. I've never had bad service or a bad meal at the Rock Bottoms I've been to in the past so was expecting the same high standards that I'm used to.  Might try again, but it will be a while.

oGHBdXFAq6_tLqJI-fa4Uw.text: First time eating here and checking place out. Everything exceeded expectations. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The artichoke and crab dip was to die for. The server even brought us more dipping crackers before we even had to ask her to. Same with drink refills. Always nice when you do not have to ask. Food was just as ordered. Everything was excellent. Would highly recommend this place.

JDdWlAJ2U5W9TpXFzZ7G0Q.text: Decent food with a laid-back atmosphere. The burgers are very good, and the Brewer's Club is excellent (if you like focaccia). Stay away from the non-standard stuff like their Mexican or novelty sandwiches. I've been disappointed every time I tried to venture into that territory. The main dishes are generally pretty good, with my personal favorites being the Hazelnut Crusted Chicken and the Meatloaf.   It's a great place to have lunch uptown. When the weather is nice you can sit on the patio and people watch. It's a safe place to bring non-adventurous lunch guests, as the food and atmosphere will have them feeling right at home.

Qydpi71vz0cf2PiVQTNkkQ.text: Stopped by here during a recent swing through Charlotte on biz. I was looking for an relaxed "Pub-food-plus" type of joint with good beer and in Rock Bottom, I found it.   The bar staff was helpful and generous with samples from their 8ish original beers. The Brown Ale is delicious (and award winning) and my favorite of the group.  While Rock Bottom features beer, they hang their hat on food. The nachos were loaded with fixin's, and the chili is chunky and decidedly above-average.   It's a relaxed, inviting and warm destination for anyone looking for an afterwork drink or evening out.

yXEI4vLaaWr-SVil4hTmVw.text: It looked great from the outside however when inside nothing went as planned. Granted we did have a large crowd however we expected more class... Our drinks were never filled on time. Our food came out in waves so we were unable to eat together, the chief came out and started picking up dirty plates he never talked to anyone. Our waitress was very friendly but lost when it came time to deliver our meal. It could be an amazing place they need to tighten up service.

BHQ0FwEOOHopAHk9f7gGxA.text: So.....I have a small group of pretty amazing employees and I thought I would treat them to a nice holiday dinner and a comedy show.  I never thought they would be combined.  They have 2 long tables reserved for us which was very nice.  We had pre-arranged a limited 4 item menu and for drink tickets to limit the alcohol consumption.  I sat down and saw the menus had our company name....nice touch. The waitress came to take drink orders and knew nothing about the tickets.  I had to send her to see the manager and get that straight before the booze started to flow.  Then one of my people asked who else was joining us.....as 6 of the menus had another company's name on them.   Let's say it went down hill from there.  Not everyone got salads.....the food took forever and then arrived cold and overcooked.  Nothing beats a grey steak and mashed potatoes you can pick up in one huge lump!!!  The funny part was, that they were not even properly garnished.  The steaks came unadorned, but the crispy onions they were supposed to include were on the chicken meals instead.  The delicious sounding "maple bourbon glaze" was totally invisible and tasteless, so I suspect that was left off as well.  Gordon Ramsey needs to be running the pass!!!!  After 2 1/2 hours.....still waiting on desert, I asked for the check as we were going to be late at the Comedy Zone for the planned comedy routine.  They then assured me that they could rush out desert.  The description was wonderful and I knew the staff....especially a select group would love triple chocolate brownies with caramel drizzle and vanilla ice cream.  So it arrived and was crunchy hard and the ice cream was a single melon ball scoop!!!!  People were so impressed!!!!!   NOT. So......I dropped about $800 after tip and could have taken the group to Longhorn for less and had a LOT better meal and service.   Might be a good bar to watch games.....it is not a good restaurant.  At least not for a small group of 16 people.  I suggest booking elsewhere.

K-mHhn5LWl7gI2_5zLYCqQ.text: Went for lunch and it was OK. Food was mediocre and there was a nasty smell where we were sitting. Smelled like dirty mop water.

x8C7ZlRvvbaCf7cKTrYLrQ.text: If I could design the perfect all-around restaurant, this would be it! Casual, but not too much. Wide range of food: from wings, to burgers, steaks, salads, fish tacos, and a ton more. New and clean inside, with an awesome bar area as well as private tables. I also love their outdoor seating, both the front and back sides. I've been coming here for almost ten years now, and still love it. The perfect neighborhood restaurant, whether you want a full steak dinner, or just wings and beer with friends.

-FBREqeGudbxr2Jv44j0Vw.text: My spouse and I have been here before in the afternoon when it wasn't too busy and we loved the beer, music, and service. We decided to come back and it was us and a group of friends and on a Saturday night so it was busy. They were low on staff and it was march madness and Saturday in Queen City, so taking all that into consideration we of course understood delays and such. When it came down to orders and service though, sadly was disappointed. Our friends shrimps came out ice cold with luke warm steak, forgot the glaze on the side, when recommended by the server and requested. The veggies were overly salty table round. And meats were not cooked to request and the servers forgot the eating utensils. I believe Rock Bottom needs some food warmer lamps under the order window or something. My spouse ordered a drink and since it was taking too long the server took it upon herself to make them their drink, but it was horrible. Let's just say there's a reason bartenders are the bartenders. Appreciate the effort, but we'd rather wait for the drink to be made properly. We also saw our server taking shots at another table and found it inappropriate to be drinking while working. Our group of friends also moved to the outdoors to get some air and my spouse apparently forgot their phone in our seating area, so I returned and there was another couple sitting there. I apologized and asked nicely if they have seen a phone, they said no and they offered to help me look. I then remember seeing someone lurking at our table so I approached several servers and asked about it and then I asked the hostess if anyone has seen a phone and the hostess searched and apologized and said no and if i leave my info at the desk they will call if anything turns up. I called the phone multiple times and it was already shut off when i knew it had sufficient battery. A server offered to go speak to the manager. It may seem ridiculous, but I did make a small scene searching for it. And it may seem rude but I had my suspicion it was one of the servers who took it. I was writing my information down and another server approached me saying one of the other servers found it and gave it to me.( And yup still shut off and if they had any intention to return it, it wouldn't have been shut off and when I turned it on it was set on mute.)  Obviously the one who took it did not want to confront me and apologize for "attempting to steal" my spouses phone. I was about to call the cops after writing my information down because of my suspicion and make a report, but didn't because we got it back and wanted to get the heck out of there and it left a bad taste in my mouth. It may be just a phone but it's the principle and respect of property and as a customer it was a disappointment. This is my FIRST review on yelp & most negative review on a restaurant personally. This place has reached Rockbottom.

NIsMTea6kvPKmkfLCMHLaA.text: I've visited Rock bottom many times, but recently went after the remodel. The restaurant looks much better. I ordered the southwest turkey burger (awesome) and my husband ordered the chicken tacos (awesome)! The service was superb! I think the remodel improved the dining experience.

3DRMAQWUa2-xkf9KIHTVVg.text: Visited long lost family in Charlotte, and at the last minute they decided that we should go to Rock Bottom instead of another restaurant we had reservations for. I didn't argue because I wasn't the one driving and I didn't really know better. Now I wonder what the other restaurant would've been like.  I was sold on Rock Bottom because my cousin said it has the best key lime cheesecake anywhere. I ordered some weird steak and shrimp combo and it was overcooked and forgettable. The martinis were decent tasting but not strong at all, and the service was dismal.   The cheesecake slice was giant and I required a take-out box for it, and the next morning it was pretty tasty. So... go there for a few martinis when they're on special and get some cheesecake if that's your thing, but don't expect to get in and out of there in under two hours.

IU3OlywQC2zdfWWFcQqMSw.text: Took my husband here and we simply had stellar service, amazing food and wonderfully crafted beers.  The staff went over and beyond to interact with us, including the bartender who was behind the bar with two tables in between where we were sitting. There was even some sort of traveling sports school event there with around 75 or more college students ordering at the same time as us, the place was extremely busy in all areas yet there wasn't a server or tender without a smile on their face, or a personality shining through. I must say. We had one of the best experiences we have ever had out anywhere in NC there at rock bottom. We were having such a good time when we paid the check we ordered 2 more drinks because we didn't want to leave.   I would highly recommend this restaurant and the jalapeno poppers!

6c08jNGoRz0d26zmFwXunQ.text: We like this place for casual lunches and dinners. It's right in the heart of downtown and it's huge--lots and lots of tables, along with a huge bar and plenty of outside seating--so it's pretty convenient for all sorts of days and times. It gets pretty crowded, especially during the lunch crunch, but because of its size, you'll never really have to wait all that long.   My girlfriend lives for their fish tacos, so if that's your thing, order away. I like their burgers and sandwiches--great club sandwich, good fish and chicken sandwiches, good reubens, great chicken finger sandwich. Roch Bottom features a lot of standard pub food, done up a little nicer than the options you'd find at most places. Though it's original, Rock Bottom has more of an Outback or Applebees feel than a pub. Not a bad thing.   They've got a great selection of beers, many of which are, obviously, their own creations. Try 'em all. They're really good.

-F5tym2F4OM6Rzsqr9ZBqw.text: It's spring, a warm breeze, you want to sit on a patio somewhere and have a beer, a good meal and hang out... this was the over whelming recommendation and they delivered.  I think Jennifer's review from aol was right on is stating "Rock Bottom Brewery is the Tom Hanks of Center City dining -- all-American, unassuming and very, very popular."  I went with a client and this spot has a little something for everyone (even home brewed root beer for those that don't drink - an excellent selection btw).  I sampled the burger and made me question my selection, however, I had to try the fish tacos because of the way they were served.  Side note, the only item I've ever loved on the taco bell menu was the double decker tacos because of the soft and hard shells... well this is the way their fish tacos are served, only with cheese holding the blue corn shell to the soft taco wrap.  I've had better fish tacos but this is still something I'd order again.    Lunchers tend to take their time and the service is always attentive, not pushy and generally very accommodating to the diner.  If you're in uptown and want a good beer (summer wheat and stouts were excellent), some americana fair or just a good spot to bring a client, this place is a great selection.  Enjoy

sbVksAeOHdCGECkFqfyaOQ.text: Awful. The whole experience was dreadful. The server is taking my check now. Appetizer plates are still on the table as well as the menus. We had to ask for refills each time. The server was nice but not very good. We had the pleasure of hearing a hostess yell "i shouldnt be doing this s!!! I'm a hostess". And finally, the food. A more expensive Applebees comes to mind. Chicken was chewy and had a nasty texture and we all had chicken. The bacon, chicken, and mac n cheese was highly recommended by the server. I thought it was ok at best. Wont be back.

BWg51pJDgJykEXnzPG8ehQ.text: The food is decent but the service was terrible. Our waitress didn't bring us silverware until 5 minutes after receiving our food. She also took 15 min to bring us the water we ordered when we sat down. I would not return to this place.

580YhVgzHfUfH7fnA01xfA.text: We stopped on in after an event at Discovery Place. It was relatively busy, as it was a Friday night, but the restaurant is huge and can accomodate many parties. They have a great bar/table area, and then more booths/tables towards the back of the restaurant. Right now they have a great deal going on for their beer samples where you get 6 samples for $5. Their menu offers a wide variety so it appeals to vegetarians, meat/burger lovers, those looking for smaller portions, and even has some good looking desserts as well. I had the waldorf chicken salad, which was pretty good. The baked apple crisps were a unique change from the norm. My husband had the 2 am burger, which comes with a fried egg, bacon and hashbrowns - it was a nice, thick burger and really appeals to you if you are hungry. The fries were ok - nothing special. Service was ok, as it took 20 minutes to get our beers delivered, but it was a busy Friday, and apparently the bar was low on glasses.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Waldorf salad with baked apple chips

qIR7EifcN3eb1hWlHTfYdQ.text: Hostess was not friendly. Establishment was not busy at all, decided to seat ourselves at the bar.  I got he blueberry lemonade and my friend got a martini. Both were nothing to write home about for $10.00 each.  There seemed to be an employee off the clock at he bar because she put in an order for herself by going behind the bar and enter it in the system. She was also handling some bottles, clearly not working with her purse and drinking at the bar.  This place just does not seem serious about business standards and drinks were weak.   Only came here because the martini bar we wanted to go to ended up being closed on Sunday's.

rF8hdGXzi-4xN4b8ivaWlg.text: When I tell you I will not be returning to Rock Bottom.....everything was horrible and the manager sucked ass.....chicken was completely raw and cold.......pastas was dry noodles stuck together and nothing was actually done about it......sad thing is it was a party of 13 for a bday dinner and everyone hated their meals......they was vacuuming right at our table while we were eating...THIS SHIT WAS COMPLETELY SAD

yLg1W_zEZl7Oz087YeCmdA.text: Great location downtown Charlotte, nice menu and wonderful Hand Crafted Beer Selection.  Sports bar atmosphere with quite a few TV's located around and a few Pool Tables too.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. T&amp;T

oJv7MlhreN-rESb4v9nZNw.text: My friends and I were spontaneously looking for a casual dinner last Saturday. Duckworth's Uptown was our first choice, but there was no hope of getting a table there with the college football crowd camping out, so we went across the street to Rock Bottom. I'd been there a couple times before, and figured our experience would be fine (if nothing to write home about).  The hostess told us we could seat ourselves in the bar area, so we did. I thought it was odd how many empty tables were in the bar area.  Then we waited. And waited. And waited. We asked for a server twice. I would have left at this point but half of our group was really hungry and I knew it would be tough to get a table at other nearby spots.   We did finally get a server, but I could tell she would have rather been anywhere else that night, and maybe she did go somewhere else because we didn't see much of her during our visit. Getting water took a long time. Getting cocktails took a long time. Placing an order took a long time. Our food (chicken sandwich, burger, salad, hot wings) took about an hour to arrive, and based on the temperate of my sandwich I'd guess it was sitting in the window for at least a quarter of that time. Getting our check took a long time.  I'd give only 1 star, but previous visits were acceptable.

EmUBigw-6-hdZoxy7oql8Q.text: I enjoyed my time at Rock Bottom. I had the fish and chips. My husband ordered stuffed peppers, and my friend had a chicken and avocado sandwich. All of us were pleased with our food. My husband was especially pleased with his stuffed poblanos.  All three of us ordered beer flights. I liked everything except for the IPA, which is normal for me (I'm not a big fan of IPAs). My favorite was the Black Velvet Lager.   Our server was on point. I was never left waiting for water refills, and he was friendly and efficient. Overall a very pleasant dining experience.

Pp74l6ro4ASdJk7tnpl2_Q.text: How do you not noticed that one of the people at the table did not receive their meal. The waitress who took the order said, well, other people delivered it. She took no responsibility. I asked specifically if the lobster and shrimp tacos had pieces of lobster in it. The waitress said yes. There were tiny pieces of what looked like artificial crab. No lobster.  One of our party had Caesar salad. Caesar salad should not be too spicy to eat.  I'd give it zero stars but Yelp won't let me.

mVodRiFDlUXox4Hi7mtWVQ.text: Our visit to Rock Bottom was a very nice to way to end a day of travel into Charlotte.  A tasty meal, a good beer, and a nice place? Check ,check and check.. almost.  The food was good, but nothing incredibly memorable. The asiago artichoke and crab dip appetizer was very tasty, but our burgers were nothing special.  I ordered their house beer, which had a nice flavor to it and went well with the food.  The restaurant itself has a nice brewhouse/restaurant atmosphere to it.  Servers were quite nice, and the service was prompt and efficient.  Personal tip: the outside patio is great during the daytime to watch the activity of downtown Charlotte, but after it gets dark, the people walking around get a lot sketchier.  Since your tables are next to the sidewalk, some of the nighttime folks may start messing with you.  Be warned.  Overall, though, this was a nice place to go and wouldn't mind going here again.

a44xtdeoTXSRQHoZQ3kQ2g.text: This Restaurant has a nice atmosphere and great drinks but I got chicken wings with no meat on them the wedge salad was good...

0XkURgtXW_vApYxYKde9iA.text: The servers here are good, and the place is gigantic so it has the convenience factor in terms of getting a table.  The food is mediocre pub food, and the beer is just ok for a place that advertises as a brewery.  It's a chain restaurant, and their beer outperforms other chains, but is still a cut below the really excellent breweries you can find elsewhere in Charlotte.

mkUFBPwqfRciTMHpKMktiw.text: Came here 2 days in a row because RIRa didnt want our bar business.  The food and drinks here are great....and the wait staff is friendly.  We will be back

VXJt5bVwd6uSWGQDgkApeg.text: Everything you want from a restaurant like this. Excellent comfort food and our server was great.

4gVtDsRXtO-MPI7h91w6lw.text: Took my Co worker out to eat.My bill came up to $28.97 but my credit card was charged for $70.00.l sign my credit paper for $28.00.call Restaurant back ask to speak to Manager that never happen. Who ever answered the phone told me last was only charged for $28.00 ,just kept on talking to me like last lied.Staff should be trained better than that.Also caused my account a overdraft fee,let knew how much longer could spend. Management stated it was a mistake but how long for a $28 dollar bill.

cj77kS9BNVuICzs03CDpPQ.text: Visited Rock Bottom at about 4:45 on a Saturday.  Was surprised at how busy they were but we were still able to be seated quickly in a large comfortable booth overlooking the street.  I started with the Summer Honey Ale.  Meh.  I think I was expecting a bit more of a sweet/honey flavor.  I wish I had tried one of their other beers.  It comes in a large glass (I think bigger than a typical pint serving).  I had the stuffed poblano peppers.  I was curious (dubious?) so I asked my server.  She said that the filling is awesome and that the bites with the peppers had a kick.  She was spot on.  I really enjoyed the cheesey, chicken-y, chorizo-y filing.  The rice around the peppers was good too and it definitely seemed like a hearty portion.  Eventually, with sweat running down the side of my face, I scraped the remaining filling out of the second pepper and just ate it.  I enjoyed my pepper bites but was ready to stop the heat.  Our group shared some of the ice cream sandwiches.  Childish?  Yes.  Tasty?  Surely.  The plate comes with three ice cream sandwiches made with chocolate chip cookies, some strawberries, and a bowl of chocolate sauce.  My only wish was that the cookies were a bit softer.  In texture and look, they were over done with just lent additional difficulty to eating the messy treat.  Our server was very good and took excellent care of us.

z4QNgSJrSOKMshsgsjDQgg.text: I went to the famed Rock Bottom the other night, Friday Dec. 2, 2011 to celebrate a good friend's birthday.  We ended up getting there around 7:45pm on a Friday night to find the place very alive with people, both young and old, carousing, socializing and being merry.    My friends and the party I was attending were stationed in the bar area, to the left as you walk in.  Though there was a jumble of people standing around drinking and talking, a server promptly noticed we were new to the scene and took our drink orders and provided us with a menu to look over.  I ordered a "light lager" for my girlfriend and a "Brown Ale" draft for myself.  Draft beers were running $4 per pint on Friday night; which certainly isn't bad, but isn't a deal by any means.   As evening turned into a chilly night, the people I was with found a few tables in the bar area and placed food orders.  I ordered, the BBQ pulled pork sliders as an appetizer, and some sort of lobster and shrimp rolled into a black corn enchiladas.  As a devout BBQ lover, I found the sliders to be an extreme disappointment.  The BBQ was border-line cold and there was very little BBQ on each of the sliders.  As for the enchiladas, the appeal of my meal was more in the uniqueness of the dish than its actual taste.  It's not that the enchiladas were bad, they just left me wanting more.  My girlfriend got the steak with mashed-potatoes and green-beans.  I thought the steak was above par.  My girl friend said it was cooked to her specifications.    Overall, I felt the food was good not great, and the BBQ sliders were not up to BBQ code.  However, Rock Bottom offered the perfect ambiance to enjoy myself and my friend's birthday in splendid fashion.  The service WAS GREAT!  I wish I could recall my server's name, because I would love to give her a shot-out.  Despite the chaotic atmosphere that reigned throughout the bar, she was prompt, polite and accurate with everything.  TIPS: *Nice, classy atmosphere, *Nice seating area outside  *Parking can be found by turning either way on 7th street, including in the garage attached to Rock Bottom itself (KEEP YOUR TICKET!!  BRING IT IN WITH YOU!  ROCK BOTTOM VALIDATES PARKING, SEE THE HOSTESS.)  *Stay away from the BBQ Sliders  *Great, friendly service  *Good for parties or pre-gaming before going out somewhere else

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sliders with cold-slaw.  I thought they were just ok; they did not come with a lot of pork.

PBybtphkho5rAw0jH0AC1w.text: I must say- this place, the food was really, really good. I probably would have given it 4 or 5 stars on the food alone. I ordered the grilled bruschetta chicken. Juicy and flavorful - excellent with the tomato and mozzarella. My friends' dinners looked really good as well- I had a bite of the bacon, chicken mac and cheese and the country fried chicken. Excellent food all around.   The problem with this place was our waitress in particular. Korin. She started off really sweet and cool.... And then went B*TCH on our table of 6. A bunch of rude comments and all and all unpleasant experience. My friend had ordered the house root beer before and when she took a sip this time, the root beer was flat and watered down. When the waitress was told, she immediately got defensive and said "it's our house root beer" so excuse me, it is supposed to be watered down and flat? My friend then said she had the root beer before and it tasted different. The waitress decided to blame the soda machine and check and get her another.   Her second mistake was when she came over to take our orders and said she would start with ladies first, the first lady she was talking about was chatting and the waitress said, "um, can someone tap her..."  The last and final mistake was that she mixed up all of checks or credit cards, I don't know what happened because when our cards were returned to us, we all had been charged the wrong bills! She didn't seem to know what to do, except suggest to run the cards again. But BLAMED US for the mix up and that we put our cards in the wrong bill. No! Rude rude rude!!!!  On our way out, I guess she had told the manager to cover her own behind.   I would go back for the food and that's about all I was happy with.

5WOLP3T1HenpVx2Yl2XU0g.text: Sitting here currently and the service SUCKS! Do not come here. Rock Bottom in Nashville is ten times better than this one will ever be. The beer is great, food is pretty good but waiting for beer for 15-20minutes and our server took 12 minutes to approach the table and has pretty much been absent after a couple of quick stops. Such a shame, the Nashville location is really amazing, with a great rooftop and great service. The Charlotte location, not even close! Oh yeah, and our order hasn't even been taken yet. SMH!

g6x8-riHzIhTwfQp8-VKVQ.text: Dropped in for lunch and was seated right away. This is my go to place for a quick meal. I've been back a couple of times and the service/food never fail. I ordered the chicken fried chicken, and bourbon pecan pie for dessert. Both tasted amazing!!!! The waiter kept on checking to see if everything was going well, and made sure I had everything that I needed. This place deserve a better rating! So, I hope my 5 stars will help :)

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken fried chicken. The right portion and perfectly seasoned.
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bourbon pecan pie. Delish!!!

esg2huywyaBDBSFcBE6w5Q.text: We were able to make reservations. The service was fast and we all ended up getting salads, which were fresh and delicious. The Rock Bottom brewed beer was pretty good as well.

9eT6vihofYv2syJY0zWXkQ.text: Awesome drinks and appetizers! Definitely recommend the margaritas! Dom was an absolute amazing waitress she gave us so much information about what to do in Charlotte and was very helpful! Would recommend this place for lunch or even just drinks !

2DiJFXVRTcnOP3IixS57YQ.text: I'm not quite sure how you completely run out of tequila and ginger beer on a Friday but that was just the beginning. We waited almost 20 minutes for water, another 10 to be told they didn't have certain things, and another 15 to receive our food. The staff are moving in slow-motion and seem like they're completely unaware of their surroundings.

9_ya-8fpJZJ-EUd6U98VDw.text: Me and a friend sat the bar to kill time before going to an event. Bartenders were really nice and helpful. They were really attentive too! Drinks were made just right and really refreshing. My friend wanted a white russian and they told her they didn't have all the ingredients so she got something else. They told her that her first drink was on them due to the issue. She was super pleased with that.   We were a little hungry so we got a salsa stack. It's only $2 during happy hour. It's homemade chips with pico, beans, corn and fresh avocado. It was so good!! Chips were crispy. The salsa was very fresh and the avocado was perfect. It was the perfect little snack.  To top off our visit, we saw Muggsy Bogues there too!

RlaqdZ3dBKuQ1yCyCtjJSw.text: Terrible service. Weak drinks. Waited over 20 minutes for our check. Will not come back.

XT6XSYRoMxMmL6_bZZw7Kg.text: I was kinda disappointed with Rock Bottom's lunch spread. We've eaten dinner here before and were happy with the service and food. We didn't want to wait for a long service so we opted for bar seating. I was surprised to see such an abbreviated lunch menu. Of course, they were out of the shrimp po boy I wanted, will have to come on another day for that. I went with the chicken spinach flatbread while the bf went for the Tuscan pasta. We waited for a little while but, were brought hot food. I found the chicken spinach flatbread bland and very dry, I think this would be solid lunch food if it came with some sauce or dip. The olive oil by itself does not cut it. The Tuscan pasta was a lite pasta with diced tomatoes, had a mild but, good flavor.   I doubt I'll come back and order the lunch specials at Rock Bottom, best to stick to the actual entree options and brews. Cheers!

odPb8SrCa9XQfKaRkpUZ5Q.text: The staff was able to accommodate a large party (approx 20) people for a birthday, overall I would say I thoroughly  enjoyed the atmosphere. Had the chicken tacos which were actually good. Would give them between 3-4 stars and the service 5 stars. Uptown Amber was 5stars

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

R0kIk2UrByH6lYO4BqSnww.text: Something for everyone; that's the title I would give rock bottom. I love the food and selection. My favorite item on the menu is the Cajun Pasta. It's a spicy rendition with onions, celery, green peppers, chicken, Andouille and shrimp and this delectable Cajun cream sauce with bread on the side. I always have enough for lunch the next day because it's a huge portion and the best part is that it's not dry.   They have recently updated and remolded the restaurant and menu. I like the enhancements of both. The menu has finger foods that are sure to get you by and crafted entrees to fill up before heading out.   The bartenders are creative and can provide what's on the menu and even what's not. They have a really nice flight special that you can sample a few before making a decision or make a date tasting out of it.   The location is not ideal but if you are Uptown for an event the food is better than your traditional white glove five star restaurant. On the weekends this place can get a little busy so be prepared however it is definitely worth the wait.

CevDRoPmlScUYe9MMJ4jPw.text: I gave this place one star because I walked in at 9:30 and the bartender said that they close in 30 min. Why does the sign say 11:00??? That is not cool!!  I also watched a couple came in and was ignored. If the hours are posted, at least try to adhere to those hours. So rude!  That's fine, our party went to Duckworth across the street and had a great time.

fYc6pBa8s8CFX9HalHa78Q.text: Yummy!  I had the nachos with chicken.  I love that the chips came on a big plate so it felt like each chip had the appropriate amount of toppings. Loved the salsa it tasted fresh. Service was good as well and restaurant was very clean

MrLuUU_Ee8n2AbFr-7yQWw.text: Wow what a great spot . Didn't try all the food because I had dinner earlier but a great ambiance and the bartender was nice, informative. Will be back !!!

lZHgiwJdxB1CHxRLwDhiwg.text: Wow! I just walked out of Rock Bottom. Here's the scenario: waiting for 2 friends and the start of the Panthers game, Bar area is about 3/4 full.....I sat at a bar table.....waited about 7 minutes with no sign of a server.....went to the bar and ordered....waited about 8 minutes.....bar tender seemed to forget about me.....walked out the door and across the street to Duckworth's.....great service

Y1BnMdjccvGjowa5aeti3A.text: An amazing experience. An extra large beer selection and so many beers on draft. The menu is huge and a great selection of burgers, tacos, chicken and steak. The quesadilla app. was amazing and the chicken fried chicken was filling and cooked perfectly and if you love Mac and cheese they have a huge dinner entree that is perfect for you. It's downtown Charlotte so you have a lot of business workers and it's gets pretty loud so don't bring the kids no kids menu. But the beer and cocktail menu was amazing and definitely had a fun time and can't beat $3 drafts

XABUd-S7rDh5nVNL6hOLKA.text: Came here with my friend and boyfriend we got two appetizers to share which was PLENTY of food. We had the nachos with added chicken they were delicious and the jalapeno breadsticks. The flights of beer were only $6 which was great and they write the name of the beer you're drinking which is a bonus. The reason for the missing star in my review is the service was lacking. They took a long time to come over to us we were sitting there watching every waiter/waitress go by for a while until someone came to us. We even walked up to the bar and asked if we had to order from them.
