waeIeyOzSEhjMzBKHgSRMA.text: On my first visit to Rock Bottom I must say it was a very good experience. None of the usual inattentive waitresses or appetizers that arrive at the same time as your entree. I fact the waitress (Elisa) even asked if we'd like a delay of time between the appetizer and entree which arrived a few minutes after we finished our appetizer. My wife ordered the Chicken Mac which was very flavorful, extra cheesy and moist. I had the Fireman Signature burger (medium rare) which was cooked exactly how I like it. I'd also recommend the Charlotte Gold craft beer, it was fantastic. Lastly, all (except for drinks) of it was delivered to our table by the General Manager who brought out the kids meal first after stating that he was sure the kids were hungrier and needed their food first.  I was very impressed.

Th2vduh0hnyTyFHYplvXgw.text: Subpar on a good day.  The quality of the food and service goes down year after year.  I don't even know why I come back hoping for a difference result.  Is that the definition of insanity! I assume the bar for a happy hour is fine but for a meal, appetizers, or a sit down dinner go anywhere else.

PhxPkxgdtLprpsDVbrZy7A.text: This place is pretty much lackluster ...  To start it's absolutely filthy, hands prints are literally on everything. The bathroom was disgusting and looked like it never had been cleaned, I was scared to even use it.  The server was nice but couldn't even tell us what was in the sauce that came on a simple burger.( maybe she was new?) She was also really slow and it took an incredibly long time just to get a another water. Food wasn't terrible but some of our burgers were missing ingredients. The host did notice us looking around for our server and came over to help us, he actually did a better job taking care of us than our server... no offense to her because she was really sweet but was very uniformed and slow. Thanks, Matthew!! He's the only reason the review gets 2 stars.

wPLL14UcdBjoss2YzYpUzA.text: Very disappointing.  Since last time we ate there, the menu was much larger.  Probably only 1/4 to 1/3 the number of menu items now.  Food  was not particularly tasty.  Guacamole was good.  Used to be a favorite for pre-theater or concert.  Not anymore.

A-KlWWSLSE6FHZwkiwZd2g.text: If you have plans to go to this restaurant in the future I'm sorry to say that you will not be able too. Rock Bottom is officially CLOSED for good. One of the oldest running brewery in Charlotte is no more. Yesterday was their last day of business. It was a heart breaking scene watching the doors close and managers locking the locks for the last time. Losing a restaurant that has been in Charlotte for over 20 years just makes you think which place will close next.

q_g9yU__6omnuVf-QJ4Ekw.text: So ordered rock bottom and it is the rock bottle of the restaurants. I ordered a half Cesar salad and the traditional wings to go. Once i got my food at home my order was completely wrong,. My salad had three leaves of lettuce and the salad was one of the worst Cesar i have had. The 3 leaves were completely dry and tasteless.So upon just throwing my money away. Open my box and find boneless wings and not what i ordered.  I called back one of the 2 times. Someone answered the 1st time and then they placed me on hold and hung up.  I called back and no answer. I repeated this 5 times and no answer.  Biggest wast of time and money. Do yourself a favor and skip rock bottom.

HKtLN5SXgTC4I-jU9jtphg.text: I went to Rock Bottom with a few of my friends and i will say for a restaurant and micro-brewery my Long Island Iced Tea was sufficiently strong and was quite a treat. We were seated quickly for a Saturday night with no reservation and there didn't seem to be much of a wait, unless you had a larger group of people. We tried to call for a larger group previous to this date and there apparently is a cutoff time for calling ahead for larger groups.  Our service was very good and easy on the eyes which is always a pleasant factor when dining, considering the people who can be spotted in various North Carolina locales. Our food was fresh and nicely seasoned. I had the jambalaya which had a good amount of spiciness for a creole type dish. On the menu there were various other choices like macaroni and cheese, vegetables, pretzels for appetizers, etc.   I will return to Rock Bottom for both food and for drinks, hopefully catching a large table before they are all taken up.

PK_G_VMse3celUQU4Bu1rQ.text: I visited around 2 p.m. on a Friday afternoon. The place was not busy.  Many empty tables.  I ordered Jambalaya. It was warm and  good tasting.  Dessert was great.  Staff was friendly.  Enviroment was pleasant.  It took awhile for me to get my food.  I ordered coffee and I had to wait to get a refill.  They had enough help in my opinion. Waiting to get my order is the reason I did not give a five star rating.  I will come back and eat here again.

9f1UArsfQ-5vH-89K79_XQ.text: I like bottom but I like there older menu better. For example I miss the sausage meatloaf vs the new turkey one they replaced it with. Doesn't wow me like the other did. They lose a star with this updated menu.

Yz_gPg8m_8f9UF9e4FjChQ.text: Fantastic food and even better service!! Nachos with chicken is best is town. Sangria margarita is yummy.  You have to check this place out. Ask for Ryan-amazing!! Can't go wrong here-especially if Ryan is helping you.

Ao8by8aWcDX9DeCI-DcdVw.text: By far my favorite restaurant to eat at in all of Charlotte! I refuse to try anything other than their fish tacos! Everyone that I have visited the restaurant with raves about their burgers but the fish tacos are by far the best I have ever had! The beer that is brewed within the restaurant/brewery is also delicious and I make sure to get the beer sampler every time I go so that I do not have to pick just one. The atmosphere is also a huge highlight. Part of the restaurant is a laid back, sports bar type of restaurant while the other half has a swanky feel to it. You can definitely go in jeans and a t-shirt or dressed up for a night on the town and be comfortable. The bathrooms are always cleaned and are regularly checked and the service has never been poor. Sometimes, I consider driving the 2 hours just to go! Make sure to check out this place next time you are in Charlotte!

wwzoBJNQPekL36Gr5NXW7g.text: Get to the Chase:  Pros: 1) Fantastic ribs! Succulent, juicy, and came right off the bone 2) Exceptional service (I think I saw our waitress spend half the time on her hands and knees wiping off crumbs and food that other customers left under their table)...I have never seen a restaurant where that happened...not only that she was always genuinely smiling and making sure we had fresh water 3) Fantastic beer selections (would highly recommend the beer sampler) 4) First time I actually LOVED coleslaw...perfect balance of slaw, mayo, and tangy sweetness (accented by the freshly cut slivers of apple) 5) Desserts do equal justice to their delicious entrees  Cons: 1) None

6tt81XRjG4v0aTTRF5g7kw.text: Perfect. Food was perfectly cooked. Great brews. Nice atmosphere. Reasonable prices. Loved our waitress, Alex. Will definitely return.

_3McfWlCTzuTikp_-X_wlg.text: This is a really nice place! They have a nice variety of food and cocktails. My man always wants the bacon Mac n cheese and I enjoy the Cajun pasta. So many good things about Rock Bottom. Try them out!

AT6a1oCd_7IqLwXHukXaog.text: The red ale was really great.   Attentive staff and friendly environment.   I recommend the Reuben.  Their location brings in a lot of tourists.

wsEGzXH8w95IADGIvs2t-w.text: We absolutely LOVE the food here. However we had family in town and brought them here and the service was terrible. It's embarrassing the service was so bad after we have been talking this establishment up for so long. The food took forever but was delicious once we received it. The server was Ami and had zero desire to be there and really wasn't in the mood for our party of eight.

h7f_IK2CAgXLoua93QyXCA.text: Had a large gathering here last night between two different companies. Staff blocked off the area and put signs up indicating it was a private party. Food was warm and drink service was great. Seemed like there was always a server ready to refill drinks. In fact, they had several servers assigned to our group, which was great. Music wasn't super loud and lights dimmed as night hit.  Good experience, no complaints

40PBI_3DlDxT2I0NLr41gQ.text: The stars are only for the brews.    Badly overcooked salmon which was devoid of any evidence of the rumored Bourbon glaze.  The Grilled broccoli side was steamed   Rice had been on the steam table too long.  Best part of rhe meal was the salad even though it took two tries for the waitress to bring the right dressing.  Just walk past this place and choose anywhere else in  this "restaurant district".

G6zqDIDYe1InkQDnzR1ENg.text: The ONLY reason this place gets two stars and not one is because our server was fantastic: he split our bills no problem, didn't screw up water orders, put up with a colleague's silly antics, and got our food to us promptly.   The food was bad, yo. Like, below Applebee's bad. We split an order of guacamole. For $8.50, you get a tiny dish of it and a bunch of chips in a little bucket. What a crock. The guacamole was fine, but for $8.95, you can go to Vida over at Epicenter and get (as I wrote in a previous review) a veritable fuck-ton of it prepared tableside.  I also ordered the Southwestern Turkey burger. It sounded delightful - peppers mixed in with the meat, jack cheese, fried jalepenos - but tasted like garbage. The meat was tasteless but spicy, the jalepenos were in five tiny bits on top of the burger, the cheese was like plastic. The bun was overly bread-y. I ordered with a side of fruit, which was disappointingly not fresh.  My colleagues complained that their food sucked too: overly dry burger for $10 and a dried out piece of salmon for $18.50. What the fuck.  People, don't go here unless you want to get ripped off and eat shitty food.

da4qdDsGPJAmPegGVQMaJQ.text: Pretty good, not bad, but nothing I would crave or get excited about so, a solid 3 stars in my book.   Friendly service and seemed like a good place for huge groups (there's no way any one there could have missed the giant family reunion here where everyone wore the exact same patterned clothing in shirt or dress form!)   Food was good, pretty good pizza (too thin and floppy for me), jambalaya was pretty good, spicy, and was made with orzo pasta.   Parking didn't seem like too much of a pain, there was a lot across the street and a garage attached to the building. Overall, it was pretty alright.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

B8gLggB3WKLJTLPTiLFQJQ.text: As I work in the immediate vicinity of Rock Bottom's, I dine (or take out) there at least once a week.   The food there is glorified over priced bar food. It is almost impossible to spend under $10 for lunch there.  That said, the sandwiches are reasonably good, as are the fries. Some rave about their mac & cheese, but I wasn't impressed. Gluey and tasteless.  I've had to send back burgers on more than one occasion to get it to the ordered temperature.   I do like their chicken sandwiches a lot. A nice sized portion with tasty options. The salads are also quite good, but too big. I'd be happy to pay half price for half the salad.  Overall, good, not great.

8BDGFJOWPKxq-QMAhTnkmQ.text: This place was just awesome. The waitress was super nice. The food was very great. Everyone was happy with what they had. Chicken sandwich, pulled pork sandwich, and a chicken salad. Amazing nachos - they are huge! Would definitely come back here.

VAnQ_OJHsd-5OYx0z6YTLw.text: Well let's start off with the front door. Very nice staff. Hello and greetings all around. Wait staff on the ball. Ok now that Jalapeno Burger I had. If you want hot this is it. Dang it was good. The wife took one bite and started to cry. NOW THAT IS A BURGER. Now the wife had the Markers Mark burger but they didn't cook it medium like she asked. She says she's had better. Well I am raving on the Jalapeno Burger. Will be going back. Oh yea get the beer flight. 5  6oz glasses of good beer types and the price of one 16oz beer. Well ok close to that price. Can not wait to go back. Will have a Zantac before I go.

KNIxMIQ4GCnxekX4U9pEEg.text: The beer was pretty good, but the food was a real disappointment. I have always enjoyed the beer at Rock Bottom and miss their location in Atlanta (Buckhead). We sent back the guacamole because it was warm from sitting under a heat lamp. I had the pizza and it was mediocre at best.  The wings were fine, but nothing special.  The restaurant was busy, but wasn't packed.   Our food took a long time to come out.  We were sitting near the kitchen and could see a number of items sitting under the heat lamps for 15 minutes.  It seemed like the kitchen was putting the food out fast enough, but the servers weren't getting the food to the tables.

JafD869hwdiQyn4V8OQ6KQ.text: A friend and I had dinner at Rock Bottom on a Saturday evening prior to attending an event at Spirit Square.  The bright red signage makes it easy to spot (we parked at the 7th St garage and it was a short walk).  Surprisingly when we arrived at 5:45, there was already a 30 minute wait (Bobcats game, Panthers game tomorrow, a few other "events" in addition to the small venue concert that we were going to were going on).  But True to what the hostess said, exactly 30 minutes later our buzzer buzzed.    Lovely restaurant, although very dark.  And when walking to the restroom, I though I was being led out into an alley, it's a hike.  Wide selection of menu items, it was hard to decide what to get.  Comfy seating.   We decided on the Jalapeno Spinach Cheese Dip which is served with tortillas to start with.  It was DELICIOUS.  Creamy and cheesy, the tortilla chips held up to dipping without breaking and they weren't overly salted.  The dip had a little bit of a kick to it without being overwhelming.  Very good start.  I ordered the 2:00 am burger, which is a burger topped with a fried egg, cheese and bacon, with a hashbrown underneath and mac n' cheese as a side (mac n' cheese is an upgrade from the fries side, so you'll be charged a buck for this - it says it clearly on the menu, so no big...).  The burger was meh - not bad by any means, but lacking flavor.  I ended up asking for some ketchup to try and do something to it.  The bun held up well to all of the toppings though, so I didn't even up with a soggy mess on my plate that I would need to eat with a knife and fork, so points for that.  The mac n' cheese was very good.  Nothing fancy, but well done.    The food was more of a 3.5, but our waitress was amazing, great service even with a packed house, so I will go with a 4.  If another Spirit Square event comes up, I would definitely eat here again.

iXIgBe04dXEunCdEVMgs-g.text: We had the following items and they were great!!! Artichoke crab dip Mac and chicken Black bean quesadilla w/chicken Chicken tenders Kids "build your own Sundae" dessert

yYjUOiE7YFtGoXROYTU_Ug.text: Stopped in for lunch a couple of weeks ago. My sister has a gluten allergy and was given a menu, however our server didn't bother to write our order down and I had a feeling it was going to be messed up somehow. And what do you know, our order was delivered to our table 20 minutes later and there was a bun on her chicken sandwich. I was angry at this point and we had it sent back to the kitchen to be remade. The manager returns 5 minutes later with a new sandwich and offers us $10 off our next meal. I was suspicious about the food being delivered so soon but my sister ate it anyway -- the next day she broke out in a rash and had stomach pains because her food was contaminated.

ONWjvTpQCwOKcVi--xe57g.text: We had the worst experience at this place! It ruined our first visit in Charlotte. Their service was horrible and I would never go to any Rock Bottom!

j0ujep6Hta2-3L5ktlqUvA.text: Average bar food, nothing to write home about. Corn tortillas average salad. Average...just average. Go support a local place that offers something different

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish taco appetizer

3HEx6dtgDAKHECbP0coU_g.text: I never go uptown just to eat here, but if I'm already uptown I come here frequently. Their beer is OK and they have all of the bases covered to suit beer tastes. Their menu covers many styles.  I had the shrimp enchiladas the other day and it really hit the spot.  I've been here with groups and have received good service and the checks have always been accurate and the food is always served with a smile. Parking is convenient in the lot right below and they validate.

DYuX7mb-gvhjuvSf1U3Zkg.text: Worst place ever. Glasses were dirty and the services was horrible very horrible. Stay far away from this place

LrR_7eaDFkrZoMX4JOJLcw.text: I have been here more than once but the food has gone down hill since I last dined here. The beer is great with lots of different choices and menu gives good details about the flavors. I had a steak, which was cooked to order but I have had much better quality steaks at other restaurants for less. The broccoli was terrible. Service was okay, with friendly staff. I would much rather pay $60+ for at a much nicer restaurant. I don't really plan to go back anytime soon.

5GBjRilzOHj8VsVTBreg5w.text: This place was one of those that kept impressing me. I had the chicken stuffed peppers-awesome, Kathy had a personal pizza-awesome, Tori had bacon mac and cheese-again awesome. To drink a had the 6  sample flight of micro beers-good to see 3/4 full juice glasses and not just a shot glass amount like so places. Kathy had a margarita also very good. To finish we had toffee cheese cake in a mason jar-killer and coffee. The waitstaff was good, bathroom clean, good room temp and loved seeing the vats for making their own micro beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great to see these!

RQIx0aFXrD-qShcQeT2QPA.text: The food was good and the prices were really good for the area the restaurant is at; we went on Friday night and it was nice. The server was very nice and attentive but we waited an hour for our food, which made the experience not a very enjoyable one.

QRHOSUT5dV_Br0hjMBftDg.text: This place has a mixed Menu..I had the 2am Burger which was very delicious and I was extremely full afterwards.  It had Bacon, hashbrown and a fried Egg for the topping. ..hence the name 2am. My Mom had the Fish and chips which were also tasty.  The sauce that came with it I could of skipped. The Fries are regular shoestring fries and nothing spectacular. They do bring Malt Vinegar to the table to doctor them up. We watched the World Cup game so it was a bit busy however our food was out in 15 minutes and yes the fries were hot!.  The waiter was helpful with the menu items and very pleasant.  I will definitely be going back to try the Stuffed Peppers which came highly recommended.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2am Burger was Delicious and very filling!

4rxwyFEzKs6PhztquTicYg.text: My wife and I went here last weekend, it was really good.  We were just going to sit at the bar and have a drink but someone ordered pizza next to us and it looked awesome.  We ordered a pizza and new people sitting next to us started asking us about the pizza.  The food was good, the bar tenders were nice and the beer was good.  We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pizza his and hers

4fJ29I-nVpvkctCzBejYNw.text: Their beers are really good, I just wish the food was that great too. I ordered the bacon chicken mac and cheese, which instantly got my mouth watering just thinking about it. I ate a little bit, but I didn't want to finish it. Way too much pepper or spices, and I could hardly taste the cheese. It would be better if they didn't label it as a mac and cheese, because it didn't taste like that at all to me. It came with a slice of french bread on the side, but it was plain. No butter on it or any on the side. Kinda weird.  My sister raved about her hazelnut crusted chicken, but I wasn't too impressed by that either. I ended up just drinking my dinner, which is just fine by me! :)

uZw6UVY1OAKgw-DDMFq7aA.text: We came here 10 minutes before the kitchen closed and we were starving 11:50pm. The staff treated us like ROYALTY and we were served by 4 different staff with nothing but absolute politeness. And also, the beer and food was fantastic. Would come back 100%

hL6ult_2_5PaCxhTGpWXlw.text: A very nice brewpub - a recent and extensive renovation provides great atmosphere.  Blue cheese bacon burger was excellent.  Their brews are very well balanced and enjoyable - something on tap for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sample flight of what&#39;s on tap - label placemat is a nice touch.

fODfHGCLHQHN1yjCbJkP9Q.text: Went for a late night dinner. They catered to my  low sodium needs. My salad was amazing! My captions were all happy with their food!

0OeXJATVvzKtC8_i_5y7gA.text: The food and beer selection here is great. Not my favorite local beers but they definitely hit the spot. It's usually pretty crowded but the wait time isn't bad if you're flexible about sitting outside. I'll be back to try more of their foods. I will say skip the macaroni and cheese - it's mostly grease and breadcrumbs.

OSEqnu73f-hY6VqlZ3y2GA.text: I had a good experience.  I came with family and everyone enjoyed their meal.  I can't say it was spectacular, or that it's a must whenever I visit the area, but overall a good meal.  Oh and they'll validate your parking so thats a plus.

0QubESI_pfGyS0NT9X4uLw.text: I go here maybe once or twice a year since they have a BOGO coupon in the Citipass book but that's really the only thing enticing me to go. They have a nice patio area where you can sit back, relax, people watch and enjoy some humdrum food. Only complaint-random, crazy people screaming about Jesus and the noise from the Gold Rush and other CATS buses. Last time I went, our server was very sweet but it took almost 30 minutes for our lunch to make it out. I ordered a chicken sandwich and french fries-were they killing the chicken in the back?? I kept watching servers go by with other peoples food, practically salivating over the plates of french fries since I gave it up for Lent and just wanted one fry to make me happy. Thank God I didn't order their fish tacos (which I've heard are fantastic) because they probably would have had to go catch the fish to make it)  I heard they validate parking which is a pretty nice touch if you don't live or work in the Uptown area. You have to park in the parking deck either below or on the side of RB.  I like it for after work drinks as well but besides that, as Stephen K said, easy to enjoy and easy to forget.

7jBKxClCyz9T9G_k1oLZDw.text: Love this place. You get to experience the city without spending a thousand dollars. Lol  it is very clean and great food. You can sit indoor or outdoor. They validate your parking so you don't have to pay.

_-6XL34crrN1ytFg-PV1Hw.text: This rock bottom doesn't disappoint. They really need to consider a nicer hostess but the service is usually great from the different servers I've had over the years.  I love the chicken mac n cheese and beer choice with it. I even tried replicating it at home. Good place for food uptown.

-juglosXaH911xhb_Lb-SQ.text: Great bar type food. Loved the fries and chicken tenders. The restaurant is beautiful on the inside, and the staff is friendly! Our waiter had us cracking up!

tcbCAy1eVaaHkYEfvpSGbQ.text: I don't remember why I started this review and never finished,  but I do remember it not being a good experience.

7NZ90WfN27aguKFsObaGOA.text: Mert's so bad I decided to ignore Rock Bottoms reviews and come here for carrot cake to go. Waited 30 minutes plus time it took to walk over in midst of rowdy but friendly people at bar. I didn't know you can mess up carrot cake that should be standard at all Rock Bottoms. Got a hard brick w questionable sauce.

bTaWqb1S0vHeS3QYCWkGCg.text: This restaurant was so disappointing. I can forgive the horrible service because I think they were a little overwhelmed with all of the people in town for a concert but the chicken on my taco was so dry, I could hardly eat any of it. Very disappointing.

V49MlnHlzaHR7louEiB6hQ.text: A group of 7 of us went there this past weekend for lunch before the big college football game.  How was it? In a single word: Awful.  1) Told we'd wait 20 minutes for a table but saw other people being seated who got there after us - including a party of 8 people.  Finally got seated after 45 minutes but ONLY because we said something to the hostess and pointed out to her a set of three small tables that had sat empty for 10 minutes that we could join together for our party.  2) It took FOREVER to get drinks, much less order our food and get that in a timely manner.  We were very patient with anyone who came to our table to help, knowing that they were swamped - but we kept having to remind folks that we didn't have our drinks yet, or that we hadn't ordered yet, or that we still needed forks/knives so we could eat our food.  3) Wait staff was abysmal. As I said in the last bullet point, when our food was delivered, we had to ask for knives and forks to eat our food.  Even after the restaurant emptied out as the start time for the college football game approached, wait staff timeliness was still terrible. Our waitress would disappear completely to the point where we wondered if she'd ever come back.   4) The ONLY saving grace was that the food itself was not the worst.   The appetizers and entrees all arrived at the same time because our apps order wasn't put in when we placed the initial order, so it made for crowded conditions on the tables.  All total we were there for 2 1/2 hours because seating took forever, service was horrifically slow, and it was complete chaos.  I've lived in the CLT area for more than 10 years and the last time I went to this place I seem to recall it wasn't too bad.  My how times have changed.  I will NEVER go to this place again - and I don't recommend it for anyone.

P2kjYmRU-VdQxbd6ZoT6SQ.text: Rock Bottom is CLOSED.  Unfortunately the poor service in the past few years caught up.  Hopefully something better will replace it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rock Bottom is CLOSED

Vycl-W7kjWAzF8xHC38f7w.text: The food is amazing. But the service was the worst I've had in 2018.  The beer was phenomenal. The burger and steak was incredible. Shrimp was amazing. But the service literally pissed me off enough to write a review. I would've done a 5 star review in a heartbeat based on the food. But I got ignored practically the whole time I was here. I had to chase down the waitresses for drinks and food. It was pathetic.  I really wish I could give this place a good review, but it legitimately was the worst service I've had this year.

4mZ7ePjpXAItemC0tWJr-w.text: Best nachos! It's a must to stop by and the environment is very welcoming. The music is great also!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

zcNeggRzHAKY90ikHYaGWQ.text: I must admit, I've only ever been to Rock Bottom with a coupon, but it's the reason why I keep coming back. If you sign up for their rewards club you get an email with a coupon (usually a buy 1 get 1 free entree coupon) maybe every other month. They also run food/drink specials so be on the look out for that (this past summer they did 2 burgers/sides/2beers for $17. Can't beat that!).  I've tried a variety of different food options here and everything has always been pretty decent. The nachos are HUGE and a great starter if you come with a group. The tacos and shrimp/lobster enchiladas are my husband's and I's go to picks. However I recently got the bourbon salmon and it was delicious! We always get a side of mac-n-cheese. It's pretty darn good here. Overall the food is OK and a little above par from your typical sports bar.  The only down side-  I don't really care for their beers, but they have others available as draft or bottles. In addition, their service can be hit or miss. We never come here with high expectations, but it's within walking distance from our house and if we have a coupon it's worth it.

iUfzWdD5FrtIK2NHDc5rLA.text: Meh. We didn't have reservations, we came in at 5:30pm on Saturday night so we sat at the bar. The place has a good atmosphere and was packed. I made the mistake of using the bathroom before ordering my food. The bathrooms were gross, the stall doors has nasty finger marks and white crud pasted all over them. Seriously, like a porno was shot in there.   This is a brew pub and you can see the brewing tanks by the bathrooms and to the side of the main dining room, they do give tours to diners. Due to diet restrictions, I had a vodka & club, it was mostly ice. I ordered the blackened fish tacos. They weren't blackened and covered in remoulade, I really question why I ate them. I couldn't eat the beans and rice and the bartender substituted that for vegetables. I think it was soggy slimy fried apples and sweet potatoes, but who the heck knows (not even the bartender knew what it was). I did eat the Brussels sprouts that were mixed in. My husband had a burger, nothing to write home about. We will take a pass on this place, just not good enough to chance again.

Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZiUUFRgeUQkffBx5eBbpKw.text: Here for work and first time as well never heard of this place. Came for lunch and the service was fantastic. I sat the bar and spilled sauce all over my shirt and the bartender immediately (without asking) gave me a towel with club soda. I'm vegan and the chef came out and spoke to me and made me,maybe the best vegan burger (on a pita) that I've ever had. The chimichurri provided was an awesome touch!  I will be back again!

2ywEYNiW8vYn_bUPvpp5Yw.text: Burgers for kids were perfect. Burgers for adults were overcooked on the outside and rare in the middle. Service was slow at the beginning but improved once the server came by. The host didn't say more then 2 words to us. This is the 2nd time we have had a less than an ideal experience here. Not sure we will be back.

H9CPoB9ya9UHfo5AZrYhIQ.text: Another day Roaming around Uptown Charlotte and i seen this spot. When coming in the staff was very pleasant. I had lunch at the bar my bartender kat was very helpful when it came to recommending something to eat. I had the makers mark burger with the Mac and cheese I was paired with the $3 wheat beer. I must say this is one of the best places I have eaten at yet

glaorsDcAT5qGSoTTZ8D3g.text: Very bad customer service. Walked in around 10:45 pm on a Friday night(2/8/19). Stood at the host stand for 5 minutes. No one greeted us, spoke to us. Servers just walked by with no eye contact or any type of greeting.  Would never recommend this to anyone!

nTI5tQG9YUByWbsDxU4FBg.text: A friend and I stopped by Rock Bottom after seeing an event called, "Cheers with the Brewer" where they were advertising their holiday cocktails and providing complimentary appetizers. When we arrived we were automatically greeted by a hostess who found out for us where we needed to sit for the event. She told and lead us to where we were to sit and after a few minutes a waiter came and greeted us. He gave us the menus and list of specialty cocktails. I decided on the peppermint bark martini and my friend got their eggnog. The martini was amazing! I love that it was coated with a chocolate rim with peppermint pieces and a candy cane. All of the flavors came together sooo well and you could taste the peppermint, chocolate, and vanilla!   The appetizers started coming around and all of them were amazing, especially the chicken and waffle "taco", which was a breaded and lightly sweetened piece of white chicken. We also tried their brushetta, which was topped with mushrooms and a light white cheese. Also, we tried their jalapeno poppers, which was an entire jalapeno stuffed with cojita cheese and lightly breaded.   My dinner was the ale chicken, which was just okay. I was not impressed by the chicken or the grilled vegetables, but I really liked the black beans which jad cojita cheese sprinkled on them.   Overall the service was good and the drinks were as well. I think it is worth returning to try again, but just another type of dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Amazing peppermint bark martini!!

LpdHluulj5V82iflLxiBMg.text: Aww, poor service made this review a 3 star. We are theater goers and how awesome that Rock Bottom gives free apps for those with tickets. So, we made our way there before our show last night (Hamilton!!), and the guy that seated us was pleasant and kind. Our waitress came over got our drink order (Dr. Pepper and Diet Coke), we put our app in, and after she came back with the app we put our food order in and by then we needed a refill on drinks. The waitress said she would be right back with them. Our food order came out from a person in the back, and us thinking she was coming back with the drinks we said, "we were fine." We are half way done still no drinks and no waitress in sight. My friend goes to the bar to refill our drinks (no apologizes from the bartender...patrons should not be getting their own drinks!). We finish our meal, still no waitress. (What's the point of having bottomless fries if you never see your waitress again?!?) My friend then goes and ask the guy at the hostess stand if we can speak to someone. He tells the waitress we need her. She finally comes to the table, saying "I didn't forget about you." Clearly she did. We explained we had to go get our own drinks and she said "sorry" and brought us the check. The 3 stars actually go to our food. The bacon wrapped poppers were delicious, her pizza looked amazing, and my bacon cheddar burger was cooked perfectly.  Sadly, there are just too many choices in Charlotte that if you can't keep up with your tables we can find another restaurant.

jOh75CTi44zmzpudPupXuQ.text: The food was ok, several people in my party had a cold food. We asked to have it heated. Our server Tiffany was not very attentive to us. We felt like we had to beg for utensils and we were never checked on. Poor service. Won't be back anytime soon.

luHszN4wPU5vExo3Ko1byg.text: I really like this place a lot. My favorite entree is the Texas ribeye. It is amazing. The steak is always cooked perfectly and I never need steak sauce. I get the ribeye with mashed potatoes and green beans. Also, I usually add some type of drink from the bar and I'm happy. The staff has always been pleasant and this location usually has some form of musical entertainment on Friday and Saturday nights. This just takes the atmosphere to better level. I'll be back.

T061NI62zb4o2mTtlm0MqQ.text: We arrived at 9:11pm. We were given a "late night" menu, consisting of six selections. It took around 25 minutes to receive wings and burgers. The bacon on the burger was raw. The burger was the size of a slider. The wings were dry and pitiful. The manager was very passive aggressive and rude! The food was visibly terrible, but he wanted to take no accountability and pretend I was just being picky. Ha!  Apparently you have to request for your bacon(pork) to be actually cooked, or you will receive it in the manner they normally serve it;RAW.

bT649gnlTuRssMcxLPzrtA.text: Terrible food and service. We had family come into town last minute before NYE. Try finding dinner reservations for NYE last minute for 6 people. Rock Bottom was one of the only ones with availability. Now we know why. Terrible service, terrible food, one order came out wrong, one person's didn't come at all until we asked a few times for it, beer served in plastic cups, women's bathroom out of TP and papertowel and looked like a 2am night club bathroom. And this was all at 730pm! And the place was NOT busy and a lot of staff members just standing around joking around so you can't even say they were understaffed for the evening. Again, NYE and they were out of some liquors and menu items. Our first time there and definitely our last. Way too many other great locations in uptown Charlotte. Even podunk breweries in the area serve their beer in glassware.

IB_qeNsppps_Seck26k-sg.text: Friendly staff but slow and dirty.  Sunday lunch is expected to be slower on Sunday I guess but in uptown with games and theatre tickets, 1 1/2 hours is too long for lunch. 25 minutes to get your average food is too long to wait. The bathrooms hadn't been cleaned in days, with the presence of old beer pint glasses from the night before as evidence. Personable staff and the chicken avocado sandwich are a saving grace.

ojkxZUC5Eo22X94QBCDSIw.text: I used to love this place. In 2016, the service is terrible.  Too many better places nearby. RB needs to clean house on their management.  The chain as a whole is good; just skip this particular one.  One of my worst experiences was going there after a discovery place IMAX film, where they served the food on paper plates w/ plastic forks and knives because they did not want to run the dishwasher.  This was fairly early 6 pm SUN.

0DosBak02w8S3OsNv3SHTQ.text: Visited on a Saturday night during a playoff game so they were pretty busy and we had a party of eight, but surprisingly there wasn't a super long wait to be seated. The waitress greeted us after about a fifteen minute wait, and was very pleasant. We placed our drink orders which came out pretty quickly and the alcoholic beverages were on point. Shortly after receiving our drinks we placed our appetizer and entree orders. The appetizers came out fine, but after ordering a second round of drinks everything there after was downhill. We waited quite sometime for our second round of drinks, but we were told the bar was backed up which was understandable but after waiting another twenty minutes with no drinks our patience began to wear thin. Another server showed up to the table to assist our waitress and said that she was sent to run the drinks and inquired about what we had ordered but she never returned. The entrees began to come out and all the orders except two were completely wrong, luckily the head chef for the night made every effort to correct our waitresses mistakes. The manager on duty got wind of all the issues we were having and also assisted in making sure everyone was taken care of. Our original server at this point had still not returned to the table, it wasn't until after most of the mistakes had been corrected that she showed up and then completely blamed it on the kitchen as if she was not the one who had put in our order incorrectly. The manager and chef were very accommodating taking several items off our tickets as well as giving everyone a forty percent discount for our patience. The food was amazing, everything was delicious. My only advice would be to hire better wait staff, or at least wait staff that works well under pressure.

NtemTnN_RSGW9DBgquGpvg.text: FiNALLY! A restaurant in Charlotte that makes up for all the bad ones. Their burgers are to die for. BEST BURGER IN CHARLOTTE! I had the Bacon Mac N Cheese which was really good but wow...my husband had the bourbonzola burger and it was delicious.   The appetizers are good too plus if you go to the Blumenthal Center for the Performing Arts and take your show ticket you get a free appetizer!  This is one of my new favorite places!   Thank you, Rock Bottom, for restoring my faith in Charlotte restaurants!

-Jr8-FOwWe6KgmU5wCPrsA.text: It's been a while since I've been in Rock Bottom but I was uptown for the Shriners parade on July 4th and figured this was a good place to find refreshment on a hot day.    The restaurant has limited hours right now because they are in the process of remodeling so I had to visit them after the parade instead of before.    Anyway, I started out with sampling their beers.  For a chain brewery, these aren't too bad.  The Belgian white was very refreshing and had a wheaty flavor.  The Hoppy Red ale was quite good and better than a normal red and then I moved up to the IPA which also had a smooth hoppy taste to it.    As for food, I just wanted something light so I ordered an appetizer...the Pepper Jack Chicken Nachos.  Well light isn't what I would call this.  The plate was huge and came with sides of salsa, sour cream and guacamole.   In the nachos, there were sliced onions which often seemed a bit too large.  Also the chicken was in large pieces and I think would have been better with smaller either shredded chicken or ground chicken.  The chicken was also very dry.  I'd also expect a little spice from something that had sliced jalapenos and pepper jack cheese but there wasn't any.  The salsa wasn't even spicy and it seemed like more of an italian chunky marinara sauce than a mexican salsa.  But hey the guac was good, if that's any consolation.  Service-wise, I sat at the bar and both of the bartenders were friendly and helpful.    So for beer, they get a 4.  for Service, they get a 4.  But for food, they get a 2.  And this averages out to slightly better than a 3.

GUF0BvCdmomwkyhhpDGr9Q.text: My steak was perfect and the fries were wonderful! Great atmosphere and excellent service even right before they closed!! Highly recommended!

JemieJBC3OlZ03g83AUbig.text: We came for dinner on a Saturday evening and sat at the bar. The beer was good, service was ok, but the food was terrible. I ordered lobster & shrimp "enchiladas", which had practically no filling. It was just a rolled tortilla with a few shrimp and pieces of lobster meat on top. The two people I was with both got burgers, one was charred to the point it was inedible (requested medium well) the other was also over cooked and came with giant chunks of onion even though he ordered it with no onions. Our server tried to take care of us by comping some of the meal so that was good but still would not recommend going here for food.

H7svazHTbRUsLmfw3dmwzw.text: Food and service are great. This is our go to place when we just want to grab a quick bite.

9D6pe_hKabIX3XIpQ6Hf9g.text: Amazing habanero shrimp appetizer, awesome Southwest egg rolls, and the fish tacos were amazing. Next time I am Charlotte I will stop here.  Did I mention the beer was pretty darned good too

QnpkUoDVNI79g4exOdVzZg.text: Sat outside near the bar. The service was very slow and obviously not very interested in being there. After waiting for 15 minutes we decided to ask the hostess for service and menus.  The food was also disappointing. Ordered the avacado chicken sandwich and though I prefer smaller portions, this was a bit ridiculous. The chicken breast was so small. Worse was that there was no flavor. It was just all around bland.   On the brighter side,  the bbq wings were good, so maybe I just ordered the wrong item. Would recommend not sitting outside or at the bar if you want food.

oPjTrtE8HwvnIpVrzxrTwA.text: I love Rock Bottom Brewery!!! I would go to 2 of them in San Diego & La Jolla... Awesome!!! The Charlotte One is even better & Bacon Mac & Cheese is why!!! #Culinary Greatness!!!

8R6BT-FhNXrQArLZrdhiSA.text: After an ACN convention our team went to this brewery to celebrate for dinner... We have a pretty large group about 40+ and was seated at different tables. Upon closing  he tabs, Andrea with management decided to call the NCPD because she couldn't manage her host  to close out all the tabs before we had to leave and there were one or two open tabs left. The police informed us about the situation and wouldn't allow the rest of the group to leave until the other tabs were paid and closed out.  After soaking with Andrea the "manager" who couldn't manage her host to close out the checks beforehand... First they said one of the table didn't pay for the food and after an hour of deliberating with the cops they figured the table that left already paid for their food but management is now stating the drinks have not been paid for.    I have never experienced such incompetence when it comes to dealing directly with your customers about closing out tabs for large parties. Andrea the manager could have approached one of us to resolve this matter before calling the cops... Seriously don't these officers have something else better to do instead of dealing with a problem or miscommunication like this? What kind of manager would do that specially of there is still a large group left behind even though some table have left already to head back to their hotels after a long day of convention...  In my opinion this is just plain poor management and my group were 95% Japanese from Japan. This was a very poor impression by getting the cops involved and not being able to handle this while my group was still in the restaurant and the cops informing my group that we would be all going to jail if a $120 tab was not paid.  Pointers for Andrea the "manager" communicate directly with your clients about open tabs left before calling the cops. Learn how to manage the floor to close out the bill since everyone at the table is no longer ordering. And last calling the cops to resolve issues you should handle yourself should be your last resort if the group left the restaurant already.  Seriously, these were our VIP Japanese colleagues and we did not come to Charlotte North Carolina to get a free meal... There are no free meals in America Andrea!  And if you fear about losing your job because you couldn't manage the floor to close out tabs... Then you don't belong in management!  We will never come back here for any meals on our next convention and maybe be corporate will not care about it... Maybe they will.... Bottom line is #Rockbottombrewery will never have any of my business or my colleagues business of patronism ever again when we come back to Charlotte, NC ever!  I wouldn't even give this place a star for this reason!

aTsCRuWa5YLFEEsArdIUFw.text: Came here before a Panthers game and had a solid time. It's a chain, but they have solid service, good beers, and decent food. All in all they provide what they chalk themselves up to be. Good tvs as well around the bar. I prefer the local Charlotte options, but this is a good alternative.

KgjlguIRzbTviSyOsmxV7Q.text: I would rate this zero stars but that's not an option. We were told a 20 minute wait Friday evening, it was 46minutes. While waiting we stood at the bar and watched the barmaid that had a permanent scowl on her face. Once seated our waitress took our drink order (waters) and said she would be right back. At that time the restaurant was half empty. She instead went to the terminal and entered past tickets for over 10 minutes. She came back to the table, apologized for the delay and said, "oops, I forgot your waters". Several minutes later she returned to take our orders. I ordered the pretzel chicken, she said, "I think we might be outta that", so I ordered something else. My husband ordered the steak fajitas. Even though she apologized many times for the fact that she kept us waiting on drinks and order taking, instead of putting our order in immediately she went to her 3 other tables and chit chatted. Then it took over 20 additional minutes to receive our food. Two waiters brought steak fajitas to the table that were literally cold, no sizzle, completely cold to the touch. The mashed potatoes that my chicken was on had a film on them from sitting in the window too long and were cold. We then didn't touch the food and asked for the manager. After waiting an additional 10 minutes with no one coming to the table we left. The manager finally rushed out to catch us and when we explained our experience all he could say was, "I don't know what is wrong with that girl." We then found ourselves sticking up for our waitress saying it wasn't all her fault. If anything manager Kevin and all the managers and owners of this restaurant, it's your fault. If your bar employees seemed pissed to be there, if your wait staff aren't trained on the basics, if your kitchen staff is making half cooked food and your food runners are running fajitas that have zero sizzle and are obviously cold, then management has failed. Manager Kevin did offer to email us a certificate to come back, AFTER my husband asked for his name, but it's not necessary, we have zero plans to ever waste time on Rock Bottom again. It was our first restaurant when we moved to Charlotte many years ago and we typically like to go when we are in the city but each time it has gotten worse and worse. We won't be back. Side note: We were starving when we finally left Rock Bottom at 10:16pm after all of that and went across the street to Duckworths. Their fajitas came out sizzling, my food was great, the waiter was friendly and on top of it. Thank goodness our evening wasn't a total waste.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cold fajitas and this is how their plates come to the table. Smh.

Zph9Ok9DZCZrtKOOjxRcbw.text: After two recent visits here, I can honestly say I am torn on my review, but overall I know I have had better. Most recently, we arrived shortly after 12 and were seated indoors, because the patio was full, and it took our server over 15 minutes to take our drink order. We started off with the spinach artichoke dip and chips, which arrived 5 minutes before our food. Before I get to the food, the appetizer was cold and came with about 10 chips. Being there were four of us we asked for some extra chips and some salsa. The chips were warm, however the salsa, stay away, unless you like Pace's from the grocery store. Really, are they kidding serving store bought salsa??? On to the food.  We ordered a good variety, stuffed peppers, chicken enchiladas, burger and chicken sandwich. The chicken sandwich was burnt and you cook smell the burn! The enchiladas and peppers were so spicy we had to ask for more water. Only positive, the fries, great seasoning! As for the service, I wish I took her name, but our waitress could have given two sh...about being there and you could tell. No refills, never saw her, except our order and bill, and very blah!  Not sure we would return anytime soon.

15EYUr2WQ_H6rJAqZl6aKQ.text: Great service , atmosphere, food and drinks . Staff and management were so friendly,  they were constantly checking in us without intruding . Everyone has a smile on their faces , they seemed to really enjoy their job and not just pandering for a tip.

iS95rBSpp1um-jg02IOtsA.text: Came here for lunch on Memorial Day. They have an outside seating area that is covered which was a huge plus and it is located really close to 7th Street Market.  I tried a flight of their beers and they were decent but nothing special. I would recommend the red ale or the double IPA.  We had their nachos to start which were ok, it is a huge serving that comes with salsa to dip. I had the veggie tacos which were good, they had a crunchy shell covered with a soft tortilla which I actually enjoyed. It came with a side of rice and beans. I really liked the black beans but there was something about the rice that had a bad after taste.  My husband ordered the veggie burger and fries. I tried the fries and I liked them but didn't try his burger. He said it was good but again nothing special.

rAck_kXucDRGeu3sujpLvw.text: My husband loves this place so whenever we are in town we tend to stop by.  I really enjoy the atmosphere!  It's a great place to meet friends, have a family meal, or for date night.  I personally love the mixed drinks.  I have yet to hit a home run with their handcrafted beers but I will keep trying- I truly believe they have one for me on that menu somewhere!  Upon a recent visit I tried the Winter Tartan Scottish Ale but it was just a little too bitter for my tastes.    The food is a different story.  I haven't had anything that was really memorable.  There was an awesome crab dip at one point but when I tried something similar on my latest visit, it was not the same taste.  Regardless of the food, we ALWAYS have a good time!

zRtRBX1AC1s4PafQxMu3Ug.text: Completely disrespected during my visit there, by the general manager. My family and i would have been happier at McDonald's. This place is terrible. And the management staff is a joke

M6VhkVyyuP4n9LuKwTQaOw.text: The food was rock bottom.   It was so disappointing that  me and two my friends could not finish our meals.

peUON7btx-mIdCgnWooW4g.text: A disappointing experience! I have been to Rock Bottom several times before this trip. The pizza always seemed decent and the microbrews were okay too. Nothing special, but the location and atmosphere has always been nice.  The insert menu excited me when I got here...Oktoberfest...was here. I love German food and I love Oktoberfest beers. I mean...love...really love Oktoberfest beers.   The German Burger: half a pound of meat with some cabbage, mushrooms, Swiss, and ketchup....on a fresh pretzel bun. Sounds great, right? Wrong! It tasted like a big meat patty...no flavor...nothing! Just plain boring.  The Oktoberfest Sampler Platter: Some type of "Knackwurst" corndog...which tasted pretty much like Pronto Pups at any northern state fair...not bad...but not warm in the middle. The fried corned beef and cabbage things were nice...but seemed pretty Irish to me. This also came with a fresh Bavarian pretzel with a variety of mustards...nice.  Now here we go! Rock Bottom describes their Oktoberfest beer as Full-bodied with a classic sweet flavor, Rocktoberfest is an award-winning Oktoberfest-style beer that is rich with a toasted malt character and finishes with a subtle crisp hop.  Now...if I was allowed to swear here...I would. In what world this beer is toasty, malty, finishing a tad hoppy...or award winning is beyond me. This beer is Budweiser with some caramel food coloring. This beer had no personality whatsoever! I can say that it finished nicely...by having no taste at all. Great job! I'm glad a terribly sub-par meal only set me back sixty bucks...I'd probably need a second job if I decided to eat somewhere with good food.

C1pGVfx0kleekCye2daBmg.text: YUM! I throughly enjoyed my lunch as well as tasting my coworkers. The chicken fried chicken (hers) was soooooo good. I got the burger but had to remove the buns cause they alone looked like they could clog my arteries. If you're going during lunch break I'd be advised it takes some time. Granted we had a 9 top. I definitely will be back.

omQ4CHAZ89-3k0LF9Oyvyw.text: Food - terrible. Service - awful Cleanliness - below average Overall - don't waste your money   Update: Looks like I was with the majority, RIP Rock Bottom

oK_cNVWzOAVEbluSepLNdg.text: Dropped our daughter off to see Dear Evan Hansen and this place caught our eye.  Business casual, clean and staff was nice.  Medium price wise.    Wife got the Gorgonzola Burger with Mac and cheese. I got the shaved steak sandwich with fries.   The good: Her burger was good, cooked medium.  Big burger, flavorful. The steak sandwich was good but not $14 good.  Go for something else.  The sandwich wasn't worth the price.   The not so good:Skip and sauce on the side. Not sure what it was but it wasn't good.  Mac and cheese was plain and unremarkable.  Wife said Velveeta is better. Fries were unremarkable.    We also had the chicken tortilla soup as a starter.  It was good and spicy.  She got a cup and I got a bowl. There wasn't really any difference in the amount except the shape of the cup and bowl. Stick with the cup, the bowl is NOT worth $2 more.  Bill plus tip came to $50.  I guess you could say this place was unremarkable.  For $50, there are better options out there.  It wasn't bad but certainly not a $50 a couple place to eat.

7mCwknaxyZ0yWMgwBmbiPw.text: I got the veggie burger with endless fries. I requested to add guac to my burger, but didn't notice I hadn't received it until I was halfway finished. I'm glad I didn't get charged for it even though I requested for the guac. The seasoned fries were good, but I had to wait a long time to get the 'next round'. I was already finished with my veggie burger by then & I'm the type of person that likes eating my fries WITH my burger. Overall, the veggie burger was tasty- I can say that.   The atmosphere was slow & lowkey. I was there during a weekday and after 6p, so it wasn't busy. Something also to note is parking. I can imagine parking isn't the best on the weekends. I lucked up and got free street parking across and on the street from the restaurant for free.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

Wu-54vK_Mnrrfbc9tIV-2g.text: Since I moved to Charlotte I would drive and walk by this establishment. Finally got to go there this past Sunday. Our party consisted of 11 people. They put 3 tables together to accommodate our group. The shaft of the table was so loose I was afraid to put my drink on it. So I put it on the stable table that my wife was in front of. Food was good.(hadn't eaten all day, so anything I ate at 7pm would be good). I do like that they validate parking in the lot.  Sadly the highlight of the night was our waiter. It was noticeable and very easy to observe, that either he was having a bad day or he didn't want to be there. EVERYONE in our party kept commenting on that. He was asked if he had any recommendations of what to order, and he informed us of the signature dishes that had the fork and knife next to it. That wasn't the question! It felt like we were inconveniencing him when we needed a refill on our drinks. Interestingly he warmed up slightly at the end. I guess because we were leaving and it would be "tip time."  I like the variety of the items on the menu, and would love to explore the other options because my food was good. I'm very hesitant to return because of the service. Highly disappointed that no attempt was made to correct the wobbling table. I can eat food at home on my sturdy table, I don't feel satisfied as a consumer paying to eat at an establishment where the table is in that condition.

75I_48mnlcFlhPjd7WjpTg.text: Few experiences in my life compare to the cognitive dissonance I experienced at Rock Bottom.  The facilities are attractive, the beer and food are outstanding, and the environment is...horrific.  I visited on a quiet Wednesday night before the dreaded hurricane Florence announced herself and found few patrons in the restaurant or the bar.  Brianna was attentive to me after an inexplicable delay involving four other employees and one thirsty bar patron and served me a fantastic beer, the "Monk's Mistress", which lives up to it's name.    I'm a fan of dip and ordered the Asiago & Artichoke Dip, which arrived 15 minutes later.  By this time, I'd sampled the Rocktoberfest and Uptown Amber, which have great potential, except that my experience had been disrupted by an employee whose conduct was so disturbing as to completely ruin the experience.  This waitress (I did not see her actually wait on any patron, so I use the term loosely), approached the end of the bar in great haste and loudly complained about an unidentified male by the name of "Big Country" and then proceeded to employ every vulgar, crude and profane word I've heard in four decades of traveling the world, spending time in the military and interviewing accomplished criminals and politicians.  The five other bar patrons all turned to see what species of female possessed a mouth capable of so much filth at such a high volume who wasn't turning tricks five blocks away.  Even the man in town from Manhattan who ordered chardonnay and a salad sans crutons seemed frightened.  Oddly, none of the five employees assembled for the filthy tirade seemed conscious of the fact that every paying customer in the restaurant had turned to learn what had brought about the vulgar tirade.  Instead, they turned to shots of the beer, at which time Nasty Woman began employing explicit and boringly unsophisticated puns about one of the locally-brewed beers, "Sourpuss" and how her colleagues should pay close attention to the name and what they were "really drinking".  Perhaps I should not have been surprised that a mouth as vile as hers would be so well-acquainted with the consequences of poor hygiene.  The Asiago & Artichoke Dip had arrived and proved to be as good as I had hoped.  I had a coupon so I ordered the Shrimp and Crab Enchiladas.  By the time that arrived I had learned that the F-word could, in fact, be used in more than 26 ways, which is what I had previously though the official limit to be.  Needless to say, she failed to employ the word in any artistic sense or in any way that reflected admirably on the character of Sewer Mouth or her employer.  She had also proven beyond any doubt that she was well acquainted with the male reproductive organs and functions and the desire of some male mammals to attempt copulation with females of all species in ways which would not likely lead to procreation.  Recognizing that I could have a similar experience in a far cheaper environment, I asked for my food to go and finished my beer.  Brianna was pleasant, the food and beer was excellent, but the conduct of the staff was so wholly inconsistent with the location, the environment and the pricing that I must conclude the brand concept sprung from the mind of a genius who is now long-dead, retired or lost in a central American country, no doubt trying to forget what sprang from his mind in Charlotte, NC.  No establishment can earn a five star rating when it is so inhospitable to ladies of any background, nor can it earn a four star rating when gentlemen of any character cannot be exposed to the discourtesy of the staff's crass, loud, narcissistic conduct.  The outstanding beer and food  redeems this poor, aptly-named brand from a one star rating.  "Rock Bottom", indeed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Monk&#39;s Mistress is fantastic!

zUYKle2N21s60VCnC-Xb9A.text: To be honest, I've never had an experience so terrible that I didn't know where to even start.  Upon arriving for our reservation, the place wasn't very busy, but there was nobody at the host stand to greet us, so we just waited about 5 minutes until a gentleman came up to greet us.  When we said we had reservations, he just sort of stared, looked confused, then after hesitating brought us to a booth that was just being cleared off.  We then sat down to look at menus.  After about 20 minutes, nobody had been to or even near our table.  We were hard-pressed to see anyone working the floor at all.  A few more tables were seated and everyone was looking around for wait staff.  Finally I went back up to the host stand, told him the dilemma, and his response was not even a word, but a blank stare.  After a few more minutes he actually came to the table to ask for our drink order with the enthusiasm of someone heading to death row.  After another 10 minutes, he returned with drinks and rudely asked for our dinner order.  Another 20 minutes went by, and still no actual wait staff had been to our table. Finally I flagged someone down and asked about the food.  Finally a few minutes later 3 out of the 4 meals arrived.  The first meal was a cobb salad with chicken.  It was the most bland, salad imaginable with rubber-like chicken. The second meal was a plate of nachos that had been sitting under a heat-lamp for so long that the cheese and jalapenos were dried out and the edges of the tortilla chips were blackened.  The third meal were two tostadas with chicken, or what appeared to be chicken.  One bite of that was enough for me. Then we waited for the fourth meal, which was a bowl of soup, for another 10 minutes. Finally I asked for a manager. While waiting for the manager, we asked for napkins and silverware, which had never been brought.  This is the best part....the server came over and dropped off four little plastic bags with cheap plastic silverware packaged with a little salt and pepper serving and the thinnest napkin I have ever seen inside.  She said they were "out" of silverware.  After glancing around to the half-empty dining room, I had to wonder what was going on.  We ordered a second round of drinks which came right as we were about to leave.  The manager was nice, but obviously overwhelmed and had no control over anything that was going on in the restaurant...she disappeared to never be seen again.  The restaurant was getting busier, and there were lines of people out the front door waiting, nobody at the host stand, and so many tables of dirty dishes it was disturbing.  I wouldn't be able to sleep at night without letting people know that this could be the very worst restaurant in all of Charlotte, and that is saying a LOT!  Stay away!  I know it is cliche, but this restaurant has hit "Rock Bottom".

VHw4tU84pJjSUQgtJcqIJg.text: Came here for happy hour on a Monday. They have $3 beer specials for each day, and food/beverage specials Monday to Friday 3:30-6:30. I tried the Hop Goddess IPA, and for food the nachos and jalapeno pretzels. Service and food were great! Will be back again.

093G72LXV45wceZuz4Mt7Q.text: Oh my. Rock bottom service.   We came on a Saturday afternoon, not busy. We were seated quickly, across from a table loaded with half eaten food... the table hadn't been cleaned from previous customers.   We waited 15 minutes to even have a waitress address us, and when she did, she acknowledged she didn't know where "our" waitress was. It was painful trying to order and get our food when she finally did show. What should've been a 30-40 minute lunch turned into well over an hour.   And that dirty table? It was never cleaned the ENTIRE time we were there. Nothing like eating lunch next to table of half eaten food and mess. Never again.

wv4kjzXgt2cTdPu6RzhhGA.text: The food wasn't bad.. but the Ribeye steak i ordered wasn't the best. Service was very slow. Took about 15 minutes to get my drink order. After i was done eating the wait time to try and wave someone down was another mishap.. the employees were very friendly and the environment was perfect if you wanted to sit and watch the game or just have a conversation with your buddies.  Good assortment of beers on tap. I did not try any but the selection was promising.

3miCe34adLDkv8t43o4LGQ.text: We went to Rock bottom today. They are in a great location and have a great patio area. We were seated right away on the patio. It took 6 minutes to get our 2 sodas and then another 7 minutes to get our straws, and I had to ask 2 people for them.   We ordered 2 appetizers, chicken tenders and artichoke crab dip. They took about 20 minutes but came out hot and were very good, had to ask for appetizer plates.  For our meal we ordered a Cob Salad and a shaved steak sandwich with garlic mashed potatoes. The salad was decent, except for the tomato ends and a couple rotten spots on 2 tomato pieces. The sandwich and potatoes were not hot. The sandwich had unmelted cheese on top and the bottom was severely burnt making it inedible. (See pictures)  The server never came back to ask us how our food was even though most of it wasn't eaten.   Overall on a scale of 1-10 I would rate the total experience as a 3.

hleDhNRWXME0RqSWr7x38A.text: I've started preferring Rock Bottom on Game Days.  Their staff is much nicer than a lot of places.  Because they are also a restaurant, I feel their food quality and options are much better than some of the other bars in the area.  They have all the games on and the TV's are marked (at least for the first games) so you can figure out where you want to sit.  They will have the sound on for Panthers games, but not sure how they decide what to audio if they aren't.  They are very accommodating.  Rock Bottom is a little further down the street than some other bars/options, which is actually nice for me, because it doesn't get as packed as quickly nor does it get as rowdy.    I don't have kids, but I feel if you want to come in with your family to watch the game you wouldn't have to worry about younger kids a lot of adult craziness.  They do have a patio in the very back past the bathrooms, but I've never sat out there and not sure if there are TV's out there or not.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of two huge ball park pretzels on their $5 All Day  Football apps options.  And all beers $3!

XJPA3DsIXXZw2L67I-5RVQ.text: Great spot! Busy but expected for a Weds @6pm. Service was fast - luckily found 2 bar spots.  Cheap Happy Hour specials & the nachos were HUGE!!! Beer was cheap and good we had the Belgian for the Weds $3 dollar special. Excited to try the other beers they make. Within walking distance to the Hornets game, definitely will be coming back to try other Happy hour food specials & more of the beer!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos - part of the happy hour special. Huge! My husband and I couldn&#39;t finish. More chips than toppings

izH5BANy4_-R3zBbYIHxGA.text: Love this place. One of the best places to enjoy dinner uptown and have a beer. We come at least once a month. Also, did a murder mystery dinner here. Fun place. Mellow atmosphere. Definitely recommend. They also validate parking which is nice.

a1Xcb6iVznl7KAjRnqwgqA.text: I went here for lunch with a coworker.I ordered the apple salad.It was really good and exceed my expectations. The dressing was different than my usual taste but definitely complimented the salad.  I'm not sure if they were short on help or not but our waitress would get absent sometimes.The type of absent that when your check is delivered upon request you present your form of payment so you wouldn't have to wait again.Therefore,I am giving them three stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

6cKlYp-uuKDJj_lfSJVW2A.text: Stumbled upon a mid-day courtyard party at Rock Bottom which was pretty cool.  They had live music and $3 beer specials.  Obviously this isn't all the time but if your in the area you may want to look into it and see if they are doing anything special.  The environment was great. The courtyard is outside and open and has small fountains around. It's great if you want to kick back, laugh and converse with friends. You can essentially be as loud as you want and the atmosphere makes you feel free.  Customer service was great! They check in with you and make sure you have what you need.  I wasn't fond of the $3.99 up charge for a shrimp substitute because she didn't mention it. She said yeah sure. It would have been nice if she made the cost known.  The food was good. I had fried pickles and bacon shrimp Mac and cheese. There was nothing special about the food...you probably could get both options elsewhere (and they may be better) but it was still good. I definitely wasn't disappointed.  The drinks were also good. I got cocktails and green tea shots.  The pricing was $12-$18. Not too bad but  What really pushed this restaurant to 4 stars was the atmosphere, live music and service.  I'd recommend it.
