3WXvYJzhktbP5WKl8adi7Q.text: THE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED. During a time where the restaurant was not very busy, my table had to wait over 30 minutes to receive drinks, silverware, and even the food. When we got the food it was cold and we had to ask several people many times for silverware and water. This restaurant truly hit rock bottom. Do not come here

KPDNdukSk-jfkilg8M2Ewg.text: We left hungry and thirsty.  We visited on a busy Sunday night. The place had several empty tables yet there was a wait so we figured they were short staffed. This is not a good sign but we had reservations so we stayed and regretted it, For starters, we waited 20 minutes to receive our beers! My daughter had to go to the bar to get hers, as we noticed other seated patrons were doing. As we waited, we noticed out server attending to too many tables, we counted at least seven. Our server was polite and tried hard, but was overwhelmed and could not keep up. To his credit, when we told him we had tickets to a show and he got our order in quickly.  When the food came to the table, we had no silverware on the table so we all starred hungry at our food and waited several minutes for tableware. The food was good, although the portions were small. My Chicken Waldorf was good but for once, I did not get enough dressing and ended up having to eat it 'dry' as I  could not get more dressing. My daughter ordered the smoked chicken tostadas. Beautifully presented but skimpy on quantity. However, my daughter ordered them served on a flour tortilla but they were served on corn shells instead, which she does not care for so she ended up eating a meal she did not really want. My son had the Jambalaya. Just the right amount of ingredients and spices made for an very good meal.    Their beers were excellent! This is one place we would like to return to just for the beer (if you can get served). During NFL games, drafts can be had for $3, a bargain.  I'm sad. This place has so much potential but poor service (management?) sacrifices a four star review down to a single star. Where were the managers? We did not see them helping. Why did they saddle a server with so many tables? Quality (of patrons) over quality of service reveals their values.  We left very disappointed, hungry and thirsty!  We all would've liked to enjoyed a desert and also we would've had more beers but Rock Bottom was incapable. Also, during the whole 90 minutes we were there, we were never able to get our waters refilled.   Given there are plenty of other fine establishments in uptown Charlotte, I recommend you spend you money elsewhere.

0FI7Wte5RzIpfgALxgRI7Q.text: The service is awful. The MANAGER of the restaurant interrupted us by yelling LADIES at us to get our attention during our conversation. Some of our party had to wait well after we had already finished our food to get their food. Half of our party didn't get their drinks until way after they ordered. The food was subpar and wasn't anything to brag over.  I would not recommend this restaurant to anyone wanting good service and good food.

kEjG0QgTYO8XSYq9x5uFWQ.text: Tried 2 times... will not be back/ do not recommend. Horrible service and bad food. So many great places in uptown. Do not waste your time and money here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burger
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

Gc9ueIC6fy9dzkBmD6ZjZA.text: Valentine's Day dinner with 3 couples. We chose rock bottom because everyone had been there at some point. The beginning check in should've been a red flag for us to run. The hostess was answering phone calls, arranging menus and even walking off while telling us to hold on. There were several parties waiting to be checked in behind us. 10 minutes later we were sat.    Server came over greeted us promptly, took drink orders and asked if we wanted apps and gave us a chance to look over menu. Some drinks were returned from the bar while some never reached the table. This was how this went all night.    Oh boy, the kitchen and food. I ordered a 2am burger as well as my husband except his without hash browns. Runner brought food and started auctioning off food and when my husband and I couldn't decide who's was who's, HE GRABBED THE BUN OFF THE BURGER AND STARTED DISSECTING FOR HASHBROWNS! What in the world??!! Neither of us touched our food. Another couple ordered the Cajun Pasta and brewery beef tips. Both came out ice cold. Third and final couple, their order was the beef tips and a steak cooked medium rare. The beef tips came out cold as the others and the steak never hit the table.    Manager-- my husband walked off to find him so he could address it personally instead of making a scene. He told my husband he'd be back over in 30 seconds- several tens of minutes later, we had our server go find him. He said he'd bring out our checks. CHECKS? No. No checks. He agreed to comp food, especially what never hit the table. We paid for drinks and left our sever a gracious tip. We won't be back as we had to leave and go to Wendy's! Never ever again.

Ro9tKH64Ca4oLMVnTMpiYA.text: Very middle of the road. Average in every sense of the word. Not great, not terrible. I don't think I need to go on.

U_eUDiCmZS_tU3n6FNw1Lg.text: This place has kind of a cool vibe. The beer was fantastic. The food was so good and cooked to order. The menu has so many great selections. My husband ordered the mac&cheese with chicken. I didn't try any of it but it looked so decadent and he practically licked the bowI! I had a burger with pepper jack cheese, house pickled onions, chipotle mayo, avocado...it was cooked to a perfect medium rare with just the right amount of char and juicy in the middle. A few improvements could be to attend to the rest rooms more frequently. They needed some tidying up, the paper towel dispenser was not working, and some stalls needed toilet paper. The service was good and friendly but could be a bit more attentive. I think if this place could get a bit more polished it would earn another star!

X4mp6sG2IUBe1OxAVFw0Tw.text: Amazing food wonderful spread of locally crafted beers! Kid friendly great for a date and I would suggest the beer flight with the margarita pizza!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. The house beer flight 6 beers for 6$ a great way to expand your palate of locally crafted and brewed flavors! #rockbottom

RmZ7NnyVJq0Tl0wh3bs2Ww.text: Typical bar-ish type food. Nothing that really stands out. It's a good place to go out after work.

C7K9jrHtu92-0nBGD2OnxA.text: The whole experience was good. Nothing wrong with the beer, food, or service. The portion was actually big enough for two people but the bill was a little on the pricey side.

fSYQ_oQ0wNGk2nMJLvNZJA.text: Location hurts this place. It's fun to sit outside and watch what North Tryon has to offer the first couple times going here, but it loses its luster.   No complaints, but nothing stands out here.

koMzE7SFb_hxtRoM86K3kw.text: Rock middle more like.... We went here a few weeks ago... Food was overpriced and meh. The server was sooo schmooze-y that it was unbearable...nice enough I guess, but who you kidding kid? We know you hate this job. Anyone who doesn't hate serving is on something, but I digress. I went here a few years ago when I was just vacationing here and felt that it was just as than non-noteworthy then. I won't be going back now. Just too much money to spend on mediocre food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nice enough presentation

Dz_3FcSaLe8uP6HaRiK1qg.text: Rock bottom ...name explains itself. My friends got quesadillas...it simply wasn't a quesadilla it was a fuckin taco. No cheese...just don't get it. Service sucked our waiter was eh idk we didn't get water until after we finished our meal. My food was fantastic tho highly recommend the enchilada

039rwDGYx2-vZL2fHApbEQ.text: I've visited Rock Bottom a few times over the last couple months, courtesy of a gift card =)  They have really stepped up their game! I was always a fan, but I like it even more now. They remodeled and it has a better -- more upscale, modern, but not pretentious -- vibe now. Service (at the bar) has always been great!  They brew their own beer (and have local charlotte brews on their guest taps), both of the recent Seasonal Brews I tried were great - most recently Rocktoberfest. And you can always get a sampler if you feel torn. Their menu selection is huge and has something for everyone. This weekend I tried the grilled chicken with mashed potatoes and veggies - yumm! Next time, I'm eyeing the chicken fried chicken, ooo yeah.   The only not-so-nice thing I have to say is, skip the pretzels. You can do much better at other places in charlotte.   Other than that, I really like this place and I'm sure we'll be back!  P.S. They validate parking for the attached garage!

CwE-B1Z9Jx-v-nFjoaYTUw.text: Here's the Deal...Just stopped in for quick bite to eat while I was in town... I had the grilled chicken sandwich with avocado and it was good!.   Service was very friendly and helpful with menu choices.  The place has nice outdoor seating & plenty of TV's and bar space... I'd try again when in the area.

bWgUaVzsKBG5YqtPWLwZlQ.text: Went last night with in-laws for mother in laws bday.We always have loved the place and it is our go to place when we have something to celebrate and even when we don't.  Walked right in, we're seated, server was pleasant. Mentioned it was for mother in laws birthday and she was nice about it.  Ordered drinks and an appetizer. ..This is where things went slightly pear shaped. Server came back and told us the appetizer was delayed. No big beal, things happen.   Food comes and as always, was completely wonderful. Chicken fried chicken for three of us and my wife had the sizzling peppers. More pear shaped, waitress was no where to be found for 20 minutes. Wife was out of beer and spicy food minus drink.....she waited. Finally I got up and had to get another server to get a refill. She started with "I am not your server...." but said she would take care of it. To her credit she did.   Manager comes over, very nice, apologized for the appetizer and days she will cover it. Server shows up and is rather standoffish. Not rude per se but moody. Not sure if it was my stunt with the beer or the manager but either way not our fault. More waiting for desert, more drinks, something and then the server does show up with the bill no questions asked, not a thing.  The rating is not for the appetizer,  like I said things happen. It was not for the lack of drinks, it was for the apathy. At least come by and check on us, tell us the app is coming, but the server seemed to say, "the app screwed my tip so why try". If the place was hopping I would get it, but it was early afternoon.   Anyway long story short: great food, apathetic service, use to be a go to place even with the hour drive but we may  be finding another one.

dbwhS4xuETgmHy3rWTpkZw.text: Lately this has been Sunday football watching spot for my friends and I. We normally occupy one of the long bar table in front of 4 TVs (3 more on the other side) for hours. With that being said, there are hits & misses but overall I am a fan of being a fan at Rock Bottom.  Service is typically of acceptable quality. They can be a little slow in checking in, or filling water, but on the other hand we are there for a long time.   Food is actually pretty good. They also have game day specials on wings and nachos etc. Half nachos ($6) is good portion, but is without meat, which you can add for $2. They offer their own brew for beer (in case you don't know). They have beer special for Sundays as well. I can safely say that you can't go bad with ordering anything. I had a lobster & shrimp enchiladas and that was good.  Park is free, they validate for the garage under the restaurant. Be careful, my 1st time visit this season ended up charging me money to get out of the garage because the validation barcode was unclear (good news is I got my money back after contacting the parking garage office with proof of my validation via cell phone pic)  The only disappointing thing for our football watching days is: BY GOSH, stay on top of the game scheduling. We all know there are a new round of games kicking off at 4pm, so get the remotes ready and change over the moment 1pm game is over. PLEASE managers on duty??

eLMJYbFPV3yW2urcfCcABg.text: The live music was the best thing about the place. We made reservations but they screwed it up so about 15 of us had to huddle in a corner, and it took 30 minutes to get our drinks. Service was slow and really bad so it made for a poor experience. If it wasn't for the guy with the guitar and harmonica, I might have strangled the server. Don't think I'll visit again anytime soon.

Vjeq9teTallXnH6t8uLJDA.text: The chef messed up with our orders 4 times in a row and made me and my family wait more than two hours on our food. In the end they never gave us any service to help us out and all they did was give us salad and food that was supposed to be for other people. I give them a horrible review because I am disgusted that they couldn't even cook a decent chicken sandwich

dqtJy1_YOlpm0o-jeV4_iw.text: I had the beer sampler here. For $6 I got to taste 6 pretty good beers.  We had the jambalaya and it was decent. TBH, I have no clue what great jambalaya is...  service was pretty good.

zVsQupfAu79msfCvH3k_ng.text: I called and asked if they had a gluten free menu, they said that they had one. We arrived, we were sat and given our menus. It was NOT a gluten free menu at all! It was a menu with a very small selection of items on their normal menu with the gluten taken again. No substitute were given. There were burgers with out any buns, salads without croutons, no fries, etc. Very disappointed with this restaurant.

c-hIvVgko2zD73dNgZkuZQ.text: I only gave a 2 star rating because during our last visit we had a terrible waiter. His attitude totally sucked and i had to ask another waiter if she would please give me a refill of my drink. Our waiter just kept walking by our table without checking to see if we were okay. His service to us was less than admirable yet he paid more attention to the table next to us. Needless to say he did not receive a tip from us at all....my tip to him would be to treat customers as you would want them to treat you.

6_0fhc6_IzWeh-NafGEDyg.text: The beer sampler was great. All of them were great craft beers. Wait staff had some good recommendations. I had the fish and chips, and they were very good. Would recommend if your looking for a restaurant downtown.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer sampler

0eMcq3Vy-qj47NzjSXngig.text: If I could give it less than 1 star I would. We have been to Rock Bottom several times over the years. We went Saturday, March 10th for dinner with Family that came into town to visit. We had HORRIBLE service, so much so in fact, we weren't even greeted by a server for 22 minutes. It was when we stopped someone and asked if we could order we got an eye roll and a "hang on". Finally our server came over and we ordered our drinks. I ordered a Miller lite and was told you don't have domestic beers b/c you're a brewery. I mentioned to the server that I've been there many times and you do have a few domestic options. He said no, we don't. I asked if we could see a manager because I was sure there was an option. He said oh yeah, we have bud light. We got our drinks from another server and eventually our original server came back to take our order. We started with several appetizers for the table. They came out after a VERY long time and were awful. Cold and the nachos were burnt. Our server never came back to ask how things were. We stopped another server to order drinks again. Finally our server came back and asked what we would like for entrees. We declined and asked for the check. No manager ever came to our table. Awful experience from beginning to end.

y0e-NO63KPSILIulIdQ53A.text: Service is great. Outside seating in mild weather is awesome. Chicken Mac and Sausage Mac were both great. Veggie pizza was fresh and yummy. Beer sampler was fun to try!

8S9IIGJPpcZPU9nqloUlRg.text: 57 dollars for two steak meals and plenty of beer is not a bad price at all. Being in the center of downtown you would think there prices would be higher but they have some amazing choices and beers for a good price. I enjoyed there red ale more then there brown but both where great and my wife said that her kolsch was well made also. Ive been here several times and will be returning several more.

06EhG-UkIPDNBai4YGqOfA.text: Nothing here really blew me away..  Yeah, it's pretty cool that they brew their own beers and they are located on Tryon but... eh.  This spot is one step above an Applebees.  Dont get me wrong, I kinda like Applebees.  Just dont expect anything amazing.  I would suggest sitting outside and enjoying a nice day.  That might make it a little better.  I would also suggest you try the artichoke/crab dip.  That was rather delicious.  I would say, give it a try but know.. There are much better places in the city.  Enjoy!  -Ian M.

j1hAPmOwe1qeqaaRhtER2g.text: You'll know when you've hit it.  (Ba-dum crash!)

KzjHTvsjBmDZczP110CnbQ.text: I wasn't impressed with this place. The menu sounds really great& the waitress suggested I get the chicken bacon Mac & cheese, but it was disappointing to say the least.

-YSUxyRIhoGWG9Et3Uq7Bw.text: Not edible. Came in for a quick bite to eat on a Sunday for lunch. Server was not knowledgeable about the beer menu and was hard to flag down for anything. The chicken was flavorless and tough. The fries were cold and mushy. Will not come back here.

HVjgvGROCxWPL0BsWOSrAQ.text: I have eaten here several times & always find it disappointing. Tried a variety of foods & none have been particularly good.

jBDWMVfdUYzFvBOeuV9c-Q.text: Had lunch here with my girlfriend and her young boys after Discovery Place.  I had the Mac and Chicken - awesome.  She had the ahi tuna salad - which she said was delicious too!  It wasn't crowded at all - service was pleasant and the boys gobbled up their buttered noodles.  I had the Rock Bottom IPA - pretty good beer.  Overall we were very happy with our experience.

4y6ay5pynUxSjfR6dfUXHA.text: Okay food nothing special. Brushetta chicken dry and not much flavor.  Beer was good!

BPejhFKvUeq8Us9DJqEicg.text: I really should rate this a 1, but the brisket pizza was really good, so I'm being generous.   Unfortunately, it (the pizza) arrived 15 minutes after the rest of our food because of waiter error.   Which we would normally excuse, but there were just too many problems with our lunch.  Clearly it was a bad day...tables near us stacked with dirty dishes for our entire visit.  The restaurant was not busy.  Our food took at least 30 minutes to arrive the first time (and there was an error. )     Why a burger and a salad would take that long on a slow day is beyond me.  The worst offense was my chicken Caesar salad, which had about 1 or 2 ounces of chicken on it.  I can safely say that there was substantially less than 1/4 of a chicken breast on this salad.  The chicken was supposed to be grilled.  It might have been, but it was NOT grilled for me...it had definitely been in the refrigerator.  Flavor was fine, caesar dressing was good.   Fries with burger were luke warm.  Let's just say the restaurant almost lived up to its name...the pizza was its saving grace.  As late as it was, there was no offer to comp the pizza.  We decided to not be jerks so we didn't insist.  And the waiter seemed like a nice guy.   But obviously we have no plans to go back.

anqr0V2YTQ4gggasaj_HDg.text: yumm yumm yumm... Rock Bottom has some great food and the atmosphere is really cool. I love the fact that you can view the brewery and the beer sampler was fantastic! I don't have one bad thing to say about this place. Every one was very nice, they gave us time to actually enjoy our appetizer before our entrees came, and the food tasted absoutely amazing! I will definitely be back soon!

XnxymMxGb2e5exKWdn02zA.text: This place is okay. What I like is their own unique selection of beers they have to offer. Since they brew theri own on site and have many different "flavors" to choose from this makes this place above par for actual bar food fare. Their hops have a bitter taste so I wouldn't say their crafted beers are for everyone, they would best be enjoyed by IPA lovers. Their bar food menu is alright, their fish tacos are pretty good. This is a good last minute place to check out a brew a snack and catch some updates on your favorite sports on their flat screens strategically placed through out the bar.

s538QRxBdP0V5a-MhXFgXw.text: Go here if you enjoy waiting in the lobby when there are tons of open tables and being rudely treated by the hostess!  The food is just ok bar food.  The beer is awesome I will admit and the servers are pretty attentive.  I would rather drive down to Myrtle beach or Atlanta to it's sister restaurant Gordon Biersch.  The food is much better and the people who work there will treat you much better.  If you really need to go there to enjoy the beer, I'd eat elsewhere and then just sit at the bar.

Pz4_9j7j-_NHtzMVlY6Rfg.text: While I love the beer that they brew, their food is less than stellar and with their corporate office dictating local taste it is not worth it for food, Duckworth's will be opening next week and it is a better option for food and a larger selection of commercial beers.

dfB5zanbk0czfQ1NhZUV_g.text: I tried the pulled pork BBQ sandwich tonight and I'm very sorry about the choice. It has to be the worst BBQ sandwich I've had in 32 years in the Carolinas. The meat was saturated in a cloying nauseatingly sweet sauce. I should have sent the plate back, but I was very hungry and just ate it.  You know, it tasted like what a person up North thinks a BBQ sandwich should be.  ICK!

88aQgl6ZT9bzgquFP3f4-g.text: This is almost directly across the street from The Fox and Hound...and suffers not a whit in comparison! Huge menu, both in food and ale. A little *too* big inside-makes for a lack of intimate conversation, but if you want to enjoy a group outing... very nice indeed. On the whole, the staff was knowledgeable and friendly. Waiting times are sometimes longer than I care for... My only beef with Uptown dining is the absolute dearth of parking. This has the advantage of being across from a good-sized parking lot.

gVgBaexHCvUueFw7F9bebA.text: Easy to enjoy and easy to forget.  Rock Bottom is fine but not exceptional; the nachos are tasty, but isn't that True everywhere? I seem to remember a nice fish taco, but it might have been a black bean burrito. That's the sort of food you'll get. Enjoyable, but forgettable. This place's real appeal is a social one. Its outdoor seating is some of the best in Charlotte: in front you're on a busy street corner, perfect for people watching, and in back is a quieter courtyard. The interior is big and comfortable, so you'll want to linger and you'll never feel rushed. Bring good friends, and enjoy the beer.  Which brings us to their status as a brewery. Supposedly they brew a host of award winning beers on the premises, but nothing I have tasted has been exceptional. I suspect that in this regard, breweries are like car companies - there are more than enough awards to go around and even the most mediocre beers will win something. Or maybe I just don't appreciate good beer.

oCD17wXpYf2ZUJuNfjy9Qg.text: Typical sports bar. Caught the tail end of happy hour. I got the Rocktoberfest seasonal ale and that was pretty good. But i ordered a side of fries to munch on and it was incredibly tiny :(

oBelyLX6EogS9i9ffQSQHQ.text: Nachos, pretzels, pretzels, salad, burgers and margaritas are a must have!!! Great place to watch the game!!

O1IepNGMh6wAKqVJcI5C5A.text: Absolutely delicious! Ordered cherry glazed, hazelnut-crusted chicken. The vegs? They didn't overcook carrots! Yay! My teen ordered avocado chicken sandwich - it's BIG and avocado, were ripe and fresh! Nice service! Go. I almost died there... so was my teenager daughter (she was picky but she loved her order very much).

diA9V5Nisp9QxTpaOWfykg.text: Ordered takeout and was served MOLDY chicken fingers. After several attempts to contact management, I still haven't heard anything back. Never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. MOLDY chicken fingers. Seriously.

fvyui09VV5fISbh1kdD7og.text: Oh man oh man! Another review, and this time from the well known Rock Bottom in downtown Charlotte. I came here with a friend who wanted some of their beer as well as their food. And sadly, I wasn't impressed. Inside though they completely changed the outlay of the dining area from the last time I came here, which was about 2 years ago... They added ramps as well as new things to look at and admire, such as the glass between booths and some paintings. But, overall it's all the same with the looks and what not.  I had two things from the menu: Fish Tacos (RB Taco) and the Southwestern Chili.  Now, the good first. Southwestern Chili. It was awesome, I felt like it was very good and chunky. However, I wish the portion was just a wee bit bigger just because it was so tasty!  Another plus was the service. My friend ordered a steak and it was a little overcooked, the waiter completely understood and took it back to get another steak cooked medium rare. It was fast and I believe even the manager came up to fix the problem. They offered a soup or whatever, but my friend declined (I was wondering why he didn't get me another chili!)  Now the bad. Eating the Fish Tacos was like grabbing a handful of seasoned salt and then eating it. Every single bite was just a burst of not just salt, but just sodium with a little heat kicked in, but that was probably from the amount of salt and it made it seem spicier. After drinking water, it was still stuck in my mouth. Kick back the salt Rock Bottom and pull out that flavor of the fish! After all, it is a fish taco.  Overall, not bad, food is average. Service is pretty good though. Next time though, I'm sticking away from those tacos.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish Tacos
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Southwestern Chili

rKhKAStEgB22zGDmGb8LKQ.text: Guac desperately needed salt. Mac n cheese was fantastic. Large outdoor seating. Microbrewery with good beer!

IMPWVfEw7v3PsmWcnwjC7g.text: We stopped here for lunch the other day while walking around downtown. It was fairly cold and they seated our larger party right in front of the door so every time people came in and out during lunch time we got a cold draft air that froze us out while we ate.   Other than that the food was pretty good. We ordered our two year daughter the chicken quesadillas and they were amazing. Hands down the best quesadillas we have ever gotten at a restaurant. She, nor we, could stop eating them.   My husband got the wedge salad and chicken tortilla soup. The salad was the biggest wedge salad I've ever seen and his tortilla soup was delicious. You could definitely tell it was handmade and not premade/warmed up soup.   My MIL and I both had the Cuban Sandwich. I was not impressed with the sandwich itself. The pulled pork and ham inside were great. However, with the bread being dipped and fried it was overwhelming caked in bread compared to the amount of stuff inside the sandwich. I would not order it again. The fries were well seasoned and delicious.   My FIL had the Derby Burger and said it was great.   Overall for five us the cost of lunch was not as bad as one might expect for a restaurant of this quality. I thought the food was overall extremely good. The wait staff was great and prompt.   I down graded to  because my sandwich wasn't the best and we were not thrilled to freeze while we ate. We would definitely come back though.

IxHuv_Da0wWXnFuOglgQEw.text: I'd give this place zero stars if I could. Group of 4 of us went in on a Monday night to a deserted restaurant. Took our waitress 20 minutes to come to our table, took our drink orders and came back 20 minutes later with those. Waited for her to come over to take our order, the 2 booths behind us filled up with a group that were all together. We finally place our order, one appetizer and we waited, waited and waited AND watched the 2 booths get THEIR food. Finally our food came out, after of course watching the 2 booths of food pass us by. Appetizer came out with dinner and 1 person in our party, never got his burger. They brought out a philly steak sandwich as his order, which was wrong. By this time, we were there there for 90 mins and had to leave to go to our show. Took 15 minutes for the manager to voice our opinions, who then had the nerve to offer gift cards. Um, no thanks, will NEVER go back!

gVwZKKXXqVsqa6BdzA-XAw.text: Can't say enough good things about the few food items I've had hear. Appetizer: definitely go with the chicken nachos. HUGE (easily share between 4+ people) and great taste/toppings. My absolute favorite entree is the Lobster & Shrimp Enchiladas. I'm not a fan of black beans, so I sub out the black beans for Mac & Cheese. I consider myself a connoisseur of mac'n cheese ... and this is definitely top 5 of any restaurant I've been too.  Do yourself a favor and stop in here!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fish tacos off of their food truck menu... Very small. Not recommended for those with a big appetite.
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black bean taqueria things off of their food truck menu --- a little over cooked and burnt on the ends.
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster and shrimp enchiladas. A must try for seafood lovers.

IK-aKW7wxMRmiteffVDSFQ.text: Does Rock Bottom have the best beer in town...no. But is it good beer...absolutely! Thursday nights their beers are $3! There are other beer specials on the weeknights also. The service can be lacking in the bar area, unless you are actually sitting at the bar, which is typically exceptional.  Food is quite good! Grilled fish tacos are a recommendation ads well as the veggie burger. Just a couple of recommendations but plenty more to choose from! Friendly staff!

Y5lutjthmkIEe22cPd8CKA.text: Brought some friends to this place last week. It was also my first time.   The drinks weren't that great. We ordered sangria margaritas, a Cosmo, and a mojito and none of us were pleased.   We ordered the crab dip which was amazing.   Our meals were like frozen dinners that just came out of the microwave.  I asked for my steak rare, it came out well done. My sides didn't come out till I was almost done with my meal. I got rice and it wasn't cooked...  Just very disappointed in this place because the restaurant itself is nice and the service was decent

353RpFfFmpL8g576Q0vZSA.text: went to lunch with a group from work yesterday.  Most of us had the Primavera Pasta which is soooo tasty.  Fettuccine with lots of veggies in a great sauce.  It was on their specials menu.  But, I hope they move it to their permanent menu.  They didn't have our table setup when we arrived - even though we made reservations.  So, we had to wait.  But, they made up for it with three free appetizers for nine of us.  Waiter and manager were fantastic.

8xAH77huisWbpcjJRJIvdg.text: First time here , only thing nice about this place is the location. The food from the frozen baked wings , bland Mac and cheese , tasteless stuffed brisket burger , and let's not forget the pepperoni pizza that Sam's food club can do better . This has to be the worse bar food for game watching in Charlotte, NC .

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pepporoni pizza , omg.You can get a frozen one from supermarket that taste 10times better.
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Stuffed brisket burger with gouda cheese , and mac &amp; cheese . I&#39;ve had better burgers at steak and shake :(

EDS2SdJQd-FV7fz5_sZk4g.text: Their beer is just "ok". I tried the amber ale, kolsch, and white ale. Is recommend getting the white ale.   As far as service, we wenton a Saturday night and the place was packed. Hostess said it was a 40 minute wait, which ended up being an hour... Our server was nice. Although, not knowledgable about the beer when we had basic questions.  Boyfriend got a burger and said it was ok. You have to order sides separately here (absolutely hate that). The side order of fries was so small. I mean give me a break. I split the BBQ pizza with a friend and we enjoyed it. Great flavors and the fried onions on top have it a nice crunch. Also, I would highly recommend getting a side of the mac n cheese. Request adding bacon jam.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mac n cheese side
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Brisket flatbread

suD0Retg6apB5i4IIEZJbg.text: Beer - Many choices and micro-brews (I dont drink beer, but if you do, there is lots here) Salads - Meh Burgers - Good Wine - Meh Coffee - Meh Soup - So/so Tex-Mexish dishes - were actually ok Stuffed bell peppers - actually quite good  This isn't my kind of place, but we stop in for lunch now and then because it's downstairs from where we work. When you walk by outside, the smell of the brewing is so strong!  I say A-OK, because it's not my style, but it is a good micro-brewery with burgers, fries etc. The stuff you expect. Lots of seating and service is A-Ok. They have a nice patio as well.

rATmtON8UOmZ6ZbKVHHnxA.text: Ok another one with as many check-ins I have for this place that should be my review. If this was Boston than Rock Bottom would be my Cheers. What can I say about this place. Lets start with drinks.  The beer is made in house. I love the beer the current brew master has been doing a great job. I look forward to tapping part of the new brews he has made. The Bartends are freaking awesome and very cute(always a plus at a bar). They are super friendly and makes the best drinks in the world.    Food is awesome. I love the apps and whatever season menu item they come up with. This summer they had a luau with a pig roast. I was great. My favorite item off the menu is the steak cooked texas fire style. Trust me when you smell it you will want it. The salad are really great especially if you are on a diet.   So to sum it up great drinks, great food, awesome and cute staff. Why are you not there now?

rq8oXG5lSj0m_Li4yArnnQ.text: Was in with a party of 10 and walked out after waiting for 25mins just to place a food order.  Figured we didn't want to risk a long wait for the food. Nobody tried to even convince us to stay. 2nd time service was extremely slow.   Seems to be a pattern.   Went across the street to Duckworth's who took great care of us.

rfasS6KNXII3D_EIZ_fE5Q.text: We didn't order a meal here, this review is just for the bar and an appetizer.  Never having had any Rock Bottom brews before (they don't have any in our state), we started with a flight of the basics and then ordered pints of a couple of others. We didn't have a single bad beer out of all of them. Granted, not all of them were amazing, but they were all at least good.  We ordered the soft pretzel appetizer, which really hit the spot. It came with two huge pretzels and a delicious dip. If you're a fan of soft pretzels, you'll want to get this.  The bartender was really friendly, talking to us at length about Charlotte and his previous residence Greenville (both places that we are considering for a future move), and we really appreciated the time he took to chat with us.  It may be a chain brewery, but the beer here was a fair sight better than at least one or two of the local breweries we visited during this tour of the Carolinas, so that says something!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

q0cPZm1Mqf3sNyhlR4PBnA.text: Had the pepperoni pizza tonight.  I realize this not an Italian place, but, anyone can do a good pizza if they really want to.    Online menu said "pepperoni, pepperoni, pepperoni".  It had a typical single serving of pepperoni.  Pepperoni was almost tasteless.  Cheese was totally tasteless, could not even tell it was there.  Low quality pepperoni and cheese.  Sauce is just ok, but, very light on sauce. Ragu pizza quick sauce is tastier.  The crust was the "brick oven style" burnt crust. Or it was just burnt. Now, I don't mind a brick oven crust, but, your toppings have to be able to hold their own against the dry, powdery, charcoal taste of the crust.  Here, it was all burnt crust taste.    If you want something to munch while drinking, this may work. For a dedicated dinner food, you may be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Underside of crust.
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pepperoni pizza

bj1qfZcgMMcbwErCTVOhsg.text: These burgers were all ordered medium. One is pretty much completely raw. Everything else we had was just okay. Drink specials are nice, but would not recommend the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

pqJGQYLXGQzTjhQdGgidGw.text: Came to this place two years ago and loved it- couldn't wait to go back. Went back on Friday evening and had an awful experience. After we were seated, no one approached us for a good five minutes. Finally, a nice man took our drink order and told us that our waitress, Jessica, was busy but she would be there to take our order in a minute. After 10 minutes, Jessica finally came. Her "greeting" to us was, "Do you guys know what you'd like?" Placed our order and didn't see Jessica again for the rest of the night until we were ready for the check. No re-fills, no checking up on us, nothing. Also, I was brought the wrong entree, but it's not like Jessica was around for me to tell. Terrible experience.

4Zc6NzcYUB193sqzzS49GA.text: I met a couple of girlfriends here for dinner and drinks on Friday evening. Parking was easy because the restaurant is attracted to a parking garage and...yes! They do validate parking.   We started in the bar area, which was pretty crowded. We were hoping to grab a table but quickly found out they take reservations at those tables so we were moved to the main dining area once everyone arrived.   The bartenders were awesome! With so many beers on tap, I had no clue which to try first! So she let me sample some of her favorites and I found that the Kolsch was a winner!! It was light and refreshing and a perfect compliment to our appetizers.   We ordered the Brewery chicken nachos and Southwest egg rolls, both were delicious! The nachos come with an entire dish of freshly made salsa and the they load you up on the toppings: cheese, sour cream,black beans, chicken, onions, jalapenos and guacamole. The egg rolls are deep fried and stuffed with chicken, beans, red peppers, zucchini, tomatoes, corn and pepper jack cheese! Yum.   For dinner I went with the Southwest Turkey burger. The turkey burger is mixed with peppers and onions which adds a really nice flavor to the meat! They then top it with lettuce tomato, avocado mayo, fried peppers, sliced avocado and pepper jack cheese. I really enjoyed it! The fries weren't my favorite...they were shoe string cut and a bit too crunchy but at least they came out hot!   All in all, I'd definitely return and recommend a visit to anyone!

jp4jwGvDBVS6pkb9IZ0TLg.text: Service was absolutely terrible. Steak sent to table well done when told medium rare.....this caused our guest to eat alone for everyone else had finished while waiting for re-do. Waitress would ask if we wanted another drink, we said yes and told her what we wanted. 10 minutes later she came back and said do we want drinks!!! We politely said you took our order 10 minutes ago. This happened twice by same server!!! Salad dressing was so thick that it was extremely difficult to add to salad......the server said it was mayonnaise based balsamic vinegarette. It should not be pudding consistency Rock Bottom :( Just noticed this place has drastically gone down hill over the past few years. I never write a review but this evening was so bad for our out of town guests.......

xLLL34INzxSUq5CNOeHEFw.text: Great place for after work happy hour. Want to say thanks to Maggie for always giving us great service every time we come out. Tryin to lobby to change the name of hop goddess to hop Maggie bc she's so cool.  Also want to thank Germaine for being such a great cook and all around cool guy

MetzXNFlO7P4KLATsErB2Q.text: We came with a group of 10...the service was friendly but very slow. Our food came out very staggered, about a 15 minute process. We had to ask for all the basic things, silverware, refills, condiments, ext. we had an event we were going to and had to cut out dessert because it was so slow. We allotted 2 hours for dinner and still had to leave the table to find our server for our check. Several times food runners came by our table with large trays that came inches away from our heads( we were at a high top table) and did not say anything...someone from our party would have to yell, " don't move". It had been years since we have been and may be years again...

DhflYAnb9atpemB8oJ4tDA.text: We went for our anniversary dinner. The food was great. There chicken and Mac and cheese is a classic and everyone should try it.   Service was typical and we had no problems at all while we were there.   This doesn't strike you as your normal brewery that you would find around Charlotte because it's a part of a chain. We tried a flight of their beers and weren't disappointed but it's not a place we will go back to just for the beer.   The location right downtown is very nice however.

A6egyyJzsmNoq_ThVFWzMQ.text: I wouldn't recommend coming here for business lunches.... especially if you only have an hour. It took way to long to take our order and even longer to get our food.  By the time it came, one person had to immediately get a to go box and the rest of us had 15 minutes to eat.   They were not very busy but I saw the manager busing tables. Grilled chicken was tasteless and fried peppers on my salad were stone cold.

FG97T6NsyvdUU2fQkYiRxA.text: I always love Rock Bottom....They have great appetizers and their lobster and shrimp tacos are superb. The prices are extremely reasonable...you can order 2 appetizers...2 drinks and a entree for under $40 bucks

JgOO3B4yZ59fwoxfGQRd2w.text: Just like all the other posts suggest.... food and beer is good- the service is god awful.

Ope1CUT1DZz22_JSqUT1pw.text: The mac n cheese crocks are awesome.  I suggest a beer flight to find your preference.

roG9FhGrcb0SNVBEEi0oFw.text: Pretty bad. Don't waste your time or money. Worst of all it's really not clean. Beer was good, but that's about it.

wW37YSuHiCrgv9vU5viLyQ.text: I come here every time I'm in uptown. Friendly service, great atmosphere, and the food is fantastic. Lest we forget the beer. The beer is flavorful and bold. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.

drJLScnnqByOy3l2rO_84g.text: I've always loved this place but after the reno it just became my absolute favorite. It is classy and fancy, the decor and layout are on point, service has always been satisfying, prices are great, food is even better and their beers are worth trying. I keep coming back to this place with family or friends. Never had a bad experience. Please open more locations in NC or SC

vKTauR_SfbQh-rXhiEmzPw.text: I selected Rock Bottom for my birthday luncheon. Great choice among my party! We started with cocktails, the pomegranate "holiday" mule was a hit. Light sweetness and a nice kick from the ginger beer. My party of 16 had very different eating habits and the menu here was a hit! I had the Maker's Mark Bourbonzola burger (added bacon....mmmmm, bacon) with a side of fries. The burger was a decent size and tasty add it was topped with gorgonzola cheese and onion straws. The sauce was interesting...i used it as dip fur my fries. Since it was my birthday, I had a choice of a desert! (winning) I selected the sales carmel cheesecake and boy is it good!!

J28r8P_Q1oicYJmld7P-Aw.text: My family and I went here yesterday. It was quite an experience. The food in the drinks and everything we're good and the manager was very nice. They had some problems with not having the pretzel sticks so they comped us an appetizer and our waiter got my husband and his cousins order wrong they comped us that meal. We would definitely go here again everybody was real nice and the waiter although he was new we were the best group to learn from because we're very patient people we were there for about two and a half hours. I would recommend this restaurant to anybody we don't have one near us where in South Carolina.

edZqMsUGJg7vAyX-vpL5Hw.text: Decided to stop in here for lunch on our vacation after going to Discovery Place.The hostess greeted us with a smile and sat us down. The Waiter came over promptly and informed us that he would be with us in a moment.  He came over and brought us our drinks and was very friendly about suggestions for the menu (even though I took a while). My wife got the Mac n' Chicken, per his recommendation, while I had the Cajun Fish Tacos.   Right off the bat just looking at the food was presented very nicely and prefessionally.  The taste of the Mac n' Chicken was so flavorful. It was the perfect amount of creaminess, and the breadcrumb crust added a nice bit of texture to it. The chicken was perfectly juicy and seasoned well.  The Cajun Fish Tacos were perfectly flaky and seasoned to perfection with a sauce that was to die for, while the black beans and rice complimented it perfectly.  Our server Edmund was very friendly and promptly refilled our drinks whenever they were low, as well as checking on us to make sure our food was ok or if we needed anything from time to time.   Overall this was a wonderful hole in the wall with amazing food and a friendly, casual atmosphere. It really topped off our visit to Charlotte and definitely makes me and my wife want to come back

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fantastic Mac n&#39; Chicken
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Best Cajun Fish Tacos

vXgV3g3IZXiV4vct8KMbwg.text: Pretty good food, service is alright - very cookie cutter style of restaurant, but they do brew beer... just like many of their other locations around the nation.   Beer is good though!

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pasta
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States

QxFkucbOQjAzhCXILIa6Sg.text: Came here with a party of 5 and was seated promptly upon arriving. The waitress was efficient for the most part, she didn't let our cups get empty. The cups weren't the most clean though and at one point we were trying to find the waitress for several minutes but she was apparently busy. It was one of my friends' birthday so we needed to discreetly order him a birthday slice of cake while he was in the restroom. No biggie overall. I'd definitely come back for the food and the atmosphere. Would've given 4 stars but the not so clean cups took it down to a 3.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Happy birthday Mike!
Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cajun pasta with chicken,  shrimp,  and andouille sausage..... delicious!

sQxdfXGFn-4fQsZm-HINFg.text: We came here on a Friday night for dinner before & it was great, got the bacon Mac & cheese & it was delicious!  We came again this past Saturday for lunch & I guess they do not care about the staff that works there during this time! Our service was horrible, our appetizer never came out BEFORE our meal! We got our macaroni & it was so cold we could not even eat it! We sent it back, asked if we could atleast go ahead & get our appetizer while we were waiting on our new plates to come out (which by the way we never send food back, but this was just too cold to eat) Well.., our new plates came out instead of our appetizer which was fine... About 15 min later (almost done with our lunch) she brings our appetizer out!! We were like umm we don't really need this anymore she said "sorry our chef already made it" ......... my mom ate a few bites of it which was fine but it was still on our bill which was pretty ridiculous, a manager never came & apologized for the cold food which is pretty standard at most places. Don't know, overall this place is kind of a joke for service/food   Too many other restaurants in Charlotte to need to go back here

uF4A6JbrCzBYWIidUYUlaw.text: We had been to RBB before, so we were expecting bar food and a really casual atmosphere. Well, apparently they have remodeled in the last year or so, and now have a nice modern ambiance.   The menu was not at all what I remembered, and that was a plus. I ordered the Chicken-fried-chicken, and my husband had the Classic Mac'n Chicken. Let me just say, it was the best chicken fried chicken I've ever had. The meat was so light and delicious! The mashed  potatoes were good, but nothing to write about. His Mac'n "roasted" Chicken was perfect. He loved every bite of it. The portion looked small, but ended up being just enough to fill him up.   We were there on a Saturday for lunch. Surprisingly there were quit a few families there with small, very small children. There was ample seating all over the restaurant, but the hostess sat us right beside a high-chair, with a whinny baby in it. Of course, I immediately asked to be moved and they accommodated us with no problem. Later more small children came in, and of course the hostess sat the kids right near us rather than near the other children.   My advice for all hostess is to sit children near other children and couples near other couples. It makes for a much better meal.

rOhETIxLX2QRCC0iTK0RIg.text: I have come to this brewery twice now. It is a convenient place to drop by uptown that is affordable and has a decent microbrew feel. There is a happy hour from 4-6:30, and they have a beer on special every day. I had the seasonal beer offered in the fall, Rocktoberfest and it was delicious! The food is equitable to an Applebee's so nothing fantastic there. I would agree with the previous reviews that state this is "nothing special".

e2bB4zRz6WeHb9CbGi3qxg.text: Enjoyed the food. I had the lower calorie beer chicken. The glaze was amazing! The salad with kale had less kale and more coleslaw. I was a little disappointed but the dish itself was yummy. Got pretzel appetizers which were filling and enough to share! Enjoyed the environment outside in the city. The service was a little slow but all in all good casual dinner.

zIhWr_ULLBYxFZzl3_v1Aw.text: I came out to watch the Hornets game during Game 6 of the 2016 NBA Finals. Despite there being a crowd, service did not suffer and our waiter was quick and attentive. I wasn't particularly hungry and ordered the Mexican Street Tacos. They were tiny - with a speck of fish, regular old hot sauce, and some slaw. They were disappointing to say the least and if I were being a diva, I would've sent them back. I would discourage anyone from ordering these disappointing mini flavorless tacos. My friend ordered chips and guacamole. It was served in a tiny bowl that you would see in an elementary cafeteria for your sides. NOT what you would expect for an appetizer. It was the size you would expect if you ordered guacamole on something else. I'll give this place another shot later, but the food needs to get up to par with the restaurant's cool atmosphere and service.

VpjEaL16IHTAXf0TS5DgDw.text: During a visit to the queen city, I came across Rock Bottom when looking for a place to watch college football on a Saturday afternoon. I sat at the bar and was greeted by an excellent bar tender (whose name I cannot recall) and she walked me through the beer selections for the day. I think I'm getting old, because I can't remember what beer I ordered with my meal. I do remember that whatever it was it went well with my baby brats (I think there were an Oktoberfest menu item) and ahi tuna salad. Both dishes were very good and I'm definitely ordering the brats again when I visit the restaurant on another occasion.

MWK_wOwbB2iY2ib2uhXRug.text: Good service and great food. Only draw back was no fault of restaurant. We were seated next to some screaming children. But the restaurant found us better seating.

T-K6q41Tnb0Ms6ZnUNJ-8A.text: 3.5 stars.  Nothing special, but everything was fairly well done.  Went for a lunch meeting and had the southwest salad.  The jalapeno ranch was made in house and was great.  The baguette on the side was a nice touch.  Service was perfect: attentive but not hovering.  We were able to get in and out quickly.  Other diner thought the ahi tuna salad was good as well.  Tuna was perfectly done and contained a good sized lunch portion.  Other meals (chicken avocado sandwich and bacon cheeseburger) looked uninteresting.

SOErS9pgZxxyfGu3BS3-uw.text: This place was great! Their menu is HUGE - which can be a good and bad thing. Good if you know what you want. Bad if you're totally indecisive like me. =) There is such a big variety, you will definitely find something you like and if you don't you're not human. Luckily, I had a friend recommend the fish tacos so I went with that. It was a hard taco wrapped in a soft taco with melted pepper jack cheese, and all the regular taco garnishes. Was fantastic. A little on the spicy side for me, but I'm truly a baby when it comes to that so don't go by my spicy judgment. Also, I want to add that the server was extremely nice by letting me only get the tacos. I didn't want the extra rice & beans so she took a couple dollars of the meal price and just gave me the tacos.   Obviously Rock Bottom is known for their beers and they definitely had a great selection to offer. I tried a few =) but ended up really liking the Brown Ale the best.   They were packed when we went but we didn't have to wait too long for our food and our service was on point! Clean place too.   Would definitely hit up this place if I'm ever back in Charlotte again. =) Go try it!.

W2WPkrJ0bV9hLCQtcqDBkg.text: Food was good, a bit overpriced for the quality / selection. They have a make your own pizza for the kids which is great and provides some entertainment. I recommend ordering it first thing though bc it does delay the rest of the order while they make it. Would go back but would like to try some non-chains in the area too. Very close to discovery place which was nice as we only had to walk a block for lunch.

pj08ZkdSyQaO3eqgTDT_XQ.text: A cool place to hang out in downtown. The food.is very good. You cannot go wrong with the fish and chips. I enjoy the beer. Most of beers are brewed on site. The only problem is the staff turns over very quickly. Parking is free if you park in the deck under the restaurant. Make sure yo ger your ticket validated. Sign up for the rewards card. It is not nearly as good as the previous perks card, but it can be uses nationally.

007_ksfYlE87thLX8S2mEA.text: So I ate here for lunch & it was my 1st trip to the place. If you are to head here, it seems better suited to be a dinner or late night visit.  First off, this place encompasses half a city block...well not really, but it is pretty huge. We decided to sit outside on the patio, but the inside looked huge, with a large bar, 2 pool tables, & several seating areas. The place wasn't too packed, but it was after the lunch crowd hour so I'm sure we caught it at a light time.  As for the menu, while very good, it's just a little heavy for a lunch menu. Maybe I ordered something a little too filling, but from what I saw on the menu, everything was more suited to the dinner crowd. If they had lunch portions, then I think this could make it a little better place to grab lunch. The food was great though & I'd definitely consider going back for dinner next time.  The one thing I regret not doing was ordering one of their beers. I've heard how good some of them are & was planning on ordering a pint, but my meal was too filiing & I couldn't see myself downing anything else.  I'll be back for dinner here next time, & remember to order my beer before I eat my meal.

PwqaO8KlDAmNfBYM8ALUiw.text: We walked downtown and got dinner here. I ordered enchiladas and while they tasted good, I was disappointed by the size. My girlfriend got some time of Cajun pasta that tasted good and was much more appropriately sized.

deWHUwRtPoP8jEaAIUTHTA.text: You definitely don't want for choices with the Rock Bottom menu.  They cover all sorts of ground in the American/Tex-Mex/Americanized Ethnic food types.  But of course, most places with big menus have lots of food that is between pretty good and pretty mediocre.  I had an okay bowl of chili, my guest had a chicken pot pie  that she did not care for.  Burgers and sandwiches are solid.  We all loved the excellent, addictive fries: they're the thin snacky types full of potatoey flavor. Oh man and I tried the seasonal beer - a bock - which was a pretty good deal.  We figured that it was 25% more beer than the standard serving but at only 12.5% higher cost.  Anyway the brew was a knockout.  Don't drink it on an empty stomach, but do drink it.

na9cQlIlUTshDE0pT2Euhg.text: Visiting from out of town we happen to walk upon this place. The food was good and the service was great. The menu itself has a lot for everyone. We did sample the beer it was good just a bit warm for my taste.

22tMxS480k8ME4XJLnQx5A.text: My Husband and I took my son out for dinner and we all LOVED it!  My husband had the bacon mac and cheese. He said it was the best he had ever eaten!  My son at the veggie tacos and also loved them.  I had one of there salads and was very happy with what I received.  Our server went out of his way to make sure everything was the way we wanted it.  Looking forward to going back soon!

4DcJim1mBg0K-1Pjs7v6Hg.text: First Yelp post ever...service was so bad I felt inclined to do it. Fiance ordered bison burger and ended up getting a 2am with egg, etc. I had garden salad which was good however my Mac n'Chicken had absolutely no roasted chicken in it whatsoever. Apparently it's supposed to be "loaded" with roasted chicken. Informed manager and he brought us what we initially ordered but the Mac and cheese with roasted chicken was swimming in grease and oil. Fiance ended up with a bison burger that looked like a slider on a regular sized bun. Bun was also cold like just out of the refrigerator. Sent that back too. Manager apologized and offered us another beer, we asked for the meal to be comped. When server asked us how our final meal was once my fiance got a normal sized burger I asked if there was supposed to be that much grease in the Mac and cheese and all she said with a shrug of the shoulders was, "I think so." Unacceptable. When she came back with the check she ran off with the Mac and cheese not even asking if I wanted it boxed. Food was comped but drinks still on check. After waiting 10 minutes we had to bring the check in to pay; fiance ended up asking for the manager to let him know what happened after he brought us the corrected meals. The first thing out of his mouth was "it's her." He was asked by the manager not to post anything on Yelp but I promised nothing. Let's hope the manager can move this place in to a more professional establishment.

lCuwNQlCXtsshjAQJs39qA.text: Ate here on a Saturday night for a friend's birthday. We had a party of approx. 10 people. We were seated in the back corner and given plenty of space for our party which was nice, considering it was primetime on a Saturday night.  That was pretty much when the good things I have to say about the restaurant end. Our server, from beginning to end, was slow. I would post his name, but I don't know if that's against Yelp rules. I ordered a honey dijon chicken sandwich with french fries. The fries were mediocre at best (not hot, plain tasting) and the sandwich was pretty poor. I don't know how you can screw up grilled chicken, cheese, bacon and honey dijon sauce. The bottom of the bun was completely soggy and the sandwich as a whole was bland. Our guest of honor (the birthday girl) ordered a steak which she had to return because it was almost raw inside. She had asked for medium well. Several members of our group DID, however, like their food.  Going back to the service, several members of our party waited several minutes for drink refills. Also, we had to flag our waiter down for our checks after waiting close to (if not more than) 20 minutes. Even after we gave him our checks and credit cards, he took close to another 10 minutes to bring them back.   Our best guess is that he knew he was adding an 18% gratuity to our checks because of our party size, so he took his time doing everything. I seriously considered crossing out the 18% and leaving 10% and noting on the tab that the service didn't warrant the 18%, but in the end, I opted against it.  Definitely will not return.

g640kx6qDe9awGtVN3jPaw.text: The waitress was awesome. Thanks Victory for telling us your secrets. Rock bottom is a really good chain. the difference is in the service when visiting one of these places.

jAxH57g4Uw1LcA6HBZ7qpQ.text: Beer! Free parking! Great place to have some good brew. Great bar food.

photos.caption: Photo of Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery - Charlotte, NC, United States. $5 Martinis. Every Wed!

T6ZZYLswgusAZeaY4HggPA.text: Hearty and nice portions. I like to eat here and sit outside in the summer.

LCNik_59DG1Ta3vPBkOo-w.text: Love the patio here, if it's nice out and you are a big fan of people watching (like me), then it's about as good as it gets.  The bar area is nice as well and spacious which is something sometimes overlooked by other establishments.  Give me room to drink and socialize!  Anyway, I've been here on multiple locations both dinner and lunches and never been disappointed at all.  They have a great selection of food (online menu is available), from shrimp and grits, to great sandwich's, steaks and seafood.    I will also tell you the service has never been bad, for me at least.  Always prompt and never lacking.   Bottom line for Rock Bottom is......you can't go wrong here!

-Y4WxoES2_I_c8yN15-iag.text: The staff was very friendly and prompt, but the food is clearly made in some massive off site kitchen and then frozen and shipped (unfortunately, most restaurants are doing this nowadays). This is basically a glorified Applebees, but if you need a place to get a beer and some simple appetizers, or if you love fat and salt, a good bet. They do have a good beer selection and sitting at the bar can be interesting, but every bar is interesting.

mKBSfb5I4fKvR-MsHu6TfQ.text: They've remodeled the inside of the restaurant and it looks great! The beer is great and the service really good. The food is overpriced. It's good food, but not worth the $$. I'd prefer to grab a beer here and eat somewhere else uptown for the money.

sKR0qzq8TWrd_J_Wt8Z5HA.text: I have sat at the bar, house red ale, jambalaya, big chunks of chicken, shrimp, and sausage, great spicy. I have had the pulled pork with the white ale. I have had the fish tacos. I have been back over and over and over. I have a colleague who eats here 3 or 4 times a week. This place is winner winner chicken dinner.

qkL-bUIUkDrxPSkDhlL9_w.text: I visited Charlotte and decided to go here, cause it was crowded. The wait was 35-50 minutes. I really didn't know what to choose --- so i end up ordering Beer Battered Fish and Chips (os os) and the ribs and chicken combo w/ fries (os os). There was nothing really special about the food. Charlotte doesn't have much to offer when it comes to food =P

0bzTv7L4QYaFVUzOzGUszQ.text: I'd have to say it was no where near an awesome experience. We tried to order a pitcher of the IPA and the waitress stops us and is like do you like IPAS? do you know what your ordering? i was like yes i like IPAS im capable of ordering a beer like a grown up. maybe next time be like hey our ipa is exceptionally hoppy compared to other ipas, is that alright for you? After finally ordering a pitcher of beer (there were six of us, so four of us had one beer) the waitress tells us that it is such a high gravity, she says 9% that if any of us have more than three she'll have to start figuring out who the DD is and maybe cut people off. Not only was it an uncomfortable comment, but we looked back at the menu and the beer was only 5.7%. Needless to say none of us wanted to order another round of drinks. Then when the waitress brought out our chili, she told us that the green onions looked nasty and she didn't feel comfortable serving them. I was kind of grossed out by that point. Couldn't you have just lied to me and told me you were out? I don't wanna hear about nasty things in the kitchen, it made me really not want to eat. Luckily the food was good, however the service was reason enough not to return.

XDn0hhLSD_ugrJbEKfWf7Q.text: Our first time visit today. Food was very good and service was great. !

I-D087y62MiUjQwcquPuyg.text: first off, me and my wife went here many times since moving to charyork [since everybody here is from nyc!!!]lol.  the fist two times the food was great! let me recomend the spicy nachos!!! omg! the best! in charlotte! and the shrimp and grits! southern perfection! but the 3rd times the charm! were in the hell did they get there waiter staff from the circus! these guys and gals have no sense of whats going onin the kitchen. if better give your waiter or waitess step by step directions on our food! but for the money and qulity of food rock bottom gets passed on the chop block!

pL8uGGyuoHw8WpoKMb4eJA.text: I recently visited Charlotte this past weekend for the race and needed a casual good food experience. I reviewed Yelp but most of the Downtown spots were noted as dressy or trendy attire establishments. From a 5 hour ride most of us were just comfortable in jeans and tees so nothing to dapper. The concierge at the hotel recommended the Rock Bottom so we gave it a shot. The place was excellent with its open air styling and the drinks were on spot. We ordered the southwest eggrolls as a app and started to order another plate of them and then we remembered we had more food coming! They were that good. I ordered the 14 Ribye with bourbonzola topping. Couldnt have been a more delicious and tender piece of meat. . The seaon veggies and chedder mash were no second. Everything on my plate could not have been anybetter. Check it out . It was worth the visit. And the house brews seemed to hit the spot with the guys that were with me.
